137// Base class for shell ArrayBuffer allocators. It forwards all operations to
138// the default v8 allocator.
139class ArrayBufferAllocatorBase : public v8::ArrayBuffer::Allocator {
140 public:
141 void* Allocate(size_t length) override {
142 return allocator_->Allocate(length);
143 }
144
145 void* AllocateUninitialized(size_t length) override {
146 return allocator_->AllocateUninitialized(length);
147 }
148
149 void Free(void* data, size_t length) override {
150 allocator_->Free(data, length);
151 }
152
153 private:
154 std::unique_ptr<Allocator> allocator_ =
155 std::unique_ptr<Allocator>(NewDefaultAllocator());
156};
157
158// ArrayBuffer allocator that can use virtual memory to improve performance.
159class ShellArrayBufferAllocator : public ArrayBufferAllocatorBase {
160 public:
161 void* Allocate(size_t length) override {
162 if (length >= kVMThreshold) return AllocateVM(length);
163 return ArrayBufferAllocatorBase::Allocate(length);
164 }
165
166 void* AllocateUninitialized(size_t length) override {
167 if (length >= kVMThreshold) return AllocateVM(length);
168 return ArrayBufferAllocatorBase::AllocateUninitialized(length);
169 }
170
171 void Free(void* data, size_t length) override {
172 if (length >= kVMThreshold) {
173 FreeVM(data, length);
174 } else {
175 ArrayBufferAllocatorBase::Free(data, length);
176 }
177 }
178
179 private:
180 static constexpr size_t kVMThreshold = 65536;
181
182 void* AllocateVM(size_t length) {
183 DCHECK_LE(kVMThreshold, length);
184 v8::PageAllocator* page_allocator = i::GetArrayBufferPageAllocator();
185 size_t page_size = page_allocator->AllocatePageSize();
186 size_t allocated = RoundUp(length, page_size);
187 return i::AllocatePages(page_allocator, nullptr, allocated, page_size,
188 PageAllocator::kReadWrite);
189 }
190
191 void FreeVM(void* data, size_t length) {
192 v8::PageAllocator* page_allocator = i::GetArrayBufferPageAllocator();
193 size_t page_size = page_allocator->AllocatePageSize();
194 size_t allocated = RoundUp(length, page_size);
195 i::FreePages(page_allocator, data, allocated);
196 }
197};
198
199// ArrayBuffer allocator that never allocates over 10MB.
200class MockArrayBufferAllocator : public ArrayBufferAllocatorBase {
201 protected:
202 void* Allocate(size_t length) override {
203 return ArrayBufferAllocatorBase::Allocate(Adjust(length));
204 }
205
206 void* AllocateUninitialized(size_t length) override {
207 return ArrayBufferAllocatorBase::AllocateUninitialized(Adjust(length));
208 }
209
210 void Free(void* data, size_t length) override {
211 return ArrayBufferAllocatorBase::Free(data, Adjust(length));
212 }
213
214 private:
215 size_t Adjust(size_t length) {
216 const size_t kAllocationLimit = 10 * i::MB;
217 return length > kAllocationLimit ? i::AllocatePageSize() : length;
218 }
219};
220
221// ArrayBuffer allocator that can be equipped with a limit to simulate system
222// OOM.
223class MockArrayBufferAllocatiorWithLimit : public MockArrayBufferAllocator {
224 public:
225 explicit MockArrayBufferAllocatiorWithLimit(size_t allocation_limit)
226 : space_left_(allocation_limit) {}
227
228 protected:
229 void* Allocate(size_t length) override {
230 if (length > space_left_) {
231 return nullptr;
232 }
233 space_left_ -= length;
234 return MockArrayBufferAllocator::Allocate(length);
235 }
236
237 void* AllocateUninitialized(size_t length) override {
238 if (length > space_left_) {
239 return nullptr;
240 }
241 space_left_ -= length;
242 return MockArrayBufferAllocator::AllocateUninitialized(length);
243 }
244
245 void Free(void* data, size_t length) override {
246 space_left_ += length;
247 return MockArrayBufferAllocator::Free(data, length);
248 }
249
250 private:
251 std::atomic<size_t> space_left_;
252};
253
254#ifdef V8_OS_LINUX
255
256// This is a mock allocator variant that provides a huge virtual allocation
257// backed by a small real allocation that is repeatedly mapped. If you create an
258// array on memory allocated by this allocator, you will observe that elements
259// will alias each other as if their indices were modulo-divided by the real
260// allocation length.
261// The purpose is to allow stability-testing of huge (typed) arrays without
262// actually consuming huge amounts of physical memory.
263// This is currently only available on Linux because it relies on {mremap}.
264class MultiMappedAllocator : public ArrayBufferAllocatorBase {
265 protected:
266 void* Allocate(size_t length) override {
267 if (length < kChunkSize) {
268 return ArrayBufferAllocatorBase::Allocate(length);
269 }
270 // We use mmap, which initializes pages to zero anyway.
271 return AllocateUninitialized(length);
272 }
273
274 void* AllocateUninitialized(size_t length) override {
275 if (length < kChunkSize) {
276 return ArrayBufferAllocatorBase::AllocateUninitialized(length);
277 }
278 size_t rounded_length = RoundUp(length, kChunkSize);
279 int prot = PROT_READ | PROT_WRITE;
280 // We have to specify MAP_SHARED to make {mremap} below do what we want.
281 int flags = MAP_SHARED | MAP_ANONYMOUS;
282 void* real_alloc = mmap(nullptr, kChunkSize, prot, flags, -1, 0);
283 if (reinterpret_cast<intptr_t>(real_alloc) == -1) {
284 // If we ran into some limit (physical or virtual memory, or number
285 // of mappings, etc), return {nullptr}, which callers can handle.
286 if (errno == ENOMEM) {
287 return nullptr;
288 }
289 // Other errors may be bugs which we want to learn about.
290 FATAL("mmap (real) failed with error %d: %s", errno, strerror(errno));
291 }
292#ifdef V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
293 // The backing memory must be allocated inside the sandbox as it will be
294 // used for array buffer contents.
295 // Here we go into somewhat less-well-defined territory by using the
296 // sandbox's virtual address space to essentially just reserve a number of
297 // OS pages inside the sandbox, but then using mremap to replace these
298 // pages directly afterwards. In practice, this works fine however.
299 VirtualAddressSpace* vas = i::GetProcessWideSandbox()->address_space();
300 i::Address in_sandbox_page_reservation = vas->AllocatePages(
301 VirtualAddressSpace::kNoHint, rounded_length,
302 vas->allocation_granularity(), PagePermissions::kNoAccess);
303 void* virtual_alloc =
304 in_sandbox_page_reservation != 0
305 ? reinterpret_cast<void*>(in_sandbox_page_reservation)
306 : reinterpret_cast<void*>(-1);
307#else
308 void* virtual_alloc =
309 mmap(nullptr, rounded_length, prot, flags | MAP_NORESERVE, -1, 0);
310#endif
311 if (reinterpret_cast<intptr_t>(virtual_alloc) == -1) {
312 if (errno == ENOMEM) {
313 // Undo earlier, successful mappings.
314 munmap(real_alloc, kChunkSize);
315 return nullptr;
316 }
317 FATAL("mmap (virtual) failed with error %d: %s", errno, strerror(errno));
318 }
319 i::Address virtual_base = reinterpret_cast<i::Address>(virtual_alloc);
320 i::Address virtual_end = virtual_base + rounded_length;
321 for (i::Address to_map = virtual_base; to_map < virtual_end;
322 to_map += kChunkSize) {
323 // Specifying 0 as the "old size" causes the existing map entry to not
324 // get deleted, which is important so that we can remap it again in the
325 // next iteration of this loop.
326 void* result =
327 mremap(real_alloc, 0, kChunkSize, MREMAP_MAYMOVE | MREMAP_FIXED,
328 reinterpret_cast<void*>(to_map));
329 if (reinterpret_cast<intptr_t>(result) == -1) {
330 if (errno == ENOMEM) {
331 // Undo earlier, successful mappings.
332 munmap(real_alloc, kChunkSize);
333#ifdef V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
334 vas->FreePages(in_sandbox_page_reservation, rounded_length);
335#else
336 munmap(virtual_alloc, rounded_length);
337#endif
338 return nullptr;
339 }
340 FATAL("mremap failed with error %d: %s", errno, strerror(errno));
341 }
342 }
343 base::MutexGuard lock_guard(&regions_mutex_);
344 regions_[virtual_alloc] = real_alloc;
345 return virtual_alloc;
346 }
347
348 void Free(void* data, size_t length) override {
349 if (length < kChunkSize) {
350 return ArrayBufferAllocatorBase::Free(data, length);
351 }
352 base::MutexGuard lock_guard(&regions_mutex_);
353 void* real_alloc = regions_[data];
354 munmap(real_alloc, kChunkSize);
355 size_t rounded_length = RoundUp(length, kChunkSize);
356#ifdef V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
357 VirtualAddressSpace* vas = i::GetProcessWideSandbox()->address_space();
358 vas->FreePages(reinterpret_cast<i::Address>(data), rounded_length);
359#else
360 munmap(data, rounded_length);
361#endif
362 regions_.erase(data);
363 }
364
365 private:
366 // Aiming for a "Huge Page" (2M on Linux x64) to go easy on the TLB.
367 static constexpr size_t kChunkSize = 2 * 1024 * 1024;
368
369 std::unordered_map<void*, void*> regions_;
370 base::Mutex regions_mutex_;
371};
372
373#endif // V8_OS_LINUX

378template <int N>
379bool ThrowError(Isolate* isolate, const char (&message)[N]) {
380 if (isolate->IsExecutionTerminating()) return false;
381 isolate->ThrowError(message);
382 return true;
383}
384
385bool ThrowError(Isolate* isolate, Local<String> message) {
386 if (isolate->IsExecutionTerminating()) return false;
387 isolate->ThrowError(message);
388 return true;
389}
390
391static MaybeLocal<Value> TryGetValue(v8::Isolate* isolate,
392 Local<Context> context,
393 Local<v8::Object> object,
394 const char* property) {
395 MaybeLocal<String> v8_str = String::NewFromUtf8(isolate, property);
396 if (v8_str.IsEmpty()) return {};
397 return object->Get(context, v8_str.ToLocalChecked());
398}
399
400static Local<Value> GetValue(v8::Isolate* isolate, Local<Context> context,
401 Local<v8::Object> object, const char* property) {
402 return TryGetValue(isolate, context, object, property).ToLocalChecked();
403}
404
405std::shared_ptr<Worker> GetWorkerFromInternalField(Isolate* isolate,
406 Local<Object> object) {
407 if (object->InternalFieldCount() != 1) {
408 ThrowError(isolate, "this is not a Worker");
409 return nullptr;
410 }
411
412 i::Handle<i::Object> handle = Utils::OpenHandle(*object->GetInternalField(0));
413 if (IsSmi(*handle)) {
414 ThrowError(isolate, "Worker is defunct because main thread is terminating");
415 return nullptr;
416 }
417 auto managed = i::Handle<i::Managed<Worker>>::cast(handle);
418 return managed->get();
419}
420
421base::Thread::Options GetThreadOptions(const char* name) {
422 // On some systems (OSX 10.6) the stack size default is 0.5Mb or less
423 // which is not enough to parse the big literal expressions used in tests.
424 // The stack size should be at least StackGuard::kLimitSize + some
425 // OS-specific padding for thread startup code. 2Mbytes seems to be enough.
426 return base::Thread::Options(name, 2 * i::MB);
427}

435static constexpr char kIncludedCategoriesParam[] = "included_categories";
436static constexpr char kTraceConfigParam[] = "trace_config";
437
438class TraceConfigParser {
439 public:
440 static void FillTraceConfig(v8::Isolate* isolate,
441 platform::tracing::TraceConfig* trace_config,
442 const char* json_str) {
443 HandleScope outer_scope(isolate);
444 Local<Context> context = Context::New(isolate);
445 Context::Scope context_scope(context);
446 HandleScope inner_scope(isolate);
447
448 Local<String> source =
449 String::NewFromUtf8(isolate, json_str).ToLocalChecked();
450 Local<Value> result = JSON::Parse(context, source).ToLocalChecked();
451 Local<v8::Object> trace_config_object = result.As<v8::Object>();
452 // Try reading 'trace_config' property from a full chrome trace config.
453 // https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/memory-infra/memory_infra_startup_tracing.md#the-advanced-way
454 Local<Value> maybe_trace_config_object =
455 GetValue(isolate, context, trace_config_object, kTraceConfigParam);
456 if (maybe_trace_config_object->IsObject()) {
457 trace_config_object = maybe_trace_config_object.As<Object>();
458 }
459
460 UpdateIncludedCategoriesList(isolate, context, trace_config_object,
461 trace_config);
462 }
463
464 private:
465 static int UpdateIncludedCategoriesList(
466 v8::Isolate* isolate, Local<Context> context, Local<v8::Object> object,
467 platform::tracing::TraceConfig* trace_config) {
468 Local<Value> value =
469 GetValue(isolate, context, object, kIncludedCategoriesParam);
470 if (value->IsArray()) {
471 Local<Array> v8_array = value.As<Array>();
472 for (int i = 0, length = v8_array->Length(); i < length; ++i) {
473 Local<Value> v = v8_array->Get(context, i)
474 .ToLocalChecked()
475 ->ToString(context)
476 .ToLocalChecked();
477 String::Utf8Value str(isolate, v->ToString(context).ToLocalChecked());
478 trace_config->AddIncludedCategory(*str);
479 }
480 return v8_array->Length();
481 }
482 return 0;
483 }
484};
485
486} // namespace
487
488static platform::tracing::TraceConfig* CreateTraceConfigFromJSON(
489 v8::Isolate* isolate, const char* json_str) {
490 platform::tracing::TraceConfig* trace_config =
491 new platform::tracing::TraceConfig();
492 TraceConfigParser::FillTraceConfig(isolate, trace_config, json_str);
493 return trace_config;
494}

498class ExternalOwningOneByteStringResource
499 : public String::ExternalOneByteStringResource {
500 public:
501 ExternalOwningOneByteStringResource() = default;

503 std::unique_ptr<base::OS::MemoryMappedFile> file)
504 : file_(std::move(file)) {}
505 const char* data() const override {
506 return static_cast<char*>(file_->memory());
507 }
508 size_t length() const override { return file_->size(); }
509
510 private:
511 std::unique_ptr<base::OS::MemoryMappedFile> file_;
512};

543
544ScriptCompiler::CachedData* Shell::LookupCodeCache(Isolate* isolate,
545 Local<Value> source) {
546 i::ParkedMutexGuard lock_guard(
547 reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(isolate)->main_thread_local_isolate(),
548 cached_code_mutex_.Pointer());
549 CHECK(source->IsString());
550 v8::String::Utf8Value key(isolate, source);
551 DCHECK(*key);
552 auto entry = cached_code_map_.find(*key);
553 if (entry != cached_code_map_.end() && entry->second) {
554 int length = entry->second->length;
555 uint8_t* cache = new uint8_t[length];
556 memcpy(cache, entry->second->data, length);
557 ScriptCompiler::CachedData* cached_data = new ScriptCompiler::CachedData(
558 cache, length, ScriptCompiler::CachedData::BufferOwned);
559 return cached_data;
560 }
561 return nullptr;
562}
563
564void Shell::StoreInCodeCache(Isolate* isolate, Local<Value> source,
565 const ScriptCompiler::CachedData* cache_data) {
566 i::ParkedMutexGuard lock_guard(
567 reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(isolate)->main_thread_local_isolate(),
568 cached_code_mutex_.Pointer());
569 CHECK(source->IsString());
570 if (cache_data == nullptr) return;
571 v8::String::Utf8Value key(isolate, source);
572 DCHECK(*key);
573 int length = cache_data->length;
574 uint8_t* cache = new uint8_t[length];
575 memcpy(cache, cache_data->data, length);
576 cached_code_map_[*key] = std::unique_ptr<ScriptCompiler::CachedData>(
577 new ScriptCompiler::CachedData(cache, length,
578 ScriptCompiler::CachedData::BufferOwned));
579}

581// Dummy external source stream which returns the whole source in one go.
582// TODO(leszeks): Also test chunking the data.
583class DummySourceStream : public v8::ScriptCompiler::ExternalSourceStream {
584 public:
585 explicit DummySourceStream(Local<String> source) : done_(false) {
586 source_buffer_ = Utils::OpenDirectHandle(*source)->ToCString(
587 i::ALLOW_NULLS, i::FAST_STRING_TRAVERSAL, &source_length_);
588 }
589
590 size_t GetMoreData(const uint8_t** src) override {
591 if (done_) {
592 return 0;
593 }
594 *src = reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(source_buffer_.release());
595 done_ = true;
596
597 return source_length_;
598 }
599
600 private:
601 int source_length_;
602 std::unique_ptr<char[]> source_buffer_;
603 bool done_;
604};

606// Run a ScriptStreamingTask in a separate thread.
607class StreamerThread : public v8::base::Thread {
608 public:
609 static void StartThreadForTaskAndJoin(
610 v8::ScriptCompiler::ScriptStreamingTask* task) {
611 StreamerThread thread(task);
612 CHECK(thread.Start());
613 thread.Join();
614 }
615
616 explicit StreamerThread(v8::ScriptCompiler::ScriptStreamingTask* task)
617 : Thread(Thread::Options()), task_(task) {}
618
619 void Run() override { task_->Run(); }
620
621 private:
622 v8::ScriptCompiler::ScriptStreamingTask* task_;
623};

626template <class T>
627MaybeLocal<T> CompileStreamed(Local<Context> context,
628 ScriptCompiler::StreamedSource* v8_source,
629 Local<String> full_source_string,
630 const ScriptOrigin& origin) {}
631
632template <>
633MaybeLocal<Script> CompileStreamed(Local<Context> context,
634 ScriptCompiler::StreamedSource* v8_source,
635 Local<String> full_source_string,
636 const ScriptOrigin& origin) {
637 return ScriptCompiler::Compile(context, v8_source, full_source_string,
638 origin);
639}
640
641template <>
642MaybeLocal<Module> CompileStreamed(Local<Context> context,
643 ScriptCompiler::StreamedSource* v8_source,
644 Local<String> full_source_string,
645 const ScriptOrigin& origin) {
646 return ScriptCompiler::CompileModule(context, v8_source, full_source_string,
647 origin);
648}
649
650template <class T>
651MaybeLocal<T> Compile(Local<Context> context, ScriptCompiler::Source* source,
652 ScriptCompiler::CompileOptions options) {}
653template <>
654MaybeLocal<Script> Compile(Local<Context> context,
655 ScriptCompiler::Source* source,
656 ScriptCompiler::CompileOptions options) {
657 return ScriptCompiler::Compile(context, source, options);
658}
659
660template <>
661MaybeLocal<Module> Compile(Local<Context> context,
662 ScriptCompiler::Source* source,
663 ScriptCompiler::CompileOptions options) {
664 return ScriptCompiler::CompileModule(context->GetIsolate(), source, options);
665}

668
669template <class T>
670MaybeLocal<T> Shell::CompileString(Isolate* isolate, Local<Context> context,
671 Local<String> source,
672 const ScriptOrigin& origin) {
673 if (options.streaming_compile) {
674 v8::ScriptCompiler::StreamedSource streamed_source(
675 std::make_unique<DummySourceStream>(source),
676 v8::ScriptCompiler::StreamedSource::UTF8);
677 std::unique_ptr<v8::ScriptCompiler::ScriptStreamingTask> streaming_task(
678 v8::ScriptCompiler::StartStreaming(isolate, &streamed_source,
679 std::is_same<T, Module>::value
680 ? v8::ScriptType::kModule
681 : v8::ScriptType::kClassic));
682 StreamerThread::StartThreadForTaskAndJoin(streaming_task.get());
683 return CompileStreamed<T>(context, &streamed_source, source, origin);
684 }
685
686 ScriptCompiler::CachedData* cached_code = nullptr;
687 if (options.compile_options == ScriptCompiler::kConsumeCodeCache) {
688 cached_code = LookupCodeCache(isolate, source);
689 }
690 ScriptCompiler::Source script_source(source, origin, cached_code);
691 MaybeLocal<T> result =
692 Compile<T>(context, &script_source,
693 cached_code ? ScriptCompiler::kConsumeCodeCache
694 : ScriptCompiler::kNoCompileOptions);
695 if (cached_code) CHECK(!cached_code->rejected);
696 return result;
697}
698
699namespace {
700// For testing.
701const int kHostDefinedOptionsLength = 2;
702const uint32_t kHostDefinedOptionsMagicConstant = 0xF1F2F3F0;
703
704std::string ToSTLString(Isolate* isolate, Local<String> v8_str) {
705 String::Utf8Value utf8(isolate, v8_str);
706 // Should not be able to fail since the input is a String.
707 CHECK(*utf8);
708 return *utf8;
709}
710
711// Per-context Module data, allowing sharing of module maps
712// across top-level module loads.
713class ModuleEmbedderData {
714 private:
715 class ModuleGlobalHash {
716 public:
717 explicit ModuleGlobalHash(Isolate* isolate) : isolate_(isolate) {}
718 size_t operator()(const Global<Module>& module) const {
719 return module.Get(isolate_)->GetIdentityHash();
720 }
721
722 private:
723 Isolate* isolate_;
724 };
725
726 public:
727 static constexpr i::ExternalPointerTag kManagedTag = i::kGenericManagedTag;
728
729 explicit ModuleEmbedderData(Isolate* isolate)
730 : module_to_specifier_map(10, ModuleGlobalHash(isolate)),
731 json_module_to_parsed_json_map(
732 10, module_to_specifier_map.hash_function()) {}
733
734 static ModuleType ModuleTypeFromImportAttributes(
735 Local<Context> context, Local<FixedArray> import_attributes,
736 bool hasPositions) {
737 Isolate* isolate = context->GetIsolate();
738 const int kV8AssertionEntrySize = hasPositions ? 3 : 2;
739 for (int i = 0; i < import_attributes->Length();
740 i += kV8AssertionEntrySize) {
741 Local<String> v8_assertion_key =
742 import_attributes->Get(context, i).As<v8::String>();
743 std::string assertion_key = ToSTLString(isolate, v8_assertion_key);
744
745 if (assertion_key == "type") {
746 Local<String> v8_assertion_value =
747 import_attributes->Get(context, i + 1).As<String>();
748 std::string assertion_value = ToSTLString(isolate, v8_assertion_value);
749 if (assertion_value == "json") {
750 return ModuleType::kJSON;
751 } else {
752 // JSON is currently the only supported non-JS type
753 return ModuleType::kInvalid;
754 }
755 }
756 }
757
758 // If no type is asserted, default to JS.
759 return ModuleType::kJavaScript;
760 }
761
762 // Map from (normalized module specifier, module type) pair to Module.
763 std::map<std::pair<std::string, ModuleType>, Global<Module>> module_map;
764 // Map from Module to its URL as defined in the ScriptOrigin
765 std::unordered_map<Global<Module>, std::string, ModuleGlobalHash>
766 module_to_specifier_map;
767 // Map from JSON Module to its parsed content, for use in module
768 // JSONModuleEvaluationSteps
769 std::unordered_map<Global<Module>, Global<Value>, ModuleGlobalHash>
770 json_module_to_parsed_json_map;
771
772 // Origin location used for resolving modules when referrer is null.
773 std::string origin;
774};
775
776enum { kModuleEmbedderDataIndex, kInspectorClientIndex };
777
778std::shared_ptr<ModuleEmbedderData> InitializeModuleEmbedderData(
779 Local<Context> context) {
780 i::Isolate* i_isolate = reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(context->GetIsolate());
781 const size_t kModuleEmbedderDataEstimate = 4 * 1024; // module map.
782 i::Handle<i::Managed<ModuleEmbedderData>> module_data_managed =
783 i::Managed<ModuleEmbedderData>::Allocate(
784 i_isolate, kModuleEmbedderDataEstimate, context->GetIsolate());
785 v8::Local<v8::Value> module_data = Utils::ToLocal(module_data_managed);
786 context->SetEmbedderData(kModuleEmbedderDataIndex, module_data);
787 return module_data_managed->get();
788}
789
790std::shared_ptr<ModuleEmbedderData> GetModuleDataFromContext(
791 Local<Context> context) {
792 v8::Local<v8::Value> module_data =
793 context->GetEmbedderData(kModuleEmbedderDataIndex);
794 i::Handle<i::Managed<ModuleEmbedderData>> module_data_managed =
795 i::Handle<i::Managed<ModuleEmbedderData>>::cast(
796 Utils::OpenHandle<Value, i::Object>(module_data));
797 return module_data_managed->get();
798}
799
800ScriptOrigin CreateScriptOrigin(Isolate* isolate, Local<String> resource_name,
801 v8::ScriptType type) {
802 Local<PrimitiveArray> options =
803 PrimitiveArray::New(isolate, kHostDefinedOptionsLength);
804 options->Set(isolate, 0,
805 v8::Uint32::New(isolate, kHostDefinedOptionsMagicConstant));
806 options->Set(isolate, 1, resource_name);
807 return ScriptOrigin(resource_name, 0, 0, false, -1, Local<Value>(), false,
808 false, type == v8::ScriptType::kModule, options);
809}
810
811bool IsValidHostDefinedOptions(Local<Context> context, Local<Data> options,
812 Local<Value> resource_name) {
813 if (!options->IsFixedArray()) return false;
814 Local<FixedArray> array = options.As<FixedArray>();
815 if (array->Length() != kHostDefinedOptionsLength) return false;
816 uint32_t magic = 0;
817 if (!array->Get(context, 0).As<Value>()->Uint32Value(context).To(&magic)) {
818 return false;
819 }
820 if (magic != kHostDefinedOptionsMagicConstant) return false;
821 return array->Get(context, 1).As<String>()->StrictEquals(resource_name);
822}
823
824class D8WasmAsyncResolvePromiseTask : public v8::Task {
825 public:
826 D8WasmAsyncResolvePromiseTask(v8::Isolate* isolate,
827 v8::Local<v8::Context> context,
828 v8::Local<v8::Promise::Resolver> resolver,
829 v8::Local<v8::Value> result,
830 WasmAsyncSuccess success)
831 : isolate_(isolate),
832 context_(isolate, context),
833 resolver_(isolate, resolver),
834 result_(isolate, result),
835 success_(success) {}
836
837 void Run() override {
838 v8::HandleScope scope(isolate_);
839 v8::Local<v8::Context> context = context_.Get(isolate_);
840 MicrotasksScope microtasks_scope(context,
841 MicrotasksScope::kDoNotRunMicrotasks);
842 v8::Local<v8::Promise::Resolver> resolver = resolver_.Get(isolate_);
843 v8::Local<v8::Value> result = result_.Get(isolate_);
844
845 Maybe<bool> ret = success_ == WasmAsyncSuccess::kSuccess
846 ? resolver->Resolve(context, result)
847 : resolver->Reject(context, result);
848 // It's guaranteed that no exceptions will be thrown by these
849 // operations, but execution might be terminating.
850 CHECK(ret.IsJust() ? ret.FromJust() : isolate_->IsExecutionTerminating());
851 }
852
853 private:
854 v8::Isolate* isolate_;
855 v8::Global<v8::Context> context_;
856 v8::Global<v8::Promise::Resolver> resolver_;
857 v8::Global<v8::Value> result_;
858 WasmAsyncSuccess success_;
859};
860
861void D8WasmAsyncResolvePromiseCallback(
862 v8::Isolate* isolate, v8::Local<v8::Context> context,
863 v8::Local<v8::Promise::Resolver> resolver, v8::Local<v8::Value> result,
864 WasmAsyncSuccess success) {
865 // We have to resolve the promise in a separate task which is not a cancelable
866 // task, to avoid a deadlock when {quit()} is called in the then-handler of
867 // the result promise.
868 g_platform->GetForegroundTaskRunner(isolate)->PostTask(
869 std::make_unique<D8WasmAsyncResolvePromiseTask>(
870 isolate, context, resolver, result, success));
871}
872
873} // namespace
874
875// Executes a string within the current v8 context.
876bool Shell::ExecuteString(Isolate* isolate, Local<String> source,
877 Local<String> name,
878 ReportExceptions report_exceptions,
879 Global<Value>* out_result) {
880 i::Isolate* i_isolate = reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(isolate);
881 if (i::v8_flags.parse_only) {
882 i::VMState<PARSER> state(i_isolate);
883 i::Handle<i::String> str = Utils::OpenHandle(*(source));
884
885 // Set up ParseInfo.
886 i::UnoptimizedCompileState compile_state;
887 i::ReusableUnoptimizedCompileState reusable_state(i_isolate);
888
889 i::UnoptimizedCompileFlags flags =
890 i::UnoptimizedCompileFlags::ForToplevelCompile(
891 i_isolate, true, i::construct_language_mode(i::v8_flags.use_strict),
892 i::REPLMode::kNo, ScriptType::kClassic, i::v8_flags.lazy);
893
894 if (options.compile_options == v8::ScriptCompiler::kEagerCompile) {
895 flags.set_is_eager(true);
896 }
897
898 i::ParseInfo parse_info(i_isolate, flags, &compile_state, &reusable_state);
899
900 i::Handle<i::Script> script = parse_info.CreateScript(
901 i_isolate, str, i::kNullMaybeHandle, ScriptOriginOptions());
902 if (!i::parsing::ParseProgram(&parse_info, script, i_isolate,
903 i::parsing::ReportStatisticsMode::kYes)) {
904 parse_info.pending_error_handler()->PrepareErrors(
905 i_isolate, parse_info.ast_value_factory());
906 parse_info.pending_error_handler()->ReportErrors(i_isolate, script);
907
908 fprintf(stderr, "Failed parsing\n");
909 return false;
910 }
911 return true;
912 }
913
914 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
915 TryCatch try_catch(isolate);
916 try_catch.SetVerbose(report_exceptions == kReportExceptions);
917
918 // Explicitly check for stack overflows. This method can be called
919 // recursively, and since we consume quite some stack space for the C++
920 // frames, the stack check in the called frame might be too late.
921 if (i::StackLimitCheck{i_isolate}.HasOverflowed()) {
922 i_isolate->StackOverflow();
923 return false;
924 }
925
926 PerIsolateData* data = PerIsolateData::Get(isolate);
927 Local<Context> realm =
928 Local<Context>::New(isolate, data->realms_[data->realm_current_]);
929 Context::Scope context_scope(realm);
930 Local<Context> context(isolate->GetCurrentContext());
931 ScriptOrigin origin = CreateScriptOrigin(isolate, name, ScriptType::kClassic);
932
933 std::shared_ptr<ModuleEmbedderData> module_data =
934 GetModuleDataFromContext(realm);
935 module_data->origin = ToSTLString(isolate, name);
936
937 for (int i = 1; i < options.repeat_compile; ++i) {
938 HandleScope handle_scope_for_compiling(isolate);
939 if (CompileString<Script>(isolate, context, source, origin).IsEmpty()) {
940 return false;
941 }
942 }
943 Local<Script> script;
944 if (!CompileString<Script>(isolate, context, source, origin)
945 .ToLocal(&script)) {
946 return false;
947 }
948
949 if (options.code_cache_options ==
950 ShellOptions::CodeCacheOptions::kProduceCache) {
951 // Serialize and store it in memory for the next execution.
952 ScriptCompiler::CachedData* cached_data =
953 ScriptCompiler::CreateCodeCache(script->GetUnboundScript());
954 StoreInCodeCache(isolate, source, cached_data);
955 delete cached_data;
956 }
957 if (options.compile_only) return true;
958 if (options.compile_options == ScriptCompiler::kConsumeCodeCache) {
959 i::Handle<i::Script> i_script(
960 i::Script::cast(Utils::OpenDirectHandle(*script)->shared()->script()),
961 i_isolate);
962 // TODO(cbruni, chromium:1244145): remove once context-allocated.
963 i_script->set_host_defined_options(i::FixedArray::cast(
964 *Utils::OpenDirectHandle(*(origin.GetHostDefinedOptions()))));
965 }
966
967 MaybeLocal<Value> maybe_result = script->Run(realm);
968
969 if (options.code_cache_options ==
970 ShellOptions::CodeCacheOptions::kProduceCacheAfterExecute) {
971 // Serialize and store it in memory for the next execution.
972 ScriptCompiler::CachedData* cached_data =
973 ScriptCompiler::CreateCodeCache(script->GetUnboundScript());
974 StoreInCodeCache(isolate, source, cached_data);
975 delete cached_data;
976 }
977 data->realm_current_ = data->realm_switch_;
978
979 Local<Value> result;
980 if (!maybe_result.ToLocal(&result)) {
981 DCHECK(try_catch.HasCaught());
982 return false;
983 } else if (out_result != nullptr) {
984 out_result->Reset(isolate, result);
985 }
986
987 // It's possible that a FinalizationRegistry cleanup task threw an error.
988 return !try_catch.HasCaught();
989}
990
991namespace {
992
993bool IsAbsolutePath(const std::string& path) {
994#if defined(V8_OS_WIN)
995 // This is an incorrect approximation, but should
996 // work for all our test-running cases.
997 return path.find(':') != std::string::npos;
998#else
999 return path[0] == '/';
1000#endif
1001}
1002
1003std::string GetWorkingDirectory() {
1004#if defined(V8_OS_WIN)
1005 char system_buffer[MAX_PATH];
1006 // Unicode paths are unsupported, which is fine as long as
1007 // the test directory doesn't include any such paths.
1008 DWORD len = GetCurrentDirectoryA(MAX_PATH, system_buffer);
1009 CHECK_GT(len, 0);
1010 return system_buffer;
1011#else
1012 char curdir[PATH_MAX];
1013 CHECK_NOT_NULL(getcwd(curdir, PATH_MAX));
1014 return curdir;
1015#endif
1016}
1017
1018// Returns the directory part of path, without the trailing '/'.
1019std::string DirName(const std::string& path) {
1020 DCHECK(IsAbsolutePath(path));
1021 size_t last_slash = path.find_last_of('/');
1022 DCHECK(last_slash != std::string::npos);
1023 return path.substr(0, last_slash);
1024}
1025
1026// Resolves path to an absolute path if necessary, and does some
1027// normalization (eliding references to the current directory
1028// and replacing backslashes with slashes).
1029std::string NormalizePath(const std::string& path,
1030 const std::string& dir_name) {
1031 std::string absolute_path;
1032 if (IsAbsolutePath(path)) {
1033 absolute_path = path;
1034 } else {
1035 absolute_path = dir_name + '/' + path;
1036 }
1037 std::replace(absolute_path.begin(), absolute_path.end(), '\\', '/');
1038 std::vector<std::string> segments;
1039 std::istringstream segment_stream(absolute_path);
1040 std::string segment;
1041 while (std::getline(segment_stream, segment, '/')) {
1042 if (segment == "..") {
1043 if (!segments.empty()) segments.pop_back();
1044 } else if (segment != ".") {
1045 segments.push_back(segment);
1046 }
1047 }
1048 // Join path segments.
1049 std::ostringstream os;
1050 if (segments.size() > 1) {
1051 std::copy(segments.begin(), segments.end() - 1,
1052 std::ostream_iterator<std::string>(os, "/"));
1053 os << *segments.rbegin();
1054 } else {
1055 os << "/";
1056 if (!segments.empty()) os << segments[0];
1057 }
1058 return os.str();
1059}
1060
1061MaybeLocal<Module> ResolveModuleCallback(Local<Context> context,
1062 Local<String> specifier,
1063 Local<FixedArray> import_attributes,
1064 Local<Module> referrer) {
1065 Isolate* isolate = context->GetIsolate();
1066 std::shared_ptr<ModuleEmbedderData> module_data =
1067 GetModuleDataFromContext(context);
1068 auto specifier_it = module_data->module_to_specifier_map.find(
1069 Global<Module>(isolate, referrer));
1070 CHECK(specifier_it != module_data->module_to_specifier_map.end());
1071 std::string absolute_path = NormalizePath(ToSTLString(isolate, specifier),
1072 DirName(specifier_it->second));
1073 ModuleType module_type = ModuleEmbedderData::ModuleTypeFromImportAttributes(
1074 context, import_attributes, true);
1075 auto module_it =
1076 module_data->module_map.find(std::make_pair(absolute_path, module_type));
1077 CHECK(module_it != module_data->module_map.end());
1078 return module_it->second.Get(isolate);
1079}
1080
1081} // anonymous namespace
1082
1083MaybeLocal<Module> Shell::FetchModuleTree(Local<Module> referrer,
1084 Local<Context> context,
1085 const std::string& file_name,
1086 ModuleType module_type) {
1087 DCHECK(IsAbsolutePath(file_name));
1088 Isolate* isolate = context->GetIsolate();
1089 MaybeLocal<String> source_text = ReadFile(isolate, file_name.c_str(), false);
1090 if (source_text.IsEmpty() && options.fuzzy_module_file_extensions) {
1091 std::string fallback_file_name = file_name + ".js";
1092 source_text = ReadFile(isolate, fallback_file_name.c_str(), false);
1093 if (source_text.IsEmpty()) {
1094 fallback_file_name = file_name + ".mjs";
1095 source_text = ReadFile(isolate, fallback_file_name.c_str());
1096 }
1097 }
1098
1099 std::shared_ptr<ModuleEmbedderData> module_data =
1100 GetModuleDataFromContext(context);
1101 if (source_text.IsEmpty()) {
1102 std::string msg = "d8: Error reading module from " + file_name;
1103 if (!referrer.IsEmpty()) {
1104 auto specifier_it = module_data->module_to_specifier_map.find(
1105 Global<Module>(isolate, referrer));
1106 CHECK(specifier_it != module_data->module_to_specifier_map.end());
1107 msg += "\n imported by " + specifier_it->second;
1108 }
1109 ThrowError(isolate,
1110 v8::String::NewFromUtf8(isolate, msg.c_str()).ToLocalChecked());
1111 return MaybeLocal<Module>();
1112 }
1113
1114 Local<String> resource_name =
1115 String::NewFromUtf8(isolate, file_name.c_str()).ToLocalChecked();
1116 ScriptOrigin origin =
1117 CreateScriptOrigin(isolate, resource_name, ScriptType::kModule);
1118
1119 Local<Module> module;
1120 if (module_type == ModuleType::kJavaScript) {
1121 ScriptCompiler::Source source(source_text.ToLocalChecked(), origin);
1122 if (!CompileString<Module>(isolate, context, source_text.ToLocalChecked(),
1123 origin)
1124 .ToLocal(&module)) {
1125 return MaybeLocal<Module>();
1126 }
1127 } else if (module_type == ModuleType::kJSON) {
1128 Local<Value> parsed_json;
1129 if (!v8::JSON::Parse(context, source_text.ToLocalChecked())
1130 .ToLocal(&parsed_json)) {
1131 return MaybeLocal<Module>();
1132 }
1133
1134 auto export_names = v8::to_array<Local<String>>(
1135 {String::NewFromUtf8(isolate, "default").ToLocalChecked()});
1136
1137 module = v8::Module::CreateSyntheticModule(
1138 isolate,
1139 String::NewFromUtf8(isolate, file_name.c_str()).ToLocalChecked(),
1140 export_names, Shell::JSONModuleEvaluationSteps);
1141
1142 CHECK(module_data->json_module_to_parsed_json_map
1143 .insert(std::make_pair(Global<Module>(isolate, module),
1144 Global<Value>(isolate, parsed_json)))
1145 .second);
1146 } else {
1147 UNREACHABLE();
1148 }
1149
1150 CHECK(module_data->module_map
1151 .insert(std::make_pair(std::make_pair(file_name, module_type),
1152 Global<Module>(isolate, module)))
1153 .second);
1154 CHECK(module_data->module_to_specifier_map
1155 .insert(std::make_pair(Global<Module>(isolate, module), file_name))
1156 .second);
1157
1158 std::string dir_name = DirName(file_name);
1159
1160 Local<FixedArray> module_requests = module->GetModuleRequests();
1161 for (int i = 0, length = module_requests->Length(); i < length; ++i) {
1162 Local<ModuleRequest> module_request =
1163 module_requests->Get(context, i).As<ModuleRequest>();
1164 Local<String> name = module_request->GetSpecifier();
1165 std::string absolute_path =
1166 NormalizePath(ToSTLString(isolate, name), dir_name);
1167 Local<FixedArray> import_attributes = module_request->GetImportAttributes();
1168 ModuleType request_module_type =
1169 ModuleEmbedderData::ModuleTypeFromImportAttributes(
1170 context, import_attributes, true);
1171
1172 if (request_module_type == ModuleType::kInvalid) {
1173 ThrowError(isolate, "Invalid module type was asserted");
1174 return MaybeLocal<Module>();
1175 }
1176
1177 if (module_data->module_map.count(
1178 std::make_pair(absolute_path, request_module_type))) {
1179 continue;
1180 }
1181
1182 if (FetchModuleTree(module, context, absolute_path, request_module_type)
1183 .IsEmpty()) {
1184 return MaybeLocal<Module>();
1185 }
1186 }
1187
1188 return module;
1189}
1190
1191MaybeLocal<Value> Shell::JSONModuleEvaluationSteps(Local<Context> context,
1192 Local<Module> module) {
1193 Isolate* isolate = context->GetIsolate();
1194
1195 std::shared_ptr<ModuleEmbedderData> module_data =
1196 GetModuleDataFromContext(context);
1197 auto json_value_it = module_data->json_module_to_parsed_json_map.find(
1198 Global<Module>(isolate, module));
1199 CHECK(json_value_it != module_data->json_module_to_parsed_json_map.end());
1200 Local<Value> json_value = json_value_it->second.Get(isolate);
1201
1202 TryCatch try_catch(isolate);
1203 Maybe<bool> result = module->SetSyntheticModuleExport(
1204 isolate,
1205 String::NewFromUtf8Literal(isolate, "default",
1206 NewStringType::kInternalized),
1207 json_value);
1208
1209 // Setting the default export should never fail.
1210 CHECK(!try_catch.HasCaught());
1211 CHECK(!result.IsNothing() && result.FromJust());
1212
1213 Local<Promise::Resolver> resolver =
1214 Promise::Resolver::New(context).ToLocalChecked();
1215 resolver->Resolve(context, Undefined(isolate)).ToChecked();
1216 return resolver->GetPromise();
1217}
1218
1219struct DynamicImportData {
1220 DynamicImportData(Isolate* isolate_, Local<Context> context_,
1221 Local<Value> referrer_, Local<String> specifier_,
1222 Local<FixedArray> import_attributes_,
1223 Local<Promise::Resolver> resolver_)
1224 : isolate(isolate_) {
1225 context.Reset(isolate, context_);
1226 referrer.Reset(isolate, referrer_);
1227 specifier.Reset(isolate, specifier_);
1228 import_attributes.Reset(isolate, import_attributes_);
1229 resolver.Reset(isolate, resolver_);
1230 }
1231
1232 Isolate* isolate;
1233 // The initiating context. It can be the Realm created by d8, or the context
1234 // created by ShadowRealm built-in.
1235 Global<Context> context;
1236 Global<Value> referrer;
1237 Global<String> specifier;
1238 Global<FixedArray> import_attributes;
1239 Global<Promise::Resolver> resolver;
1240};
1241
1242namespace {
1243struct ModuleResolutionData {
1244 ModuleResolutionData(Isolate* isolate_, Local<Value> module_namespace_,
1245 Local<Promise::Resolver> resolver_)
1246 : isolate(isolate_) {
1247 module_namespace.Reset(isolate, module_namespace_);
1248 resolver.Reset(isolate, resolver_);
1249 }
1250
1251 Isolate* isolate;
1252 Global<Value> module_namespace;
1253 Global<Promise::Resolver> resolver;
1254};
1255
1256} // namespace
1257
1258void Shell::ModuleResolutionSuccessCallback(
1259 const FunctionCallbackInfo<Value>& info) {
1260 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
1261 std::unique_ptr<ModuleResolutionData> module_resolution_data(
1262 static_cast<ModuleResolutionData*>(
1263 info.Data().As<v8::External>()->Value()));
1264 Isolate* isolate(module_resolution_data->isolate);
1265 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
1266
1267 Local<Promise::Resolver> resolver(
1268 module_resolution_data->resolver.Get(isolate));
1269 Local<Value> module_namespace(
1270 module_resolution_data->module_namespace.Get(isolate));
1271
1272 PerIsolateData* data = PerIsolateData::Get(isolate);
1273 Local<Context> realm = data->realms_[data->realm_current_].Get(isolate);
1274 Context::Scope context_scope(realm);
1275
1276 resolver->Resolve(realm, module_namespace).ToChecked();
1277}
1278
1279void Shell::ModuleResolutionFailureCallback(
1280 const FunctionCallbackInfo<Value>& info) {
1281 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
1282 std::unique_ptr<ModuleResolutionData> module_resolution_data(
1283 static_cast<ModuleResolutionData*>(
1284 info.Data().As<v8::External>()->Value()));
1285 Isolate* isolate(module_resolution_data->isolate);
1286 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
1287
1288 Local<Promise::Resolver> resolver(
1289 module_resolution_data->resolver.Get(isolate));
1290
1291 PerIsolateData* data = PerIsolateData::Get(isolate);
1292 Local<Context> realm = data->realms_[data->realm_current_].Get(isolate);
1293 Context::Scope context_scope(realm);
1294
1295 DCHECK_EQ(info.Length(), 1);
1296 resolver->Reject(realm, info[0]).ToChecked();
1297}
1298
1299MaybeLocal<Promise> Shell::HostImportModuleDynamically(
1300 Local<Context> context, Local<Data> host_defined_options,
1301 Local<Value> resource_name, Local<String> specifier,
1302 Local<FixedArray> import_attributes) {
1303 Isolate* isolate = context->GetIsolate();
1304
1305 MaybeLocal<Promise::Resolver> maybe_resolver =
1306 Promise::Resolver::New(context);
1307 Local<Promise::Resolver> resolver;
1308 if (!maybe_resolver.ToLocal(&resolver)) return MaybeLocal<Promise>();
1309
1310 if (!resource_name->IsNull() &&
1311 !IsValidHostDefinedOptions(context, host_defined_options,
1312 resource_name)) {
1313 resolver
1314 ->Reject(context, v8::Exception::TypeError(String::NewFromUtf8Literal(
1315 isolate, "Invalid host defined options")))
1316 .ToChecked();
1317 } else {
1318 DynamicImportData* data =
1319 new DynamicImportData(isolate, context, resource_name, specifier,
1320 import_attributes, resolver);
1321 PerIsolateData::Get(isolate)->AddDynamicImportData(data);
1322 isolate->EnqueueMicrotask(Shell::DoHostImportModuleDynamically, data);
1323 }
1324 return resolver->GetPromise();
1325}
1326
1327void Shell::HostInitializeImportMetaObject(Local<Context> context,
1328 Local<Module> module,
1329 Local<Object> meta) {
1330 Isolate* isolate = context->GetIsolate();
1331 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
1332
1333 std::shared_ptr<ModuleEmbedderData> module_data =
1334 GetModuleDataFromContext(context);
1335 auto specifier_it = module_data->module_to_specifier_map.find(
1336 Global<Module>(isolate, module));
1337 CHECK(specifier_it != module_data->module_to_specifier_map.end());
1338
1339 Local<String> url_key =
1340 String::NewFromUtf8Literal(isolate, "url", NewStringType::kInternalized);
1341 Local<String> url = String::NewFromUtf8(isolate, specifier_it->second.c_str())
1342 .ToLocalChecked();
1343 meta->CreateDataProperty(context, url_key, url).ToChecked();
1344}
1345
1346MaybeLocal<Context> Shell::HostCreateShadowRealmContext(
1347 Local<Context> initiator_context) {
1348 Local<Context> context = v8::Context::New(initiator_context->GetIsolate());
1349 std::shared_ptr<ModuleEmbedderData> shadow_realm_data =
1350 InitializeModuleEmbedderData(context);
1351 std::shared_ptr<ModuleEmbedderData> initiator_data =
1352 GetModuleDataFromContext(initiator_context);
1353
1354 // ShadowRealms are synchronously accessible and are always in the same origin
1355 // as the initiator context.
1356 context->SetSecurityToken(initiator_context->GetSecurityToken());
1357 shadow_realm_data->origin = initiator_data->origin;
1358
1359 return context;
1360}
1361
1362void Shell::DoHostImportModuleDynamically(void* import_data) {
1363 DynamicImportData* import_data_ =
1364 static_cast<DynamicImportData*>(import_data);
1365
1366 Isolate* isolate(import_data_->isolate);
1367 Global<Context> global_realm;
1368 Global<Promise::Resolver> global_resolver;
1369 Global<Module> global_root_module;
1370 Global<Value> global_result;
1371
1372 TryCatch try_catch(isolate);
1373 try_catch.SetVerbose(true);
1374
1375 {
1376 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
1377 Local<Context> realm = import_data_->context.Get(isolate);
1378 Local<Value> referrer = import_data_->referrer.Get(isolate);
1379 Local<String> specifier = import_data_->specifier.Get(isolate);
1380 Local<FixedArray> import_attributes =
1381 import_data_->import_attributes.Get(isolate);
1382 Local<Promise::Resolver> resolver = import_data_->resolver.Get(isolate);
1383
1384 global_realm.Reset(isolate, realm);
1385 global_resolver.Reset(isolate, resolver);
1386
1387 PerIsolateData* data = PerIsolateData::Get(isolate);
1388 data->DeleteDynamicImportData(import_data_);
1389
1390 Context::Scope context_scope(realm);
1391
1392 ModuleType module_type = ModuleEmbedderData::ModuleTypeFromImportAttributes(
1393 realm, import_attributes, false);
1394
1395 if (module_type == ModuleType::kInvalid) {
1396 ThrowError(isolate, "Invalid module type was asserted");
1397 CHECK(try_catch.HasCaught());
1398 resolver->Reject(realm, try_catch.Exception()).ToChecked();
1399 return;
1400 }
1401
1402 std::shared_ptr<ModuleEmbedderData> module_data =
1403 GetModuleDataFromContext(realm);
1404
1405 std::string source_url = referrer->IsNull()
1406 ? module_data->origin
1407 : ToSTLString(isolate, referrer.As<String>());
1408 std::string dir_name =
1409 DirName(NormalizePath(source_url, GetWorkingDirectory()));
1410 std::string file_name = ToSTLString(isolate, specifier);
1411 std::string absolute_path = NormalizePath(file_name, dir_name);
1412
1413 Local<Module> root_module;
1414 auto module_it = module_data->module_map.find(
1415 std::make_pair(absolute_path, module_type));
1416 if (module_it != module_data->module_map.end()) {
1417 root_module = module_it->second.Get(isolate);
1418 } else if (!FetchModuleTree(Local<Module>(), realm, absolute_path,
1419 module_type)
1420 .ToLocal(&root_module)) {
1421 CHECK(try_catch.HasCaught());
1422 if (isolate->IsExecutionTerminating()) {
1423 Shell::ReportException(isolate, try_catch);
1424 } else {
1425 resolver->Reject(realm, try_catch.Exception()).ToChecked();
1426 }
1427 return;
1428 }
1429 global_root_module.Reset(isolate, root_module);
1430
1431 if (root_module->InstantiateModule(realm, ResolveModuleCallback)
1432 .FromMaybe(false)) {
1433 MaybeLocal<Value> maybe_result = root_module->Evaluate(realm);
1434 CHECK(!maybe_result.IsEmpty());
1435 global_result.Reset(isolate, maybe_result.ToLocalChecked());
1436 }
1437 }
1438
1439 if (!global_result.IsEmpty()) {
1440 // This method is invoked from a microtask, where in general we may have an
1441 // non-trivial stack. Emptying the message queue below may trigger the
1442 // execution of a stackless GC. We need to override the embedder stack
1443 // state, to force scanning the stack, if this happens.
1444 i::Heap* heap = reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(isolate)->heap();
1445 i::EmbedderStackStateScope scope(
1446 heap, i::EmbedderStackStateOrigin::kExplicitInvocation,
1447 StackState::kMayContainHeapPointers);
1448 EmptyMessageQueues(isolate);
1449 } else {
1450 DCHECK(try_catch.HasCaught());
1451 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
1452 Local<Context> realm = global_realm.Get(isolate);
1453 Local<Promise::Resolver> resolver = global_resolver.Get(isolate);
1454 resolver->Reject(realm, try_catch.Exception()).ToChecked();
1455 return;
1456 }
1457
1458 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
1459 Local<Context> realm = global_realm.Get(isolate);
1460 Local<Module> root_module = global_root_module.Get(isolate);
1461 Local<Promise::Resolver> resolver = global_resolver.Get(isolate);
1462 Local<Value> result = global_result.Get(isolate);
1463 Local<Value> module_namespace = root_module->GetModuleNamespace();
1464 Local<Promise> result_promise = result.As<Promise>();
1465
1466 // Setup callbacks, and then chain them to the result promise.
1467 // ModuleResolutionData will be deleted by the callbacks.
1468 auto module_resolution_data =
1469 new ModuleResolutionData(isolate, module_namespace, resolver);
1470 Local<v8::External> edata = External::New(isolate, module_resolution_data);
1471 Local<Function> callback_success;
1472 CHECK(Function::New(realm, ModuleResolutionSuccessCallback, edata)
1473 .ToLocal(&callback_success));
1474 Local<Function> callback_failure;
1475 CHECK(Function::New(realm, ModuleResolutionFailureCallback, edata)
1476 .ToLocal(&callback_failure));
1477 result_promise->Then(realm, callback_success, callback_failure)
1478 .ToLocalChecked();
1479}
1480
1481bool Shell::ExecuteModule(Isolate* isolate, const char* file_name) {
1482 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
1483 Global<Module> global_root_module;
1484 Global<Promise> global_result_promise;
1485
1486 // Use a non-verbose TryCatch and report exceptions manually using
1487 // Shell::ReportException, because some errors (such as file errors) are
1488 // thrown without entering JS and thus do not trigger
1489 // isolate->ReportPendingMessages().
1490 TryCatch try_catch(isolate);
1491
1492 {
1493 PerIsolateData* data = PerIsolateData::Get(isolate);
1494 Local<Context> realm = data->realms_[data->realm_current_].Get(isolate);
1495 Context::Scope context_scope(realm);
1496
1497 std::string absolute_path = NormalizePath(file_name, GetWorkingDirectory());
1498
1499 std::shared_ptr<ModuleEmbedderData> module_data =
1500 GetModuleDataFromContext(realm);
1501 Local<Module> root_module;
1502 auto module_it = module_data->module_map.find(
1503 std::make_pair(absolute_path, ModuleType::kJavaScript));
1504 if (module_it != module_data->module_map.end()) {
1505 root_module = module_it->second.Get(isolate);
1506 } else if (!FetchModuleTree(Local<Module>(), realm, absolute_path,
1507 ModuleType::kJavaScript)
1508 .ToLocal(&root_module)) {
1509 CHECK(try_catch.HasCaught());
1510 ReportException(isolate, try_catch);
1511 return false;
1512 }
1513 global_root_module.Reset(isolate, root_module);
1514
1515 module_data->origin = absolute_path;
1516
1517 MaybeLocal<Value> maybe_result;
1518 if (root_module->InstantiateModule(realm, ResolveModuleCallback)
1519 .FromMaybe(false)) {
1520 maybe_result = root_module->Evaluate(realm);
1521 CHECK(!maybe_result.IsEmpty());
1522 global_result_promise.Reset(isolate,
1523 maybe_result.ToLocalChecked().As<Promise>());
1524 }
1525 }
1526
1527 if (!global_result_promise.IsEmpty()) {
1528 EmptyMessageQueues(isolate);
1529 } else {
1530 DCHECK(try_catch.HasCaught());
1531 ReportException(isolate, try_catch);
1532 return false;
1533 }
1534
1535 // Loop until module execution finishes
1536 while (isolate->HasPendingBackgroundTasks() ||
1537 (i::ValueHelper::HandleAsValue(global_result_promise)->State() ==
1538 Promise::kPending &&
1539 reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(isolate)
1540 ->default_microtask_queue()
1541 ->size() > 0)) {
1542 Shell::CompleteMessageLoop(isolate);
1543 }
1544
1545 {
1546 Local<Promise> result_promise = global_result_promise.Get(isolate);
1547 Local<Module> root_module = global_root_module.Get(isolate);
1548
1549 if (result_promise->State() == Promise::kRejected) {
1550 // If the exception has been caught by the promise pipeline, we rethrow
1551 // here in order to ReportException.
1552 // TODO(cbruni): Clean this up after we create a new API for the case
1553 // where TLA is enabled.
1554 if (!try_catch.HasCaught()) {
1555 isolate->ThrowException(result_promise->Result());
1556 } else {
1557 DCHECK_EQ(try_catch.Exception(), result_promise->Result());
1558 }
1559 ReportException(isolate, try_catch);
1560 return false;
1561 }
1562
1563 auto [stalled_modules, stalled_messages] =
1564 root_module->GetStalledTopLevelAwaitMessages(isolate);
1565 DCHECK_EQ(stalled_modules.size(), stalled_messages.size());
1566 if (stalled_messages.size() > 0) {
1567 Local<Message> message = stalled_messages[0];
1568 ReportException(isolate, message, v8::Exception::Error(message->Get()));
1569 return false;
1570 }
1571 }
1572
1573 DCHECK(!try_catch.HasCaught());
1574 return true;
1575}
1576
1577// Treat every line as a JSON value and parse it.
1578bool Shell::LoadJSON(Isolate* isolate, const char* file_name) {
1579 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
1580 PerIsolateData* isolate_data = PerIsolateData::Get(isolate);
1581 Local<Context> realm =
1582 isolate_data->realms_[isolate_data->realm_current_].Get(isolate);
1583 Context::Scope context_scope(realm);
1584 TryCatch try_catch(isolate);
1585
1586 std::string absolute_path = NormalizePath(file_name, GetWorkingDirectory());
1587 int length = 0;
1588 std::unique_ptr<char[]> data(ReadChars(absolute_path.c_str(), &length));
1589 if (length == 0) {
1590 printf("Error reading '%s'\n", file_name);
1591 base::OS::ExitProcess(1);
1592 }
1593 std::stringstream stream(data.get());
1594 std::string line;
1595 while (std::getline(stream, line, '\n')) {
1596 for (int r = 0; r < DeserializationRunCount(); ++r) {
1597 Local<String> source =
1598 String::NewFromUtf8(isolate, line.c_str()).ToLocalChecked();
1599 MaybeLocal<Value> maybe_value = JSON::Parse(realm, source);
1600
1601 Local<Value> value;
1602 if (!maybe_value.ToLocal(&value)) {
1603 DCHECK(try_catch.HasCaught());
1604 ReportException(isolate, try_catch);
1605 return false;
1606 }
1607 }
1608 }
1609 return true;
1610}

1612PerIsolateData::PerIsolateData(Isolate* isolate)
1613 : isolate_(isolate), realms_(nullptr) {
1614 isolate->SetData(0, this);
1615 if (i::v8_flags.expose_async_hooks) {
1616 async_hooks_wrapper_ = new AsyncHooks(isolate);
1617 }
1618 ignore_unhandled_promises_ = false;
1619}
1620
1621PerIsolateData::~PerIsolateData() {
1622 isolate_->SetData(0, nullptr); // Not really needed, just to be sure...
1623 if (i::v8_flags.expose_async_hooks) {
1624 delete async_hooks_wrapper_; // This uses the isolate
1625 }
1626#if defined(LEAK_SANITIZER)
1627 for (DynamicImportData* data : import_data_) {
1628 delete data;
1629 }
1630#endif
1631}
1632
1633void PerIsolateData::SetTimeout(Local<Function> callback,
1634 Local<Context> context) {
1635 set_timeout_callbacks_.emplace(isolate_, callback);
1636 set_timeout_contexts_.emplace(isolate_, context);
1637}
1638
1639MaybeLocal<Function> PerIsolateData::GetTimeoutCallback() {
1640 if (set_timeout_callbacks_.empty()) return MaybeLocal<Function>();
1641 Local<Function> result = set_timeout_callbacks_.front().Get(isolate_);
1642 set_timeout_callbacks_.pop();
1643 return result;
1644}
1645
1646MaybeLocal<Context> PerIsolateData::GetTimeoutContext() {
1647 if (set_timeout_contexts_.empty()) return MaybeLocal<Context>();
1648 Local<Context> result = set_timeout_contexts_.front().Get(isolate_);
1649 set_timeout_contexts_.pop();
1650 return result;
1651}
1652
1653void PerIsolateData::RemoveUnhandledPromise(Local<Promise> promise) {
1654 if (ignore_unhandled_promises_) return;
1655 // Remove handled promises from the list
1656 DCHECK_EQ(promise->GetIsolate(), isolate_);
1657 for (auto it = unhandled_promises_.begin(); it != unhandled_promises_.end();
1658 ++it) {
1659 v8::Local<v8::Promise> unhandled_promise = std::get<0>(*it).Get(isolate_);
1660 if (unhandled_promise == promise) {
1661 unhandled_promises_.erase(it--);
1662 }
1663 }
1664}
1665
1666void PerIsolateData::AddUnhandledPromise(Local<Promise> promise,
1667 Local<Message> message,
1668 Local<Value> exception) {
1669 if (ignore_unhandled_promises_) return;
1670 DCHECK_EQ(promise->GetIsolate(), isolate_);
1671 unhandled_promises_.emplace_back(v8::Global<v8::Promise>(isolate_, promise),
1672 v8::Global<v8::Message>(isolate_, message),
1673 v8::Global<v8::Value>(isolate_, exception));
1674}
1675
1676int PerIsolateData::HandleUnhandledPromiseRejections() {
1677 // Avoid recursive calls to HandleUnhandledPromiseRejections.
1678 if (ignore_unhandled_promises_) return 0;
1679 if (isolate_->IsExecutionTerminating()) return 0;
1680 ignore_unhandled_promises_ = true;
1681 v8::HandleScope scope(isolate_);
1682 // Ignore promises that get added during error reporting.
1683 size_t i = 0;
1684 for (; i < unhandled_promises_.size(); i++) {
1685 const auto& tuple = unhandled_promises_[i];
1686 Local<v8::Message> message = std::get<1>(tuple).Get(isolate_);
1687 Local<v8::Value> value = std::get<2>(tuple).Get(isolate_);
1688 Shell::ReportException(isolate_, message, value);
1689 }
1690 unhandled_promises_.clear();
1691 ignore_unhandled_promises_ = false;
1692 return static_cast<int>(i);
1693}
1694
1695void PerIsolateData::AddDynamicImportData(DynamicImportData* data) {
1696#if defined(LEAK_SANITIZER)
1697 import_data_.insert(data);
1698#endif
1699}
1700void PerIsolateData::DeleteDynamicImportData(DynamicImportData* data) {
1701#if defined(LEAK_SANITIZER)
1702 import_data_.erase(data);
1703#endif
1704 delete data;
1705}

1722
1723PerIsolateData::RealmScope::RealmScope(Isolate* isolate,
1724 const Global<Context>& context)
1725 : data_(PerIsolateData::Get(isolate)) {
1726 data_->realm_count_ = 1;
1727 data_->realm_current_ = 0;
1728 data_->realm_switch_ = 0;
1729 data_->realms_ = new Global<Context>[1];
1730 data_->realms_[0].Reset(data_->isolate_, context);
1731}
1732
1733PerIsolateData::RealmScope::~RealmScope() {
1734 // Drop realms to avoid keeping them alive.
1735 data_->realm_count_ = 0;
1736 delete[] data_->realms_;
1737}
1738
1739PerIsolateData::ExplicitRealmScope::ExplicitRealmScope(PerIsolateData* data,
1740 int index)
1741 : data_(data), index_(index) {
1742 realm_ = Local<Context>::New(data->isolate_, data->realms_[index_]);
1743 realm_->Enter();
1744 previous_index_ = data->realm_current_;
1745 data->realm_current_ = data->realm_switch_ = index_;
1746}
1747
1748PerIsolateData::ExplicitRealmScope::~ExplicitRealmScope() {
1749 realm_->Exit();
1750 data_->realm_current_ = data_->realm_switch_ = previous_index_;
1751}
1752
1753Local<Context> PerIsolateData::ExplicitRealmScope::context() const {
1754 return realm_;
1755}
1756
1757int PerIsolateData::RealmFind(Local<Context> context) {
1758 for (int i = 0; i < realm_count_; ++i) {
1759 if (realms_[i] == context) return i;
1760 }
1761 return -1;
1762}
1763
1764int PerIsolateData::RealmIndexOrThrow(
1765 const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info, int arg_offset) {
1766 if (info.Length() < arg_offset || !info[arg_offset]->IsNumber()) {
1767 ThrowError(info.GetIsolate(), "Invalid argument");
1768 return -1;
1769 }
1770 int index = info[arg_offset]
1771 ->Int32Value(info.GetIsolate()->GetCurrentContext())
1772 .FromMaybe(-1);
1773 if (index < 0 || index >= realm_count_ || realms_[index].IsEmpty()) {
1774 ThrowError(info.GetIsolate(), "Invalid realm index");
1775 return -1;
1776 }
1777 return index;
1778}
1779
1780// GetTimestamp() returns a time stamp as double, measured in milliseconds.
1781// When v8_flags.verify_predictable mode is enabled it returns result of
1782// v8::Platform::MonotonicallyIncreasingTime().
1783double Shell::GetTimestamp() {
1784 if (i::v8_flags.verify_predictable) {
1785 return g_platform->MonotonicallyIncreasingTime();
1786 } else {
1787 base::TimeDelta delta = base::TimeTicks::Now() - kInitialTicks;
1788 return delta.InMillisecondsF();
1789 }
1790}
1791uint64_t Shell::GetTracingTimestampFromPerformanceTimestamp(
1792 double performance_timestamp) {
1793 // Don't use this in --verify-predictable mode, predictable timestamps don't
1794 // work well with tracing.
1795 DCHECK(!i::v8_flags.verify_predictable);
1796 base::TimeDelta delta =
1797 base::TimeDelta::FromMillisecondsD(performance_timestamp);
1798 // See TracingController::CurrentTimestampMicroseconds().
1799 int64_t internal_value = (delta + kInitialTicks).ToInternalValue();
1800 DCHECK_GE(internal_value, 0);
1801 return internal_value;
1802}
1803
1804#ifdef V8_OS_LINUX
1805void SendPerfControlCommand(const char* command) {
1806 if (Shell::options.perf_ctl_fd != -1 && Shell::options.perf_ack_fd != -1) {
1807 size_t command_len = strlen(command);
1808 ssize_t ret = write(Shell::options.perf_ctl_fd, command, command_len);
1809 if (ret == -1) {
1810 fprintf(stderr, "perf_ctl write error: %s\n", strerror(errno));
1811 }
1812 CHECK_EQ(ret, command_len);
1813
1814 char ack[5];
1815 ret = read(Shell::options.perf_ack_fd, ack, 5);
1816 if (ret == -1) {
1817 fprintf(stderr, "perf_ack read error: %s\n", strerror(errno));
1818 }
1819 CHECK_EQ(ret, 5);
1820 CHECK_EQ(strcmp(ack, "ack\n"), 0);
1821 }
1822}
1823#endif
1824
1825// performance.now() returns GetTimestamp().
1826void Shell::PerformanceNow(const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
1827 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
1828 info.GetReturnValue().Set(GetTimestamp());
1829}
1830
1831// performance.mark() records and returns a PerformanceEntry with the current
1832// timestamp.
1833void Shell::PerformanceMark(const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
1834 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
1835 Isolate* isolate = info.GetIsolate();
1836 Local<Context> context = isolate->GetCurrentContext();
1837
1838 if (info.Length() < 1 || !info[0]->IsString()) {
1839 ThrowError(info.GetIsolate(), "Invalid 'name' argument");
1840 return;
1841 }
1842 Local<String> name = info[0].As<String>();
1843
1844 double timestamp = GetTimestamp();
1845
1846 Local<Object> performance_entry = Object::New(isolate);
1847 performance_entry
1848 ->DefineOwnProperty(context,
1849 String::NewFromUtf8Literal(isolate, "entryType"),
1850 String::NewFromUtf8Literal(isolate, "mark"), ReadOnly)
1851 .Check();
1852 performance_entry
1853 ->DefineOwnProperty(context, String::NewFromUtf8Literal(isolate, "name"),
1854 name, ReadOnly)
1855 .Check();
1856 performance_entry
1857 ->DefineOwnProperty(context,
1858 String::NewFromUtf8Literal(isolate, "startTime"),
1859 Number::New(isolate, timestamp), ReadOnly)
1860 .Check();
1861 performance_entry
1862 ->DefineOwnProperty(context,
1863 String::NewFromUtf8Literal(isolate, "duration"),
1864 Integer::New(isolate, 0), ReadOnly)
1865 .Check();
1866
1867 info.GetReturnValue().Set(performance_entry);
1868
1869#ifdef V8_OS_LINUX
1870 if (options.scope_linux_perf_to_mark_measure) {
1871 SendPerfControlCommand("enable");
1872 }
1873#endif
1874}
1875
1876// performance.measure() records and returns a PerformanceEntry with a duration
1877// since a given mark, or since zero.
1878void Shell::PerformanceMeasure(
1879 const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
1880 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
1881 Isolate* isolate = info.GetIsolate();
1882 Local<Context> context = isolate->GetCurrentContext();
1883
1884 if (info.Length() < 1 || !info[0]->IsString()) {
1885 ThrowError(info.GetIsolate(), "Invalid 'name' argument");
1886 return;
1887 }
1888 v8::Local<String> name = info[0].As<String>();
1889
1890 double start_timestamp = 0;
1891 if (info.Length() >= 2) {
1892#ifdef V8_OS_LINUX
1893 if (options.scope_linux_perf_to_mark_measure) {
1894 SendPerfControlCommand("disable");
1895 }
1896#endif
1897
1898 Local<Value> start_mark = info[1].As<Value>();
1899 if (!start_mark->IsObject()) {
1900 ThrowError(info.GetIsolate(),
1901 "Invalid 'startMark' argument: Not an Object");
1902 return;
1903 }
1904 Local<Value> start_time_field;
1905 if (!start_mark.As<Object>()
1906 ->Get(context, String::NewFromUtf8Literal(isolate, "startTime"))
1907 .ToLocal(&start_time_field)) {
1908 return;
1909 }
1910 if (!start_time_field->IsNumber()) {
1911 ThrowError(info.GetIsolate(),
1912 "Invalid 'startMark' argument: No numeric 'startTime' field");
1913 return;
1914 }
1915 start_timestamp = start_time_field.As<Number>()->Value();
1916 }
1917 if (info.Length() > 2) {
1918 ThrowError(info.GetIsolate(), "Too many arguments");
1919 return;
1920 }
1921
1922 double end_timestamp = GetTimestamp();
1923
1924 if (options.trace_enabled) {
1925 size_t hash = base::hash_combine(name->GetIdentityHash(), start_timestamp,
1926 end_timestamp);
1927
1928 String::Utf8Value utf8(isolate, name);
1929 TRACE_EVENT_COPY_NESTABLE_ASYNC_BEGIN_WITH_TIMESTAMP1(
1930 "v8", *utf8, static_cast<uint64_t>(hash),
1931 GetTracingTimestampFromPerformanceTimestamp(start_timestamp),
1932 "startTime", start_timestamp);
1933 TRACE_EVENT_COPY_NESTABLE_ASYNC_END_WITH_TIMESTAMP0(
1934 "v8", *utf8, static_cast<uint64_t>(hash),
1935 GetTracingTimestampFromPerformanceTimestamp(end_timestamp));
1936 }
1937
1938 Local<Object> performance_entry = Object::New(isolate);
1939 performance_entry
1940 ->DefineOwnProperty(
1941 context, String::NewFromUtf8Literal(isolate, "entryType"),
1942 String::NewFromUtf8Literal(isolate, "measure"), ReadOnly)
1943 .Check();
1944 performance_entry
1945 ->DefineOwnProperty(context, String::NewFromUtf8Literal(isolate, "name"),
1946 name, ReadOnly)
1947 .Check();
1948 performance_entry
1949 ->DefineOwnProperty(context,
1950 String::NewFromUtf8Literal(isolate, "startTime"),
1951 Number::New(isolate, start_timestamp), ReadOnly)
1952 .Check();
1953 performance_entry
1954 ->DefineOwnProperty(
1955 context, String::NewFromUtf8Literal(isolate, "duration"),
1956 Number::New(isolate, end_timestamp - start_timestamp), ReadOnly)
1957 .Check();
1958
1959 info.GetReturnValue().Set(performance_entry);
1960}
1961
1962// performance.measureMemory() implements JavaScript Memory API proposal.
1963// See https://github.com/ulan/javascript-agent-memory/blob/master/explainer.md.
1964void Shell::PerformanceMeasureMemory(
1965 const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
1966 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
1967 v8::MeasureMemoryMode mode = v8::MeasureMemoryMode::kSummary;
1968 v8::Isolate* isolate = info.GetIsolate();
1969 Local<Context> context = isolate->GetCurrentContext();
1970 if (info.Length() >= 1 && info[0]->IsObject()) {
1971 Local<Object> object = info[0].As<Object>();
1972 Local<Value> value = TryGetValue(isolate, context, object, "detailed")
1973 .FromMaybe(Local<Value>());
1974 if (value.IsEmpty()) {
1975 // Exception was thrown and scheduled, so return from the callback.
1976 return;
1977 }
1978 if (value->IsBoolean() && value->BooleanValue(isolate)) {
1979 mode = v8::MeasureMemoryMode::kDetailed;
1980 }
1981 }
1982 Local<v8::Promise::Resolver> promise_resolver =
1983 v8::Promise::Resolver::New(context).ToLocalChecked();
1984 info.GetIsolate()->MeasureMemory(
1985 v8::MeasureMemoryDelegate::Default(isolate, context, promise_resolver,
1986 mode),
1987 v8::MeasureMemoryExecution::kEager);
1988 info.GetReturnValue().Set(promise_resolver->GetPromise());
1989}

1991// Realm.current() returns the index of the currently active realm.
1992void Shell::RealmCurrent(const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
1993 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
1994 Isolate* isolate = info.GetIsolate();
1995 PerIsolateData* data = PerIsolateData::Get(isolate);
1996 int index = data->RealmFind(isolate->GetEnteredOrMicrotaskContext());
1997 if (index == -1) return;
1998 info.GetReturnValue().Set(index);
1999}

2001// Realm.owner(o) returns the index of the realm that created o.
2002void Shell::RealmOwner(const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
2003 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
2004 Isolate* isolate = info.GetIsolate();
2005 PerIsolateData* data = PerIsolateData::Get(isolate);
2006 if (info.Length() < 1 || !info[0]->IsObject()) {
2007 ThrowError(info.GetIsolate(), "Invalid argument");
2008 return;
2009 }
2010 Local<Object> object =
2011 info[0]->ToObject(isolate->GetCurrentContext()).ToLocalChecked();
2012 i::Handle<i::JSReceiver> i_object = Utils::OpenHandle(*object);
2013 if (IsJSGlobalProxy(*i_object) &&
2014 i::Handle<i::JSGlobalProxy>::cast(i_object)->IsDetached()) {
2015 return;
2016 }
2017 Local<Context> creation_context;
2018 if (!object->GetCreationContext().ToLocal(&creation_context)) {
2019 ThrowError(info.GetIsolate(), "object doesn't have creation context");
2020 return;
2021 }
2022 int index = data->RealmFind(creation_context);
2023 if (index == -1) return;
2024 info.GetReturnValue().Set(index);
2025}

2027// Realm.global(i) returns the global object of realm i.
2028// (Note that properties of global objects cannot be read/written cross-realm.)
2029void Shell::RealmGlobal(const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
2030 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
2031 PerIsolateData* data = PerIsolateData::Get(info.GetIsolate());
2032 int index = data->RealmIndexOrThrow(info, 0);
2033 if (index == -1) return;
2034 // TODO(chromium:324812): Ideally Context::Global should never return raw
2035 // global objects but return a global proxy. Currently it returns global
2036 // object when the global proxy is detached from the global object. The
2037 // following is a workaround till we fix Context::Global so we don't leak
2038 // global objects.
2039 Local<Object> global =
2040 Local<Context>::New(info.GetIsolate(), data->realms_[index])->Global();
2041 i::Handle<i::Object> i_global = Utils::OpenHandle(*global);
2042 if (IsJSGlobalObject(*i_global)) {
2043 i::Isolate* i_isolate = reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(info.GetIsolate());
2044 i::Handle<i::JSObject> i_global_proxy =
2045 handle(i::Handle<i::JSGlobalObject>::cast(i_global)->global_proxy(),
2046 i_isolate);
2047 global = Utils::ToLocal(i_global_proxy);
2048 }
2049 info.GetReturnValue().Set(global);
2050}
2051
2052MaybeLocal<Context> Shell::CreateRealm(
2053 const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info, int index,
2054 v8::MaybeLocal<Value> global_object) {
2055 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
2056 const char* kGlobalHandleLabel = "d8::realm";
2057 Isolate* isolate = info.GetIsolate();
2058 TryCatch try_catch(isolate);
2059 PerIsolateData* data = PerIsolateData::Get(isolate);
2060 if (index < 0) {
2061 Global<Context>* old_realms = data->realms_;
2062 index = data->realm_count_;
2063 data->realms_ = new Global<Context>[++data->realm_count_];
2064 for (int i = 0; i < index; ++i) {
2065 Global<Context>& realm = data->realms_[i];
2066 realm.Reset(isolate, old_realms[i]);
2067 if (!realm.IsEmpty()) {
2068 realm.AnnotateStrongRetainer(kGlobalHandleLabel);
2069 }
2070 old_realms[i].Reset();
2071 }
2072 delete[] old_realms;
2073 }
2074 Local<ObjectTemplate> global_template = CreateGlobalTemplate(isolate);
2075 Local<Context> context =
2076 Context::New(isolate, nullptr, global_template, global_object);
2077 if (context.IsEmpty()) return MaybeLocal<Context>();
2078 DCHECK(!try_catch.HasCaught());
2079 InitializeModuleEmbedderData(context);
2080 data->realms_[index].Reset(isolate, context);
2081 data->realms_[index].AnnotateStrongRetainer(kGlobalHandleLabel);
2082 info.GetReturnValue().Set(index);
2083 return context;
2084}
2085
2086void Shell::DisposeRealm(const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info,
2087 int index) {
2088 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
2089 Isolate* isolate = info.GetIsolate();
2090 PerIsolateData* data = PerIsolateData::Get(isolate);
2091 Local<Context> context = data->realms_[index].Get(isolate);
2092 data->realms_[index].Reset();
2093 // ContextDisposedNotification expects the disposed context to be entered.
2094 v8::Context::Scope scope(context);
2095 isolate->ContextDisposedNotification();
2096}

2099// and returns its index.

2102 CreateRealm(info, -1, v8::MaybeLocal<Value>());

2105// Realm.createAllowCrossRealmAccess() creates a new realm with the same
2106// security token as the current realm.
2107void Shell::RealmCreateAllowCrossRealmAccess(
2108 const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
2109 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
2110 Local<Context> context;
2111 if (CreateRealm(info, -1, v8::MaybeLocal<Value>()).ToLocal(&context)) {
2112 context->SetSecurityToken(
2113 info.GetIsolate()->GetEnteredOrMicrotaskContext()->GetSecurityToken());
2114 }
2115}
2116
2117// Realm.navigate(i) creates a new realm with a distinct security token
2118// in place of realm i.
2119void Shell::RealmNavigate(const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
2120 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
2121 Isolate* isolate = info.GetIsolate();
2122 PerIsolateData* data = PerIsolateData::Get(isolate);
2123 int index = data->RealmIndexOrThrow(info, 0);
2124 if (index == -1) return;
2125 if (index == 0 || index == data->realm_current_ ||
2126 index == data->realm_switch_) {
2127 ThrowError(info.GetIsolate(), "Invalid realm index");
2128 return;
2129 }
2130
2131 Local<Context> context = Local<Context>::New(isolate, data->realms_[index]);
2132 v8::MaybeLocal<Value> global_object = context->Global();
2133
2134 // Context::Global doesn't return JSGlobalProxy if DetachGlobal is called in
2135 // advance.
2136 if (!global_object.IsEmpty()) {
2137 HandleScope scope(isolate);
2138 if (!IsJSGlobalProxy(
2139 *Utils::OpenDirectHandle(*global_object.ToLocalChecked()))) {
2140 global_object = v8::MaybeLocal<Value>();
2141 }
2142 }
2143
2144 DisposeRealm(info, index);
2145 CreateRealm(info, index, global_object);
2146}

2148// Realm.detachGlobal(i) detaches the global objects of realm i from realm i.
2149void Shell::RealmDetachGlobal(const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
2150 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
2151 Isolate* isolate = info.GetIsolate();
2152 PerIsolateData* data = PerIsolateData::Get(isolate);
2153 int index = data->RealmIndexOrThrow(info, 0);
2154 if (index == -1) return;
2155 if (index == 0 || index == data->realm_current_ ||
2156 index == data->realm_switch_) {
2157 ThrowError(info.GetIsolate(), "Invalid realm index");
2158 return;
2159 }
2160
2161 HandleScope scope(isolate);
2162 Local<Context> realm = Local<Context>::New(isolate, data->realms_[index]);
2163 realm->DetachGlobal();
2164}

2174 index == data->realm_switch_) {

2191// Realm.eval(i, s) evaluates s in realm i and returns the result.
2192void Shell::RealmEval(const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
2193 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
2194 Isolate* isolate = info.GetIsolate();
2195 PerIsolateData* data = PerIsolateData::Get(isolate);
2196 int index = data->RealmIndexOrThrow(info, 0);
2197 if (index == -1) return;
2198 if (info.Length() < 2) {
2199 ThrowError(isolate, "Invalid argument");
2200 return;
2201 }
2202
2203 Local<String> source;
2204 if (!ReadSource(info, 1, CodeType::kString).ToLocal(&source)) {
2205 ThrowError(isolate, "Invalid argument");
2206 return;
2207 }
2208 ScriptOrigin origin =
2209 CreateScriptOrigin(isolate, String::NewFromUtf8Literal(isolate, "(d8)"),
2210 ScriptType::kClassic);
2211
2212 ScriptCompiler::Source script_source(source, origin);
2213 Local<UnboundScript> script;
2214 if (!ScriptCompiler::CompileUnboundScript(isolate, &script_source)
2215 .ToLocal(&script)) {
2216 return;
2217 }
2218 Local<Value> result;
2219 {
2220 PerIsolateData::ExplicitRealmScope realm_scope(data, index);
2221 if (!script->BindToCurrentContext()
2222 ->Run(realm_scope.context())
2223 .ToLocal(&result)) {
2224 return;
2225 }
2226 }
2227 info.GetReturnValue().Set(result);
2228}
