2248void Shell::LogGetAndStop(const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
2249 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
2250 Isolate* isolate = info.GetIsolate();
2251 i::Isolate* i_isolate = reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(isolate);
2252 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
2253
2254 std::string file_name = i_isolate->v8_file_logger()->file_name();
2255 if (!i::LogFile::IsLoggingToTemporaryFile(file_name)) {
2256 ThrowError(isolate, "Only capturing from temporary files is supported.");
2257 return;
2258 }
2259 if (!i_isolate->v8_file_logger()->is_logging()) {
2260 ThrowError(isolate, "Logging not enabled.");
2261 return;
2262 }
2263
2264 std::string raw_log;
2265 FILE* log_file = i_isolate->v8_file_logger()->TearDownAndGetLogFile();
2266 if (!log_file) {
2267 ThrowError(isolate, "Log file does not exist.");
2268 return;
2269 }
2270
2271 bool exists = false;
2272 raw_log = i::ReadFile(log_file, &exists, true);
2273 base::Fclose(log_file);
2274
2275 if (!exists) {
2276 ThrowError(isolate, "Unable to read log file.");
2277 return;
2278 }
2279 Local<String> result =
2280 String::NewFromUtf8(isolate, raw_log.c_str(), NewStringType::kNormal,
2281 static_cast<int>(raw_log.size()))
2282 .ToLocalChecked();
2283
2284 info.GetReturnValue().Set(result);
2285}
2286
2287void Shell::TestVerifySourcePositions(
2288 const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
2289 Isolate* isolate = info.GetIsolate();
2290 // Check if the argument is a valid function.
2291 if (info.Length() != 1) {
2292 ThrowError(isolate, "Expected function as single argument.");
2293 return;
2294 }
2295 auto arg_handle = Utils::OpenHandle(*info[0]);
2296 if (!IsHeapObject(*arg_handle) ||
2297 !IsJSFunctionOrBoundFunctionOrWrappedFunction(
2298 *i::Handle<i::HeapObject>::cast(arg_handle))) {
2299 ThrowError(isolate, "Expected function as single argument.");
2300 return;
2301 }
2302
2303 i::Isolate* i_isolate = reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(isolate);
2304 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
2305
2306 auto callable =
2307 i::Handle<i::JSFunctionOrBoundFunctionOrWrappedFunction>::cast(
2308 arg_handle);
2309 while (IsJSBoundFunction(*callable)) {
2310 internal::DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
2311 auto bound_function = i::Handle<i::JSBoundFunction>::cast(callable);
2312 auto bound_target = bound_function->bound_target_function();
2313 if (!IsJSFunctionOrBoundFunctionOrWrappedFunction(bound_target)) {
2314 internal::AllowGarbageCollection allow_gc;
2315 ThrowError(isolate, "Expected function as bound target.");
2316 return;
2317 }
2318 callable = handle(
2319 i::JSFunctionOrBoundFunctionOrWrappedFunction::cast(bound_target),
2320 i_isolate);
2321 }
2322
2323 i::Handle<i::JSFunction> function = i::Handle<i::JSFunction>::cast(callable);
2324 if (!function->shared()->HasBytecodeArray()) {
2325 ThrowError(isolate, "Function has no BytecodeArray attached.");
2326 return;
2327 }
2328 i::Handle<i::BytecodeArray> bytecodes =
2329 handle(function->shared()->GetBytecodeArray(i_isolate), i_isolate);
2330 i::interpreter::BytecodeArrayIterator bytecode_iterator(bytecodes);
2331 bool has_baseline = function->shared()->HasBaselineCode();
2332 i::Handle<i::TrustedByteArray> bytecode_offsets;
2333 std::unique_ptr<i::baseline::BytecodeOffsetIterator> offset_iterator;
2334 if (has_baseline) {
2335 bytecode_offsets = handle(
2336 i::TrustedByteArray::cast(
2337 function->shared()->GetCode(i_isolate)->bytecode_offset_table()),
2338 i_isolate);
2339 offset_iterator = std::make_unique<i::baseline::BytecodeOffsetIterator>(
2340 bytecode_offsets, bytecodes);
2341 // A freshly initiated BytecodeOffsetIterator points to the prologue.
2342 DCHECK_EQ(offset_iterator->current_pc_start_offset(), 0);
2343 DCHECK_EQ(offset_iterator->current_bytecode_offset(),
2344 i::kFunctionEntryBytecodeOffset);
2345 offset_iterator->Advance();
2346 }
2347 while (!bytecode_iterator.done()) {
2348 if (has_baseline) {
2349 if (offset_iterator->current_bytecode_offset() !=
2350 bytecode_iterator.current_offset()) {
2351 ThrowError(isolate, "Baseline bytecode offset mismatch.");
2352 return;
2353 }
2354 // Check that we map every address to this bytecode correctly.
2355 // The start address is exclusive and the end address inclusive.
2356 for (i::Address pc = offset_iterator->current_pc_start_offset() + 1;
2357 pc <= offset_iterator->current_pc_end_offset(); ++pc) {
2358 i::baseline::BytecodeOffsetIterator pc_lookup(bytecode_offsets,
2359 bytecodes);
2360 pc_lookup.AdvanceToPCOffset(pc);
2361 if (pc_lookup.current_bytecode_offset() !=
2362 bytecode_iterator.current_offset()) {
2363 ThrowError(isolate,
2364 "Baseline bytecode offset mismatch for PC lookup.");
2365 return;
2366 }
2367 }
2368 }
2369 bytecode_iterator.Advance();
2370 if (has_baseline && !bytecode_iterator.done()) {
2371 if (offset_iterator->done()) {
2372 ThrowError(isolate, "Missing bytecode(s) in baseline offset mapping.");
2373 return;
2374 }
2375 offset_iterator->Advance();
2376 }
2377 }
2378 if (has_baseline && !offset_iterator->done()) {
2379 ThrowError(isolate, "Excess offsets in baseline offset mapping.");
2380 return;
2381 }
2382}

2434
2435void Shell::SetPromiseHooks(const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
2436 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
2437 Isolate* isolate = info.GetIsolate();
2438 if (i::v8_flags.correctness_fuzzer_suppressions) {
2439 // Setting promise hoooks dynamically has unexpected timing side-effects
2440 // with certain promise optimizations. We might not get all callbacks for
2441 // previously scheduled Promises or optimized code-paths that skip Promise
2442 // creation.
2443 ThrowError(isolate,
2444 "d8.promise.setHooks is disabled with "
2445 "--correctness-fuzzer-suppressions");
2446 return;
2447 }
2448#ifdef V8_ENABLE_JAVASCRIPT_PROMISE_HOOKS
2449 Local<Context> context = isolate->GetCurrentContext();
2450 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
2451
2452 context->SetPromiseHooks(
2453 info[0]->IsFunction() ? info[0].As<Function>() : Local<Function>(),
2454 info[1]->IsFunction() ? info[1].As<Function>() : Local<Function>(),
2455 info[2]->IsFunction() ? info[2].As<Function>() : Local<Function>(),
2456 info[3]->IsFunction() ? info[3].As<Function>() : Local<Function>());
2457
2458 info.GetReturnValue().Set(v8::Undefined(isolate));
2459#else // V8_ENABLE_JAVASCRIPT_PROMISE_HOOKS
2460 ThrowError(isolate,
2461 "d8.promise.setHooks is disabled due to missing build flag "
2462 "v8_enabale_javascript_in_promise_hooks");
2463#endif // V8_ENABLE_JAVASCRIPT_PROMISE_HOOKS
2464}
2465
2466void Shell::SerializerSerialize(
2467 const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
2468 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
2469 Isolate* isolate = info.GetIsolate();
2470 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
2471 Local<Context> context = isolate->GetCurrentContext();
2472
2473 ValueSerializer serializer(isolate);
2474 serializer.WriteHeader();
2475 for (int i = 0; i < info.Length(); i++) {
2476 bool ok;
2477 if (!serializer.WriteValue(context, info[i]).To(&ok)) return;
2478 }
2479 Local<v8::ArrayBuffer> buffer;
2480 {
2481 std::pair<uint8_t*, size_t> pair = serializer.Release();
2482 buffer = ArrayBuffer::New(isolate, pair.second);
2483 memcpy(buffer->GetBackingStore()->Data(), pair.first, pair.second);
2484 free(pair.first);
2485 }
2486 info.GetReturnValue().Set(buffer);
2487}
2488
2489void Shell::SerializerDeserialize(
2490 const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
2491 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
2492 Isolate* isolate = info.GetIsolate();
2493 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
2494 Local<Context> context = isolate->GetCurrentContext();
2495
2496 if (!info[0]->IsArrayBuffer()) {
2497 ThrowError(isolate, "Can only deserialize from an ArrayBuffer");
2498 return;
2499 }
2500 std::shared_ptr<BackingStore> backing_store =
2501 info[0].As<ArrayBuffer>()->GetBackingStore();
2502 ValueDeserializer deserializer(
2503 isolate, static_cast<const uint8_t*>(backing_store->Data()),
2504 backing_store->ByteLength());
2505 bool ok;
2506 if (!deserializer.ReadHeader(context).To(&ok)) return;
2507 Local<Value> result;
2508 if (!deserializer.ReadValue(context).ToLocal(&result)) return;
2509 info.GetReturnValue().Set(result);
2510}
2511
2512void Shell::ProfilerSetOnProfileEndListener(
2513 const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
2514 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
2515 Isolate* isolate = info.GetIsolate();
2516 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
2517 if (!info[0]->IsFunction()) {
2518 ThrowError(isolate, "The OnProfileEnd listener has to be a function");
2519 return;
2520 }
2521 base::MutexGuard lock_guard(&profiler_end_callback_lock_);
2522 profiler_end_callback_[isolate] =
2523 std::make_pair(Global<Function>(isolate, info[0].As<Function>()),
2524 Global<Context>(isolate, isolate->GetCurrentContext()));
2525}
2526
2527bool Shell::HasOnProfileEndListener(Isolate* isolate) {
2528 base::MutexGuard lock_guard(&profiler_end_callback_lock_);
2529 return profiler_end_callback_.find(isolate) != profiler_end_callback_.end();
2530}
2531
2532void Shell::ResetOnProfileEndListener(Isolate* isolate) {
2533 // If the inspector is enabled, then the installed console is not the
2534 // D8Console.
2535 if (options.enable_inspector) return;
2536 {
2537 base::MutexGuard lock_guard(&profiler_end_callback_lock_);
2538 profiler_end_callback_.erase(isolate);
2539 }
2540
2541 i::Isolate* i_isolate = reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(isolate);
2542 D8Console* console =
2543 reinterpret_cast<D8Console*>(i_isolate->console_delegate());
2544 if (console) {
2545 console->DisposeProfiler();
2546 }
2547}
2548
2549void Shell::ProfilerTriggerSample(
2550 const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
2551 Isolate* isolate = info.GetIsolate();
2552 i::Isolate* i_isolate = reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(isolate);
2553 D8Console* console =
2554 reinterpret_cast<D8Console*>(i_isolate->console_delegate());
2555 if (console && console->profiler()) {
2556 console->profiler()->CollectSample(isolate);
2557 }
2558}
2559
2560void Shell::TriggerOnProfileEndListener(Isolate* isolate, std::string profile) {
2561 CHECK(HasOnProfileEndListener(isolate));
2562 Local<Function> callback;
2563 Local<Context> context;
2564 Local<Value> argv[1] = {
2565 String::NewFromUtf8(isolate, profile.c_str()).ToLocalChecked()};
2566 {
2567 base::MutexGuard lock_guard(&profiler_end_callback_lock_);
2568 auto& callback_pair = profiler_end_callback_[isolate];
2569 callback = callback_pair.first.Get(isolate);
2570 context = callback_pair.second.Get(isolate);
2571 }
2572 TryCatch try_catch(isolate);
2573 try_catch.SetVerbose(true);
2574 USE(callback->Call(context, Undefined(isolate), 1, argv));
2575}
2576
2577void WriteToFile(FILE* file, const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info,
2578 int first_arg_index = 0) {
2579 for (int i = first_arg_index; i < info.Length(); i++) {
2580 HandleScope handle_scope(info.GetIsolate());
2581 if (i != first_arg_index) {
2582 fprintf(file, " ");
2583 }
2584
2585 // Explicitly catch potential exceptions in toString().
2586 v8::TryCatch try_catch(info.GetIsolate());
2587 Local<Value> arg = info[i];
2588 Local<String> str_obj;
2589
2590 if (arg->IsSymbol()) {
2591 arg = arg.As<Symbol>()->Description(info.GetIsolate());
2592 }
2593 if (!arg->ToString(info.GetIsolate()->GetCurrentContext())
2594 .ToLocal(&str_obj)) {
2595 try_catch.ReThrow();
2596 return;
2597 }
2598
2599 v8::String::Utf8Value str(info.GetIsolate(), str_obj);
2600 int n = static_cast<int>(fwrite(*str, sizeof(**str), str.length(), file));
2601 if (n != str.length()) {
2602 printf("Error in fwrite\n");
2603 base::OS::ExitProcess(1);
2604 }
2605 }
2606}
2607
2608void WriteAndFlush(FILE* file,
2609 const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
2610 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
2611 WriteToFile(file, info);
2612 fprintf(file, "\n");
2613 fflush(file);
2614}
2615
2616void Shell::Print(const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
2617 WriteAndFlush(stdout, info);
2618}
2619
2620void Shell::PrintErr(const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
2621 WriteAndFlush(stderr, info);
2622}
2623
2624void Shell::WriteStdout(const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
2625 WriteToFile(stdout, info);
2626}
2627
2628// There are two overloads of writeFile().
2629//
2630// The first parameter is always the filename.
2631//
2632// If there are exactly 2 arguments, and the second argument is an ArrayBuffer
2633// or an ArrayBufferView, write the binary contents into the file.
2634//
2635// Otherwise, convert arguments to UTF-8 strings, and write them to the file,
2636// separated by space.
2637void Shell::WriteFile(const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
2638 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
2639 String::Utf8Value file_name(info.GetIsolate(), info[0]);
2640 if (*file_name == nullptr) {
2641 ThrowError(info.GetIsolate(), "Error converting filename to string");
2642 return;
2643 }
2644 FILE* file;
2645 if (info.Length() == 2 &&
2646 (info[1]->IsArrayBuffer() || info[1]->IsArrayBufferView())) {
2647 file = base::Fopen(*file_name, "wb");
2648 if (file == nullptr) {
2649 ThrowError(info.GetIsolate(), "Error opening file");
2650 return;
2651 }
2652
2653 void* data;
2654 size_t length;
2655 if (info[1]->IsArrayBuffer()) {
2656 Local<v8::ArrayBuffer> buffer = Local<v8::ArrayBuffer>::Cast(info[1]);
2657 length = buffer->ByteLength();
2658 data = buffer->Data();
2659 } else {
2660 Local<v8::ArrayBufferView> buffer_view =
2661 Local<v8::ArrayBufferView>::Cast(info[1]);
2662 length = buffer_view->ByteLength();
2663 data = static_cast<uint8_t*>(buffer_view->Buffer()->Data()) +
2664 buffer_view->ByteOffset();
2665 }
2666 fwrite(data, 1, length, file);
2667 } else {
2668 file = base::Fopen(*file_name, "w");
2669 if (file == nullptr) {
2670 ThrowError(info.GetIsolate(), "Error opening file");
2671 return;
2672 }
2673 WriteToFile(file, info, 1);
2674 }
2675 base::Fclose(file);
2676}
2677
2678void Shell::ReadFile(const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
2679 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
2680 String::Utf8Value file_name(info.GetIsolate(), info[0]);
2681 if (*file_name == nullptr) {
2682 ThrowError(info.GetIsolate(), "Error converting filename to string");
2683 return;
2684 }
2685 if (info.Length() == 2) {
2686 String::Utf8Value format(info.GetIsolate(), info[1]);
2687 if (*format && std::strcmp(*format, "binary") == 0) {
2688 ReadBuffer(info);
2689 return;
2690 }
2691 }
2692 Local<String> source;
2693 if (!ReadFile(info.GetIsolate(), *file_name).ToLocal(&source)) return;
2694 info.GetReturnValue().Set(source);
2695}
2696
2697Local<String> Shell::ReadFromStdin(Isolate* isolate) {
2698 static const int kBufferSize = 256;
2699 char buffer[kBufferSize];
2700 Local<String> accumulator = String::NewFromUtf8Literal(isolate, "");
2701 int length;
2702 // Flush stdout before reading stdin, as stdout isn't guaranteed to be flushed
2703 // automatically.
2704 fflush(stdout);
2705 while (true) {
2706 // Continue reading if the line ends with an escape '\\' or the line has
2707 // not been fully read into the buffer yet (does not end with '\n').
2708 // If fgets gets an error, just give up.
2709 char* input = nullptr;
2710 input = fgets(buffer, kBufferSize, stdin);
2711 if (input == nullptr) return Local<String>();
2712 length = static_cast<int>(strlen(buffer));
2713 if (length == 0) {
2714 return accumulator;
2715 } else if (buffer[length - 1] != '\n') {
2716 accumulator = String::Concat(
2717 isolate, accumulator,
2718 String::NewFromUtf8(isolate, buffer, NewStringType::kNormal, length)
2719 .ToLocalChecked());
2720 } else if (length > 1 && buffer[length - 2] == '\\') {
2721 buffer[length - 2] = '\n';
2722 accumulator =
2723 String::Concat(isolate, accumulator,
2724 String::NewFromUtf8(isolate, buffer,
2725 NewStringType::kNormal, length - 1)
2726 .ToLocalChecked());
2727 } else {
2728 return String::Concat(
2729 isolate, accumulator,
2730 String::NewFromUtf8(isolate, buffer, NewStringType::kNormal,
2731 length - 1)
2732 .ToLocalChecked());
2733 }
2734 }
2735}
2736
2737void Shell::ExecuteFile(const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
2738 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
2739 Isolate* isolate = info.GetIsolate();
2740 for (int i = 0; i < info.Length(); i++) {
2741 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
2742 String::Utf8Value file_name(isolate, info[i]);
2743 if (*file_name == nullptr) {
2744 std::ostringstream oss;
2745 oss << "Cannot convert file[" << i << "] name to string.";
2746 ThrowError(
2747 isolate,
2748 String::NewFromUtf8(isolate, oss.str().c_str()).ToLocalChecked());
2749 return;
2750 }
2751 Local<String> source;
2752 if (!ReadFile(isolate, *file_name).ToLocal(&source)) return;
2753 if (!ExecuteString(
2754 info.GetIsolate(), source,
2755 String::NewFromUtf8(isolate, *file_name).ToLocalChecked(),
2756 options.quiet_load ? kNoReportExceptions : kReportExceptions)) {
2757 std::ostringstream oss;
2758 oss << "Error executing file: \"" << *file_name << '"';
2759 ThrowError(
2760 isolate,
2761 String::NewFromUtf8(isolate, oss.str().c_str()).ToLocalChecked());
2762 return;
2763 }
2764 }
2765}
2766
2767void Shell::SetTimeout(const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
2768 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
2769 Isolate* isolate = info.GetIsolate();
2770 info.GetReturnValue().Set(v8::Number::New(isolate, 0));
2771 if (info.Length() == 0 || !info[0]->IsFunction()) return;
2772 Local<Function> callback = info[0].As<Function>();
2773 Local<Context> context = isolate->GetCurrentContext();
2774 PerIsolateData::Get(isolate)->SetTimeout(callback, context);
2775}
2776
2777void Shell::ReadCodeTypeAndArguments(
2778 const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info, int index,
2779 CodeType* code_type, Local<Value>* arguments) {
2780 Isolate* isolate = info.GetIsolate();
2781 if (info.Length() > index && info[index]->IsObject()) {
2782 Local<Object> object = info[index].As<Object>();
2783 Local<Context> context = isolate->GetCurrentContext();
2784 Local<Value> value;
2785 if (!TryGetValue(isolate, context, object, "type").ToLocal(&value)) {
2786 *code_type = CodeType::kNone;
2787 return;
2788 }
2789 if (!value->IsString()) {
2790 *code_type = CodeType::kInvalid;
2791 return;
2792 }
2793 Local<String> worker_type_string =
2794 value->ToString(context).ToLocalChecked();
2795 String::Utf8Value str(isolate, worker_type_string);
2796 if (strcmp("classic", *str) == 0) {
2797 *code_type = CodeType::kFileName;
2798 } else if (strcmp("string", *str) == 0) {
2799 *code_type = CodeType::kString;
2800 } else if (strcmp("function", *str) == 0) {
2801 *code_type = CodeType::kFunction;
2802 } else {
2803 *code_type = CodeType::kInvalid;
2804 }
2805 if (arguments != nullptr) {
2806 bool got_arguments =
2807 TryGetValue(isolate, context, object, "arguments").ToLocal(arguments);
2808 USE(got_arguments);
2809 }
2810 } else {
2811 *code_type = CodeType::kNone;
2812 }
2813}
2814
2815bool Shell::FunctionAndArgumentsToString(Local<Function> function,
2816 Local<Value> arguments,
2817 Local<String>* source,
2818 Isolate* isolate) {
2819 Local<Context> context = isolate->GetCurrentContext();
2820 MaybeLocal<String> maybe_function_string =
2821 function->FunctionProtoToString(context);
2822 Local<String> function_string;
2823 if (!maybe_function_string.ToLocal(&function_string)) {
2824 ThrowError(isolate, "Failed to convert function to string");
2825 return false;
2826 }
2827 *source = String::NewFromUtf8Literal(isolate, "(");
2828 *source = String::Concat(isolate, *source, function_string);
2829 Local<String> middle = String::NewFromUtf8Literal(isolate, ")(");
2830 *source = String::Concat(isolate, *source, middle);
2831 if (!arguments.IsEmpty() && !arguments->IsUndefined()) {
2832 if (!arguments->IsArray()) {
2833 ThrowError(isolate, "'arguments' must be an array");
2834 return false;
2835 }
2836 Local<String> comma = String::NewFromUtf8Literal(isolate, ",");
2837 Local<Array> array = arguments.As<Array>();
2838 for (uint32_t i = 0; i < array->Length(); ++i) {
2839 if (i > 0) {
2840 *source = String::Concat(isolate, *source, comma);
2841 }
2842 MaybeLocal<Value> maybe_argument = array->Get(context, i);
2843 Local<Value> argument;
2844 if (!maybe_argument.ToLocal(&argument)) {
2845 ThrowError(isolate, "Failed to get argument");
2846 return false;
2847 }
2848 Local<String> argument_string;
2849 if (!JSON::Stringify(context, argument).ToLocal(&argument_string)) {
2850 ThrowError(isolate, "Failed to convert argument to string");
2851 return false;
2852 }
2853 *source = String::Concat(isolate, *source, argument_string);
2854 }
2855 }
2856 Local<String> suffix = String::NewFromUtf8Literal(isolate, ")");
2857 *source = String::Concat(isolate, *source, suffix);
2858 return true;
2859}
2860
2861// ReadSource() supports reading source code through `info[index]` as specified
2862// by the `default_type` or an optional options bag provided in `info[index+1]`
2863// (e.g. `options={type: 'code_type', arguments:[...]}`).
2864MaybeLocal<String> Shell::ReadSource(
2865 const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info, int index,
2866 CodeType default_type) {
2867 CodeType code_type;
2868 Local<Value> arguments;
2869 ReadCodeTypeAndArguments(info, index + 1, &code_type, &arguments);
2870
2871 Isolate* isolate = info.GetIsolate();
2872 Local<String> source;
2873 if (code_type == CodeType::kNone) {
2874 code_type = default_type;
2875 }
2876 switch (code_type) {
2877 case CodeType::kFunction:
2878 if (!info[index]->IsFunction()) {
2879 return MaybeLocal<String>();
2880 }
2881 // Source: ( function_to_string )( params )
2882 if (!FunctionAndArgumentsToString(info[index].As<Function>(), arguments,
2883 &source, isolate)) {
2884 return MaybeLocal<String>();
2885 }
2886 break;
2887 case CodeType::kFileName: {
2888 if (!info[index]->IsString()) {
2889 return MaybeLocal<String>();
2890 }
2891 String::Utf8Value filename(isolate, info[index]);
2892 if (!Shell::ReadFile(isolate, *filename).ToLocal(&source)) {
2893 return MaybeLocal<String>();
2894 }
2895 break;
2896 }
2897 case CodeType::kString:
2898 if (!info[index]->IsString()) {
2899 return MaybeLocal<String>();
2900 }
2901 source = info[index].As<String>();
2902 break;
2903 case CodeType::kNone:
2904 case CodeType::kInvalid:
2905 return MaybeLocal<String>();
2906 }
2907 return source;
2908}
2909
2910void Shell::WorkerNew(const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
2911 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
2912 Isolate* isolate = info.GetIsolate();
2913 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
2914 if (info.Length() < 1 || (!info[0]->IsString() && !info[0]->IsFunction())) {
2915 ThrowError(isolate, "1st argument must be a string or a function");
2916 return;
2917 }
2918
2919 Local<String> source;
2920 if (!ReadSource(info, 0, CodeType::kFileName).ToLocal(&source)) {
2921 ThrowError(isolate, "Invalid argument");
2922 return;
2923 }
2924
2925 if (!info.IsConstructCall()) {
2926 ThrowError(isolate, "Worker must be constructed with new");
2927 return;
2928 }
2929
2930 // Initialize the embedder field to 0; if we return early without
2931 // creating a new Worker (because the main thread is terminating) we can
2932 // early-out from the instance calls.
2933 info.This()->SetInternalField(0, v8::Integer::New(isolate, 0));
2934
2935 {
2936 // Don't allow workers to create more workers if the main thread
2937 // is waiting for existing running workers to terminate.
2938 i::ParkedMutexGuard lock_guard(
2939 reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(isolate)->main_thread_local_isolate(),
2940 workers_mutex_.Pointer());
2941 if (!allow_new_workers_) return;
2942
2943 String::Utf8Value script(isolate, source);
2944 if (!*script) {
2945 ThrowError(isolate, "Can't get worker script");
2946 return;
2947 }
2948
2949 // The C++ worker object's lifetime is shared between the Managed<Worker>
2950 // object on the heap, which the JavaScript object points to, and an
2951 // internal std::shared_ptr in the worker thread itself.
2952 auto worker = std::make_shared<Worker>(*script);
2953 i::Isolate* i_isolate = reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(isolate);
2954 const size_t kWorkerSizeEstimate = 4 * 1024 * 1024; // stack + heap.
2955 i::Handle<i::Object> managed = i::Managed<Worker>::FromSharedPtr(
2956 i_isolate, kWorkerSizeEstimate, worker);
2957 info.This()->SetInternalField(0, Utils::ToLocal(managed));
2958 base::Thread::Priority priority =
2959 options.apply_priority ? base::Thread::Priority::kUserBlocking
2960 : base::Thread::Priority::kDefault;
2961 if (!Worker::StartWorkerThread(isolate, std::move(worker), priority)) {
2962 ThrowError(isolate, "Can't start thread");
2963 return;
2964 }
2965 }
2966}
2967
2968void Shell::WorkerPostMessage(const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
2969 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
2970 Isolate* isolate = info.GetIsolate();
2971 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
2972
2973 if (info.Length() < 1) {
2974 ThrowError(isolate, "Invalid argument");
2975 return;
2976 }
2977
2978 std::shared_ptr<Worker> worker =
2979 GetWorkerFromInternalField(isolate, info.This());
2980 if (!worker.get()) {
2981 return;
2982 }
2983
2984 Local<Value> message = info[0];
2985 Local<Value> transfer =
2986 info.Length() >= 2 ? info[1] : Undefined(isolate).As<Value>();
2987 std::unique_ptr<SerializationData> data =
2988 Shell::SerializeValue(isolate, message, transfer);
2989 if (data) {
2990 worker->PostMessage(std::move(data));
2991 }
2992}
2993
2994void Shell::WorkerGetMessage(const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
2995 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
2996 Isolate* isolate = info.GetIsolate();
2997 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
2998 std::shared_ptr<Worker> worker =
2999 GetWorkerFromInternalField(isolate, info.This());
3000 if (!worker.get()) {
3001 return;
3002 }
3003
3004 std::unique_ptr<SerializationData> data = worker->GetMessage(isolate);
3005 if (data) {
3006 Local<Value> value;
3007 if (Shell::DeserializeValue(isolate, std::move(data)).ToLocal(&value)) {
3008 info.GetReturnValue().Set(value);
3009 }
3010 }
3011}
3012
3013void Shell::WorkerTerminate(const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
3014 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
3015 Isolate* isolate = info.GetIsolate();
3016 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
3017 std::shared_ptr<Worker> worker =
3018 GetWorkerFromInternalField(isolate, info.This());
3019 if (!worker.get()) return;
3020 worker->Terminate();
3021}
3022
3023void Shell::WorkerTerminateAndWait(
3024 const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
3025 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
3026 Isolate* isolate = info.GetIsolate();
3027 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
3028 std::shared_ptr<Worker> worker =
3029 GetWorkerFromInternalField(isolate, info.This());
3030 if (!worker.get()) {
3031 return;
3032 }
3033
3034 reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(isolate)
3035 ->main_thread_local_isolate()
3036 ->BlockMainThreadWhileParked([worker](const i::ParkedScope& parked) {
3037 worker->TerminateAndWaitForThread(parked);
3038 });
3039}
3040
3041void Shell::QuitOnce(v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>* info) {
3042 int exit_code = (*info)[0]
3043 ->Int32Value(info->GetIsolate()->GetCurrentContext())
3044 .FromMaybe(0);
3045 Isolate* isolate = info->GetIsolate();
3046 ResetOnProfileEndListener(isolate);
3047 isolate->Exit();
3048
3049 // As we exit the process anyway, we do not dispose the platform and other
3050 // global data and manually unlock to quell DCHECKs. Other isolates might
3051 // still be running, so disposing here can cause them to crash.
3052 i::Isolate* i_isolate = reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(isolate);
3053 if (i_isolate->thread_manager()->IsLockedByCurrentThread()) {
3054 i_isolate->thread_manager()->Unlock();
3055 }
3056
3057 // When disposing the shared space isolate, the workers (client isolates) need
3058 // to be terminated first.
3059 if (i_isolate->is_shared_space_isolate()) {
3060 i_isolate->main_thread_local_isolate()->BlockMainThreadWhileParked(
3061 [](const i::ParkedScope& parked) { WaitForRunningWorkers(parked); });
3062 }
3063
3064 OnExit(isolate, false);
3065 base::OS::ExitProcess(exit_code);
3066}
3067
3068void Shell::Terminate(const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
3069 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
3070 // Triggering termination from JS can cause some non-determinism thus we
3071 // skip it for correctness fuzzing.
3072 // Termination also currently breaks Fuzzilli's REPRL mechanism as the
3073 // scheduled termination will prevent the next testcase sent by Fuzzilli from
3074 // being processed. This will in turn desynchronize the communication
3075 // between d8 and Fuzzilli, leading to a crash.
3076 if (!i::v8_flags.correctness_fuzzer_suppressions && !fuzzilli_reprl) {
3077 auto v8_isolate = info.GetIsolate();
3078 if (!v8_isolate->IsExecutionTerminating()) v8_isolate->TerminateExecution();
3079 }
3080}
3081
3082void Shell::Quit(const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
3083 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
3084 base::CallOnce(&quit_once_, &QuitOnce,
3085 const_cast<v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>*>(&info));
3086}
3087
3088void Shell::Version(const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
3089 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
3090 info.GetReturnValue().Set(
3091 String::NewFromUtf8(info.GetIsolate(), V8::GetVersion())
3092 .ToLocalChecked());
3093}
3094
3095void Shell::ReportException(Isolate* isolate, Local<v8::Message> message,
3096 Local<v8::Value> exception_obj) {
3097 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
3098 Local<Context> context = isolate->GetCurrentContext();
3099 bool enter_context = context.IsEmpty();
3100 if (enter_context) {
3101 context = Local<Context>::New(isolate, evaluation_context_);
3102 context->Enter();
3103 }
3104 // Converts a V8 value to a C string.
3105 auto ToCString = [](const v8::String::Utf8Value& value) {
3106 return *value ? *value : "<string conversion failed>";
3107 };
3108
3109 v8::String::Utf8Value exception(isolate, exception_obj);
3110 const char* exception_string = ToCString(exception);
3111 if (message.IsEmpty()) {
3112 // V8 didn't provide any extra information about this error; just
3113 // print the exception.
3114 printf("%s\n", exception_string);
3115 } else if (message->GetScriptOrigin().Options().IsWasm()) {
3116 // Print wasm-function[(function index)]:(offset): (message).
3117 int function_index = message->GetWasmFunctionIndex();
3118 int offset = message->GetStartColumn(context).FromJust();
3119 printf("wasm-function[%d]:0x%x: %s\n", function_index, offset,
3120 exception_string);
3121 } else {
3122 // Print (filename):(line number): (message).
3123 v8::String::Utf8Value filename(isolate,
3124 message->GetScriptOrigin().ResourceName());
3125 const char* filename_string = ToCString(filename);
3126 int linenum = message->GetLineNumber(context).FromMaybe(-1);
3127 printf("%s:%i: %s\n", filename_string, linenum, exception_string);
3128 Local<String> sourceline;
3129 if (message->GetSourceLine(context).ToLocal(&sourceline)) {
3130 // Print line of source code.
3131 v8::String::Utf8Value sourcelinevalue(isolate, sourceline);
3132 const char* sourceline_string = ToCString(sourcelinevalue);
3133 printf("%s\n", sourceline_string);
3134 // Print wavy underline (GetUnderline is deprecated).
3135 int start = message->GetStartColumn(context).FromJust();
3136 for (int i = 0; i < start; i++) {
3137 printf(" ");
3138 }
3139 int end = message->GetEndColumn(context).FromJust();
3140 for (int i = start; i < end; i++) {
3141 printf("^");
3142 }
3143 printf("\n");
3144 }
3145 }
3146 Local<Value> stack_trace_string;
3147 if (v8::TryCatch::StackTrace(context, exception_obj)
3148 .ToLocal(&stack_trace_string) &&
3149 stack_trace_string->IsString()) {
3150 v8::String::Utf8Value stack_trace(isolate, stack_trace_string.As<String>());
3151 printf("%s\n", ToCString(stack_trace));
3152 }
3153 printf("\n");
3154 if (enter_context) context->Exit();
3155}
3156
3157void Shell::ReportException(v8::Isolate* isolate,
3158 const v8::TryCatch& try_catch) {
3159 if (isolate->IsExecutionTerminating()) {
3160 printf("Got Execution Termination Exception\n");
3161 } else {
3162 ReportException(isolate, try_catch.Message(), try_catch.Exception());
3163 }
3164}
3165
3166void Counter::Bind(const char* name, bool is_histogram) {
3167 base::OS::StrNCpy(name_, kMaxNameSize, name, kMaxNameSize);
3168 // Explicitly null-terminate, in case {name} is longer than {kMaxNameSize}.
3169 name_[kMaxNameSize - 1] = '\0';
3170 is_histogram_ = is_histogram;
3171}
3172
3173void Counter::AddSample(int sample) {
3174 count_.fetch_add(1, std::memory_order_relaxed);
3175 sample_total_.fetch_add(sample, std::memory_order_relaxed);
3176}
3177
3178CounterCollection::CounterCollection() {
3179 magic_number_ = 0xDEADFACE;
3180 max_counters_ = kMaxCounters;
3181 max_name_size_ = Counter::kMaxNameSize;
3182 counters_in_use_ = 0;
3183}
3184
3185Counter* CounterCollection::GetNextCounter() {
3186 if (counters_in_use_ == kMaxCounters) return nullptr;
3187 return &counters_[counters_in_use_++];
3188}
3189
3190void Shell::MapCounters(v8::Isolate* isolate, const char* name) {
3191 counters_file_ = base::OS::MemoryMappedFile::create(
3192 name, sizeof(CounterCollection), &local_counters_);
3193 void* memory =
3194 (counters_file_ == nullptr) ? nullptr : counters_file_->memory();
3195 if (memory == nullptr) {
3196 printf("Could not map counters file %s\n", name);
3197 base::OS::ExitProcess(1);
3198 }
3199 counters_ = static_cast<CounterCollection*>(memory);
3200 isolate->SetCounterFunction(LookupCounter);
3201 isolate->SetCreateHistogramFunction(CreateHistogram);
3202 isolate->SetAddHistogramSampleFunction(AddHistogramSample);
3203}
3204
3205Counter* Shell::GetCounter(const char* name, bool is_histogram) {
3206 Counter* counter = nullptr;
3207 {
3208 base::SharedMutexGuard<base::kShared> mutex_guard(&counter_mutex_);
3209 auto map_entry = counter_map_->find(name);
3210 if (map_entry != counter_map_->end()) {
3211 counter = map_entry->second;
3212 }
3213 }
3214
3215 if (counter == nullptr) {
3216 base::SharedMutexGuard<base::kExclusive> mutex_guard(&counter_mutex_);
3217
3218 counter = (*counter_map_)[name];
3219
3220 if (counter == nullptr) {
3221 counter = counters_->GetNextCounter();
3222 if (counter == nullptr) {
3223 // Too many counters.
3224 return nullptr;
3225 }
3226 (*counter_map_)[name] = counter;
3227 counter->Bind(name, is_histogram);
3228 }
3229 }
3230
3231 DCHECK_EQ(is_histogram, counter->is_histogram());
3232 return counter;
3233}
3234
3235int* Shell::LookupCounter(const char* name) {
3236 Counter* counter = GetCounter(name, false);
3237 return counter ? counter->ptr() : nullptr;
3238}
3239
3240void* Shell::CreateHistogram(const char* name, int min, int max,
3241 size_t buckets) {
3242 return GetCounter(name, true);
3243}
3244
3245void Shell::AddHistogramSample(void* histogram, int sample) {
3246 Counter* counter = reinterpret_cast<Counter*>(histogram);
3247 counter->AddSample(sample);
3248}

3250// Turn a value into a human-readable string.
3251Local<String> Shell::Stringify(Isolate* isolate, Local<Value> value) {
3252 v8::Local<v8::Context> context =
3253 v8::Local<v8::Context>::New(isolate, evaluation_context_);
3254 if (stringify_function_.IsEmpty()) {
3255 Local<String> source =
3256 String::NewFromUtf8(isolate, stringify_source_).ToLocalChecked();
3257 Local<String> name = String::NewFromUtf8Literal(isolate, "d8-stringify");
3258 ScriptOrigin origin(name);
3259 Local<Script> script =
3260 Script::Compile(context, source, &origin).ToLocalChecked();
3261 stringify_function_.Reset(
3262 isolate, script->Run(context).ToLocalChecked().As<Function>());
3263 }
3264 Local<Function> fun = Local<Function>::New(isolate, stringify_function_);
3265 Local<Value> argv[1] = {value};
3266 v8::TryCatch try_catch(isolate);
3267 MaybeLocal<Value> result = fun->Call(context, Undefined(isolate), 1, argv);
3268 if (result.IsEmpty()) return String::Empty(isolate);
3269 return result.ToLocalChecked().As<String>();
3270}

3273 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
3274 v8::Isolate* isolate = info.GetIsolate();
3275
3276 info.GetReturnValue().Set(v8::Number::New(isolate, 1));
3277}

3604
3605static void PrintMessageCallback(Local<Message> message, Local<Value> error) {
3606 switch (message->ErrorLevel()) {
3607 case v8::Isolate::kMessageWarning:
3608 case v8::Isolate::kMessageLog:
3609 case v8::Isolate::kMessageInfo:
3610 case v8::Isolate::kMessageDebug: {
3611 break;
3612 }
3613
3614 case v8::Isolate::kMessageError: {
3615 Shell::ReportException(message->GetIsolate(), message, error);
3616 return;
3617 }
3618
3619 default: {
3620 UNREACHABLE();
3621 }
3622 }
3623 // Converts a V8 value to a C string.
3624 auto ToCString = [](const v8::String::Utf8Value& value) {
3625 return *value ? *value : "<string conversion failed>";
3626 };
3627 Isolate* isolate = message->GetIsolate();
3628 v8::String::Utf8Value msg(isolate, message->Get());
3629 const char* msg_string = ToCString(msg);
3630 // Print (filename):(line number): (message).
3631 v8::String::Utf8Value filename(isolate,
3632 message->GetScriptOrigin().ResourceName());
3633 const char* filename_string = ToCString(filename);
3634 Maybe<int> maybeline = message->GetLineNumber(isolate->GetCurrentContext());
3635 int linenum = maybeline.IsJust() ? maybeline.FromJust() : -1;
3636 printf("%s:%i: %s\n", filename_string, linenum, msg_string);
3637}
3638
3639void Shell::PromiseRejectCallback(v8::PromiseRejectMessage data) {
3640 if (options.ignore_unhandled_promises) return;
3641 if (data.GetEvent() == v8::kPromiseRejectAfterResolved ||
3642 data.GetEvent() == v8::kPromiseResolveAfterResolved) {
3643 // Ignore reject/resolve after resolved.
3644 return;
3645 }
3646 v8::Local<v8::Promise> promise = data.GetPromise();
3647 v8::Isolate* isolate = promise->GetIsolate();
3648 PerIsolateData* isolate_data = PerIsolateData::Get(isolate);
3649
3650 if (data.GetEvent() == v8::kPromiseHandlerAddedAfterReject) {
3651 isolate_data->RemoveUnhandledPromise(promise);
3652 return;
3653 }
3654
3655 i::Isolate* i_isolate = reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(isolate);
3656 bool capture_exceptions =
3657 i_isolate->get_capture_stack_trace_for_uncaught_exceptions();
3658 isolate->SetCaptureStackTraceForUncaughtExceptions(true);
3659 v8::Local<Value> exception = data.GetValue();
3660 v8::Local<Message> message;
3661 // Assume that all objects are stack-traces.
3662 if (exception->IsObject()) {
3663 message = v8::Exception::CreateMessage(isolate, exception);
3664 }
3665 if (!exception->IsNativeError() &&
3666 (message.IsEmpty() || message->GetStackTrace().IsEmpty())) {
3667 // If there is no real Error object, manually create a stack trace.
3668 exception = v8::Exception::Error(
3669 v8::String::NewFromUtf8Literal(isolate, "Unhandled Promise."));
3670 message = Exception::CreateMessage(isolate, exception);
3671 }
3672 isolate->SetCaptureStackTraceForUncaughtExceptions(capture_exceptions);
3673
3674 isolate_data->AddUnhandledPromise(promise, message, exception);
3675}
3676
3677void Shell::Initialize(Isolate* isolate, D8Console* console,
3678 bool isOnMainThread) {
3679 isolate->SetPromiseRejectCallback(PromiseRejectCallback);
3680 isolate->SetWasmAsyncResolvePromiseCallback(
3681 D8WasmAsyncResolvePromiseCallback);
3682 if (isOnMainThread) {
3683 // Set up counters
3684 if (i::v8_flags.map_counters[0] != '\0') {
3685 MapCounters(isolate, i::v8_flags.map_counters);
3686 }
3687 // Disable default message reporting.
3688 isolate->AddMessageListenerWithErrorLevel(
3689 PrintMessageCallback,
3690 v8::Isolate::kMessageError | v8::Isolate::kMessageWarning |
3691 v8::Isolate::kMessageInfo | v8::Isolate::kMessageDebug |
3692 v8::Isolate::kMessageLog);
3693 }
3694
3695 isolate->SetHostImportModuleDynamicallyCallback(
3696 Shell::HostImportModuleDynamically);
3697 isolate->SetHostInitializeImportMetaObjectCallback(
3698 Shell::HostInitializeImportMetaObject);
3699 isolate->SetHostCreateShadowRealmContextCallback(
3700 Shell::HostCreateShadowRealmContext);
3701
3702 debug::SetConsoleDelegate(isolate, console);
3703}
3704
3705Local<String> Shell::WasmLoadSourceMapCallback(Isolate* isolate,
3706 const char* path) {
3707 return Shell::ReadFile(isolate, path, false).ToLocalChecked();
3708}
3709
3710MaybeLocal<Context> Shell::CreateEvaluationContext(Isolate* isolate) {
3711 // This needs to be a critical section since this is not thread-safe
3712 i::ParkedMutexGuard lock_guard(
3713 reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(isolate)->main_thread_local_isolate(),
3714 context_mutex_.Pointer());
3715 // Initialize the global objects
3716 Local<ObjectTemplate> global_template = CreateGlobalTemplate(isolate);
3717 EscapableHandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
3718 Local<Context> context = Context::New(isolate, nullptr, global_template);
3719 if (context.IsEmpty()) {
3720 DCHECK(isolate->IsExecutionTerminating());
3721 return {};
3722 }
3723 if (i::v8_flags.perf_prof_annotate_wasm ||
3724 i::v8_flags.vtune_prof_annotate_wasm) {
3725 isolate->SetWasmLoadSourceMapCallback(Shell::WasmLoadSourceMapCallback);
3726 }
3727 InitializeModuleEmbedderData(context);
3728 Context::Scope scope(context);
3729 if (options.include_arguments) {
3730 const std::vector<const char*>& args = options.arguments;
3731 int size = static_cast<int>(args.size());
3732 Local<Array> array = Array::New(isolate, size);
3733 for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
3734 Local<String> arg =
3735 v8::String::NewFromUtf8(isolate, args[i]).ToLocalChecked();
3736 Local<Number> index = v8::Number::New(isolate, i);
3737 array->Set(context, index, arg).FromJust();
3738 }
3739 Local<String> name = String::NewFromUtf8Literal(
3740 isolate, "arguments", NewStringType::kInternalized);
3741 context->Global()->Set(context, name, array).FromJust();
3742 }
3743 {
3744 // setup console global.
3745 Local<String> name = String::NewFromUtf8Literal(
3746 isolate, "console", NewStringType::kInternalized);
3747 Local<Value> console =
3748 context->GetExtrasBindingObject()->Get(context, name).ToLocalChecked();
3749 context->Global()->Set(context, name, console).FromJust();
3750 }
3751
3752 return handle_scope.Escape(context);
3753}
3754
3755void Shell::WriteIgnitionDispatchCountersFile(v8::Isolate* isolate) {
3756 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
3757 Local<Context> context = Context::New(isolate);
3758 Context::Scope context_scope(context);
3759
3760 i::Handle<i::JSObject> dispatch_counters =
3761 reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(isolate)
3762 ->interpreter()
3763 ->GetDispatchCountersObject();
3764 std::ofstream dispatch_counters_stream(
3765 i::v8_flags.trace_ignition_dispatches_output_file);
3766 dispatch_counters_stream << *String::Utf8Value(
3767 isolate, JSON::Stringify(context, Utils::ToLocal(dispatch_counters))
3768 .ToLocalChecked());
3769}

3771namespace {
3772int LineFromOffset(Local<debug::Script> script, int offset) {
3773 debug::Location location = script->GetSourceLocation(offset);
3774 return location.GetLineNumber();
3775}
3776
3777void WriteLcovDataForRange(std::vector<uint32_t>* lines, int start_line,
3778 int end_line, uint32_t count) {
3779 // Ensure space in the array.
3780 lines->resize(std::max(static_cast<size_t>(end_line + 1), lines->size()), 0);
3781 // Boundary lines could be shared between two functions with different
3782 // invocation counts. Take the maximum.
3783 (*lines)[start_line] = std::max((*lines)[start_line], count);
3784 (*lines)[end_line] = std::max((*lines)[end_line], count);
3785 // Invocation counts for non-boundary lines are overwritten.
3786 for (int k = start_line + 1; k < end_line; k++) (*lines)[k] = count;
3787}
3788
3789void WriteLcovDataForNamedRange(std::ostream& sink,
3790 std::vector<uint32_t>* lines,
3791 const std::string& name, int start_line,
3792 int end_line, uint32_t count) {
3793 WriteLcovDataForRange(lines, start_line, end_line, count);
3794 sink << "FN:" << start_line + 1 << "," << name << std::endl;
3795 sink << "FNDA:" << count << "," << name << std::endl;
3796}
3797} // namespace
3798
3799// Write coverage data in LCOV format. See man page for geninfo(1).
3800void Shell::WriteLcovData(v8::Isolate* isolate, const char* file) {
3801 if (!file) return;
3802 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
3803 debug::Coverage coverage = debug::Coverage::CollectPrecise(isolate);
3804 std::ofstream sink(file, std::ofstream::app);
3805 for (size_t i = 0; i < coverage.ScriptCount(); i++) {
3806 debug::Coverage::ScriptData script_data = coverage.GetScriptData(i);
3807 Local<debug::Script> script = script_data.GetScript();
3808 // Skip unnamed scripts.
3809 Local<String> name;
3810 if (!script->Name().ToLocal(&name)) continue;
3811 std::string file_name = ToSTLString(isolate, name);
3812 // Skip scripts not backed by a file.
3813 if (!std::ifstream(file_name).good()) continue;
3814 sink << "SF:";
3815 sink << NormalizePath(file_name, GetWorkingDirectory()) << std::endl;
3816 std::vector<uint32_t> lines;
3817 for (size_t j = 0; j < script_data.FunctionCount(); j++) {
3818 debug::Coverage::FunctionData function_data =
3819 script_data.GetFunctionData(j);
3820
3821 // Write function stats.
3822 {
3823 debug::Location start =
3824 script->GetSourceLocation(function_data.StartOffset());
3825 debug::Location end =
3826 script->GetSourceLocation(function_data.EndOffset());
3827 int start_line = start.GetLineNumber();
3828 int end_line = end.GetLineNumber();
3829 uint32_t count = function_data.Count();
3830
3831 Local<String> function_name;
3832 std::stringstream name_stream;
3833 if (function_data.Name().ToLocal(&function_name)) {
3834 name_stream << ToSTLString(isolate, function_name);
3835 } else {
3836 name_stream << "<" << start_line + 1 << "-";
3837 name_stream << start.GetColumnNumber() << ">";
3838 }
3839
3840 WriteLcovDataForNamedRange(sink, &lines, name_stream.str(), start_line,
3841 end_line, count);
3842 }
3843
3844 // Process inner blocks.
3845 for (size_t k = 0; k < function_data.BlockCount(); k++) {
3846 debug::Coverage::BlockData block_data = function_data.GetBlockData(k);
3847 int start_line = LineFromOffset(script, block_data.StartOffset());
3848 int end_line = LineFromOffset(script, block_data.EndOffset() - 1);
3849 uint32_t count = block_data.Count();
3850 WriteLcovDataForRange(&lines, start_line, end_line, count);
3851 }
3852 }
3853 // Write per-line coverage. LCOV uses 1-based line numbers.
3854 for (size_t j = 0; j < lines.size(); j++) {
3855 sink << "DA:" << (j + 1) << "," << lines[j] << std::endl;
3856 }
3857 sink << "end_of_record" << std::endl;
3858 }
3859}
3860
3861void Shell::OnExit(v8::Isolate* isolate, bool dispose) {
3862 platform::NotifyIsolateShutdown(g_default_platform, isolate);
3863
3864 if (Worker* worker = Worker::GetCurrentWorker()) {
3865 // When invoking `quit` on a worker isolate, the worker needs to reach
3866 // State::kTerminated before invoking Isolate::Dispose. This is because the
3867 // main thread tries to terminate all workers at the end, which can happen
3868 // concurrently to Isolate::Dispose.
3869 worker->EnterTerminatedState();
3870 }
3871
3872 if (dispose) {
3873 isolate->Dispose();
3874 } else {
3875 // Normally, Dispose() prints counters. Benchmarks expect counters to be
3876 // printed on process exit, so do so manually if not disposing.
3877 isolate->DumpAndResetStats();
3878 }
3879
3880 // Simulate errors before disposing V8, as that resets flags (via
3881 // FlagList::ResetAllFlags()), but error simulation reads the random seed.
3882 if (options.simulate_errors && is_valid_fuzz_script()) {
3883 // Simulate several errors detectable by fuzzers behind a flag if the
3884 // minimum file size for fuzzing was executed.
3885 FuzzerMonitor::SimulateErrors();
3886 }
3887
3888 if (dispose) {
3889 V8::Dispose();
3890 V8::DisposePlatform();
3891 }
3892
3893 if (options.dump_counters || options.dump_counters_nvp) {
3894 base::SharedMutexGuard<base::kShared> mutex_guard(&counter_mutex_);
3895 std::vector<std::pair<std::string, Counter*>> counters(
3896 counter_map_->begin(), counter_map_->end());
3897 std::sort(counters.begin(), counters.end());
3898
3899 if (options.dump_counters_nvp) {
3900 // Dump counters as name-value pairs.
3901 for (const auto& pair : counters) {
3902 std::string key = pair.first;
3903 Counter* counter = pair.second;
3904 if (counter->is_histogram()) {
3905 std::cout << "\"c:" << key << "\"=" << counter->count() << "\n";
3906 std::cout << "\"t:" << key << "\"=" << counter->sample_total()
3907 << "\n";
3908 } else {
3909 std::cout << "\"" << key << "\"=" << counter->count() << "\n";
3910 }
3911 }
3912 } else {
3913 // Dump counters in formatted boxes.
3914 constexpr int kNameBoxSize = 64;
3915 constexpr int kValueBoxSize = 13;
3916 std::cout << "+" << std::string(kNameBoxSize, '-') << "+"
3917 << std::string(kValueBoxSize, '-') << "+\n";
3918 std::cout << "| Name" << std::string(kNameBoxSize - 5, ' ') << "| Value"
3919 << std::string(kValueBoxSize - 6, ' ') << "|\n";
3920 std::cout << "+" << std::string(kNameBoxSize, '-') << "+"
3921 << std::string(kValueBoxSize, '-') << "+\n";
3922 for (const auto& pair : counters) {
3923 std::string key = pair.first;
3924 Counter* counter = pair.second;
3925 if (counter->is_histogram()) {
3926 std::cout << "| c:" << std::setw(kNameBoxSize - 4) << std::left << key
3927 << " | " << std::setw(kValueBoxSize - 2) << std::right
3928 << counter->count() << " |\n";
3929 std::cout << "| t:" << std::setw(kNameBoxSize - 4) << std::left << key
3930 << " | " << std::setw(kValueBoxSize - 2) << std::right
3931 << counter->sample_total() << " |\n";
3932 } else {
3933 std::cout << "| " << std::setw(kNameBoxSize - 2) << std::left << key
3934 << " | " << std::setw(kValueBoxSize - 2) << std::right
3935 << counter->count() << " |\n";
3936 }
3937 }
3938 std::cout << "+" << std::string(kNameBoxSize, '-') << "+"
3939 << std::string(kValueBoxSize, '-') << "+\n";
3940 }
3941 }
3942
3943 if (options.dump_system_memory_stats) {
3944 int peak_memory_usage = base::OS::GetPeakMemoryUsageKb();
3945 std::cout << "System peak memory usage (kb): " << peak_memory_usage
3946 << std::endl;
3947 // TODO(jdapena): call rusage platform independent call, and extract peak
3948 // memory usage to print it
3949 }
3950
3951 // Only delete the counters if we are done executing; after calling `quit`,
3952 // other isolates might still be running and accessing that memory. This is a
3953 // memory leak, which is OK in this case.
3954 if (dispose) {
3955 delete counters_file_;
3956 delete counter_map_;
3957 }
3958}
3959
3960void Dummy(char* arg) {}
3961
3962V8_NOINLINE void FuzzerMonitor::SimulateErrors() {
3963 // Initialize a fresh RNG to not interfere with JS execution.
3964 std::unique_ptr<base::RandomNumberGenerator> rng;
3965 int64_t seed = i::v8_flags.random_seed;
3966 if (seed != 0) {
3967 rng = std::make_unique<base::RandomNumberGenerator>(seed);
3968 } else {
3969 rng = std::make_unique<base::RandomNumberGenerator>();
3970 }
3971
3972 double p = rng->NextDouble();
3973 if (p < 0.1) {
3974 ControlFlowViolation();
3975 } else if (p < 0.2) {
3976 DCheck();
3977 } else if (p < 0.3) {
3978 Fatal();
3979 } else if (p < 0.4) {
3980 ObservableDifference();
3981 } else if (p < 0.5) {
3982 UndefinedBehavior();
3983 } else if (p < 0.6) {
3984 UseAfterFree();
3985 } else if (p < 0.7) {
3986 UseOfUninitializedValue();
3987 }
3988}
3989
3990V8_NOINLINE void FuzzerMonitor::ControlFlowViolation() {
3991 // Control flow violation caught by CFI.
3992 void (*func)() = (void (*)()) & Dummy;
3993 func();
3994}
3995
3996V8_NOINLINE void FuzzerMonitor::DCheck() {
3997 // Caught in debug builds.
3998 DCHECK(false);
3999}
4000
4001V8_NOINLINE void FuzzerMonitor::Fatal() {
4002 // Caught in all build types.
4003 FATAL("Fake error.");
4004}
4005
4006V8_NOINLINE void FuzzerMonitor::ObservableDifference() {
4007 // Observable difference caught by differential fuzzing.
4008 printf("___fake_difference___\n");
4009}
4010
4011V8_NOINLINE void FuzzerMonitor::UndefinedBehavior() {
4012 // Caught by UBSAN.
4013 int32_t val = -1;
4014 USE(val << val);
4015}
4016
4017V8_NOINLINE void FuzzerMonitor::UseAfterFree() {
4018 // Use-after-free caught by ASAN.
4019#if defined(__clang__) // GCC-12 detects this at compile time!
4020 std::vector<bool>* storage = new std::vector<bool>(3);
4021 delete storage;
4022 USE(storage->at(1));
4023#endif
4024}
4025
4026V8_NOINLINE void FuzzerMonitor::UseOfUninitializedValue() {
4027// Use-of-uninitialized-value caught by MSAN.
4028#if defined(__clang__)
4029 int uninitialized[1];
4030 if (uninitialized[0]) USE(uninitialized);
4031#endif
4032}
4033
4034char* Shell::ReadChars(const char* name, int* size_out) {
4035 if (options.read_from_tcp_port >= 0) {
4036 return ReadCharsFromTcpPort(name, size_out);
4037 }
4038
4039 FILE* file = base::OS::FOpen(name, "rb");
4040 if (file == nullptr) return nullptr;
4041
4042 fseek(file, 0, SEEK_END);
4043 size_t size = ftell(file);
4044 rewind(file);
4045
4046 char* chars = new char[size + 1];
4047 chars[size] = '\0';
4048 for (size_t i = 0; i < size;) {
4049 i += fread(&chars[i], 1, size - i, file);
4050 if (ferror(file)) {
4051 base::Fclose(file);
4052 delete[] chars;
4053 return nullptr;
4054 }
4055 }
4056 base::Fclose(file);
4057 *size_out = static_cast<int>(size);
4058 return chars;
4059}
4060
4061MaybeLocal<PrimitiveArray> Shell::ReadLines(Isolate* isolate,
4062 const char* name) {
4063 int length;
4064 std::unique_ptr<char[]> data(ReadChars(name, &length));
4065
4066 if (data.get() == nullptr) {
4067 return MaybeLocal<PrimitiveArray>();
4068 }
4069 std::stringstream stream(data.get());
4070 std::string line;
4071 std::vector<std::string> lines;
4072 while (std::getline(stream, line, '\n')) {
4073 lines.emplace_back(line);
4074 }
4075 // Create a Local<PrimitiveArray> off the read lines.
4076 int size = static_cast<int>(lines.size());
4077 Local<PrimitiveArray> exports = PrimitiveArray::New(isolate, size);
4078 for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
4079 MaybeLocal<String> maybe_str = v8::String::NewFromUtf8(
4080 isolate, lines[i].c_str(), NewStringType::kNormal,
4081 static_cast<int>(lines[i].length()));
4082 Local<String> str;
4083 if (!maybe_str.ToLocal(&str)) {
4084 return MaybeLocal<PrimitiveArray>();
4085 }
4086 exports->Set(isolate, i, str);
4087 }
4088 return exports;
4089}
4090
4091void Shell::ReadBuffer(const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
4092 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
4093 static_assert(sizeof(char) == sizeof(uint8_t),
4094 "char and uint8_t should both have 1 byte");
4095 Isolate* isolate = info.GetIsolate();
4096 String::Utf8Value filename(isolate, info[0]);
4097 int length;
4098 if (*filename == nullptr) {
4099 ThrowError(isolate, "Error loading file");
4100 return;
4101 }
4102
4103 uint8_t* data = reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(ReadChars(*filename, &length));
4104 if (data == nullptr) {
4105 ThrowError(isolate, "Error reading file");
4106 return;
4107 }
4108 Local<v8::ArrayBuffer> buffer = ArrayBuffer::New(isolate, length);
4109 memcpy(buffer->GetBackingStore()->Data(), data, length);
4110 delete[] data;
4111
4112 info.GetReturnValue().Set(buffer);
4113}
4114
4115void Shell::ReadLine(const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
4116 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
4117 info.GetReturnValue().Set(ReadFromStdin(info.GetIsolate()));
4118}
4119
4120// Reads a file into a v8 string.
4121MaybeLocal<String> Shell::ReadFile(Isolate* isolate, const char* name,
4122 bool should_throw) {
4123 std::unique_ptr<base::OS::MemoryMappedFile> file(
4124 base::OS::MemoryMappedFile::open(
4125 name, base::OS::MemoryMappedFile::FileMode::kReadOnly));
4126 if (!file) {
4127 if (should_throw) {
4128 std::ostringstream oss;
4129 oss << "Error loading file: " << name;
4130 ThrowError(isolate,
4131 v8::String::NewFromUtf8(
4132 isolate, oss.str().substr(0, String::kMaxLength).c_str())
4133 .ToLocalChecked());
4134 }
4135 return MaybeLocal<String>();
4136 }
4137
4138 int size = static_cast<int>(file->size());
4139 char* chars = static_cast<char*>(file->memory());
4140 if (i::v8_flags.use_external_strings && i::String::IsAscii(chars, size)) {
4141 String::ExternalOneByteStringResource* resource =
4142 new ExternalOwningOneByteStringResource(std::move(file));
4143 return String::NewExternalOneByte(isolate, resource);
4144 }
4145 return String::NewFromUtf8(isolate, chars, NewStringType::kNormal, size);
4146}
4147
4148void Shell::WriteChars(const char* name, uint8_t* buffer, size_t buffer_size) {
4149 FILE* file = base::Fopen(name, "w");
4150 if (file == nullptr) return;
4151 fwrite(buffer, 1, buffer_size, file);
4152 base::Fclose(file);
4153}
4154
4155void Shell::RunShell(Isolate* isolate) {
4156 Global<Context> context;
4157 {
4158 HandleScope scope(isolate);
4159 context.Reset(isolate, Local<Context>::New(isolate, evaluation_context_));
4160 }
4161 PerIsolateData::RealmScope realm_scope(isolate, context);
4162 printf("V8 version %s\n", V8::GetVersion());
4163 while (true) {
4164 Global<Value> global_result;
4165 bool success;
4166 {
4167 HandleScope scope(isolate);
4168 Context::Scope context_scope(context.Get(isolate));
4169 printf("d8> ");
4170 Local<String> input = Shell::ReadFromStdin(isolate);
4171 if (input.IsEmpty()) break;
4172 Local<String> name = String::NewFromUtf8Literal(isolate, "(d8)");
4173 success = ExecuteString(isolate, input, name, kReportExceptions,
4174 &global_result);
4175 CHECK_EQ(success, !global_result.IsEmpty());
4176 }
4177 if (!FinishExecuting(isolate, context)) success = false;
4178 if (success) {
4179 HandleScope scope(isolate);
4180 Context::Scope context_scope(context.Get(isolate));
4181 Local<Value> result = global_result.Get(isolate);
4182 if (options.test_shell) {
4183 if (!result->IsUndefined()) {
4184 // If all went well and the result wasn't undefined then print
4185 // the returned value.
4186 v8::String::Utf8Value str(isolate, result);
4187 fwrite(*str, sizeof(**str), str.length(), stdout);
4188 printf("\n");
4189 }
4190 } else {
4191 v8::String::Utf8Value str(isolate, Stringify(isolate, result));
4192 fwrite(*str, sizeof(**str), str.length(), stdout);
4193 printf("\n");
4194 }
4195 }
4196 }
4197 printf("\n");
4198}
4199
4200class InspectorFrontend final : public v8_inspector::V8Inspector::Channel {
4201 public:
4202 explicit InspectorFrontend(Local<Context> context) {
4203 isolate_ = context->GetIsolate();
4204 context_.Reset(isolate_, context);
4205 }
4206 ~InspectorFrontend() override = default;
4207
4208 private:
4209 void sendResponse(
4210 int callId,
4211 std::unique_ptr<v8_inspector::StringBuffer> message) override {
4212 Send(message->string());
4213 }
4214 void sendNotification(
4215 std::unique_ptr<v8_inspector::StringBuffer> message) override {
4216 Send(message->string());
4217 }
4218 void flushProtocolNotifications() override {}
4219
4220 void Send(const v8_inspector::StringView& string) {
4221 v8::Isolate::AllowJavascriptExecutionScope allow_script(isolate_);
4222 v8::HandleScope handle_scope(isolate_);
4223 int length = static_cast<int>(string.length());
4224 DCHECK_LT(length, v8::String::kMaxLength);
4225 Local<String> message =
4226 (string.is8Bit()
4227 ? v8::String::NewFromOneByte(
4228 isolate_,
4229 reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t*>(string.characters8()),
4230 v8::NewStringType::kNormal, length)
4231 : v8::String::NewFromTwoByte(
4232 isolate_,
4233 reinterpret_cast<const uint16_t*>(string.characters16()),
4234 v8::NewStringType::kNormal, length))
4235 .ToLocalChecked();
4236 Local<String> callback_name = v8::String::NewFromUtf8Literal(
4237 isolate_, "receive", NewStringType::kInternalized);
4238 Local<Context> context = context_.Get(isolate_);
4239 Local<Value> callback =
4240 context->Global()->Get(context, callback_name).ToLocalChecked();
4241 if (callback->IsFunction()) {
4242 v8::TryCatch try_catch(isolate_);
4243 Local<Value> args[] = {message};
4244 USE(callback.As<Function>()->Call(context, Undefined(isolate_), 1, args));
4245#ifdef DEBUG
4246 if (try_catch.HasCaught()) {
4247 Local<Object> exception = try_catch.Exception().As<Object>();
4248 Local<String> key = v8::String::NewFromUtf8Literal(
4249 isolate_, "message", NewStringType::kInternalized);
4250 Local<String> expected = v8::String::NewFromUtf8Literal(
4251 isolate_, "Maximum call stack size exceeded");
4252 Local<Value> value = exception->Get(context, key).ToLocalChecked();
4253 DCHECK(value->StrictEquals(expected));
4254 }
4255#endif
4256 }
4257 }
4258
4259 Isolate* isolate_;
4260 Global<Context> context_;
4261};
4262
4263class InspectorClient : public v8_inspector::V8InspectorClient {
4264 public:
4265 InspectorClient(Isolate* isolate, const Global<Context>& global_context,
4266 bool connect) {
4267 if (!connect) return;
4268 isolate_ = isolate;
4269 Local<Context> context = global_context.Get(isolate);
4270 channel_.reset(new InspectorFrontend(context));
4271 inspector_ = v8_inspector::V8Inspector::create(isolate_, this);
4272 session_ =
4273 inspector_->connect(1, channel_.get(), v8_inspector::StringView(),
4274 v8_inspector::V8Inspector::kFullyTrusted,
4275 v8_inspector::V8Inspector::kNotWaitingForDebugger);
4276 context->SetAlignedPointerInEmbedderData(kInspectorClientIndex, this);
4277 inspector_->contextCreated(v8_inspector::V8ContextInfo(
4278 context, kContextGroupId, v8_inspector::StringView()));
4279
4280 Local<Value> function =
4281 FunctionTemplate::New(isolate_, SendInspectorMessage)
4282 ->GetFunction(context)
4283 .ToLocalChecked();
4284 Local<String> function_name = String::NewFromUtf8Literal(
4285 isolate_, "send", NewStringType::kInternalized);
4286 CHECK(context->Global()->Set(context, function_name, function).FromJust());
4287
4288 context_.Reset(isolate_, global_context);
4289 }
4290
4291 void runMessageLoopOnPause(int contextGroupId) override {
4292 v8::Isolate::AllowJavascriptExecutionScope allow_script(isolate_);
4293 v8::HandleScope handle_scope(isolate_);
4294 Local<String> callback_name = v8::String::NewFromUtf8Literal(
4295 isolate_, "handleInspectorMessage", NewStringType::kInternalized);
4296 Local<Context> context = context_.Get(isolate_);
4297 Local<Value> callback =
4298 context->Global()->Get(context, callback_name).ToLocalChecked();
4299 if (!callback->IsFunction()) return;
4300
4301 // Running the message loop below may trigger the execution of a stackless
4302 // GC. We need to override the embedder stack state, to force scanning the
4303 // stack, if this happens.
4304 i::Heap* heap = reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(isolate_)->heap();
4305 i::EmbedderStackStateScope stack_scanning_scope(
4306 heap, i::EmbedderStackStateOrigin::kExplicitInvocation,
4307 v8::StackState::kMayContainHeapPointers);
4308
4309 v8::TryCatch try_catch(isolate_);
4310 try_catch.SetVerbose(true);
4311 is_paused = true;
4312
4313 while (is_paused) {
4314 USE(callback.As<Function>()->Call(context, Undefined(isolate_), 0, {}));
4315 if (try_catch.HasCaught()) {
4316 is_paused = false;
4317 }
4318 }
4319 }
4320
4321 void quitMessageLoopOnPause() override { is_paused = false; }
4322
4323 private:
4324 static v8_inspector::V8InspectorSession* GetSession(Local<Context> context) {
4325 InspectorClient* inspector_client = static_cast<InspectorClient*>(
4326 context->GetAlignedPointerFromEmbedderData(kInspectorClientIndex));
4327 return inspector_client->session_.get();
4328 }
4329
4330 Local<Context> ensureDefaultContextInGroup(int group_id) override {
4331 DCHECK(isolate_);
4332 DCHECK_EQ(kContextGroupId, group_id);
4333 return context_.Get(isolate_);
4334 }
4335
4336 static void SendInspectorMessage(
4337 const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
4338 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
4339 Isolate* isolate = info.GetIsolate();
4340 v8::HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
4341 Local<Context> context = isolate->GetCurrentContext();
4342 info.GetReturnValue().Set(Undefined(isolate));
4343 Local<String> message = info[0]->ToString(context).ToLocalChecked();
4344 v8_inspector::V8InspectorSession* session =
4345 InspectorClient::GetSession(context);
4346 int length = message->Length();
4347 std::unique_ptr<uint16_t[]> buffer(new uint16_t[length]);
4348 message->Write(isolate, buffer.get(), 0, length);
4349 v8_inspector::StringView message_view(buffer.get(), length);
4350 {
4351 v8::SealHandleScope seal_handle_scope(isolate);
4352 session->dispatchProtocolMessage(message_view);
4353 }
4354 info.GetReturnValue().Set(True(isolate));
4355 }
4356
4357 static const int kContextGroupId = 1;
4358
4359 std::unique_ptr<v8_inspector::V8Inspector> inspector_;
4360 std::unique_ptr<v8_inspector::V8InspectorSession> session_;
4361 std::unique_ptr<v8_inspector::V8Inspector::Channel> channel_;
4362 bool is_paused = false;
4363 Global<Context> context_;
4364 Isolate* isolate_;
4365};
4366
4367SourceGroup::~SourceGroup() {
4368 delete thread_;
4369 thread_ = nullptr;
4370}
4371
4372bool ends_with(const char* input, const char* suffix) {
4373 size_t input_length = strlen(input);
4374 size_t suffix_length = strlen(suffix);
4375 if (suffix_length <= input_length) {
4376 return strcmp(input + input_length - suffix_length, suffix) == 0;
4377 }
4378 return false;
4379}
4380
4381bool SourceGroup::Execute(Isolate* isolate) {
4382 bool success = true;
4383#ifdef V8_FUZZILLI
4384 if (fuzzilli_reprl) {
4385 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
4386 Local<String> file_name =
4387 String::NewFromUtf8(isolate, "fuzzcode.js", NewStringType::kNormal)
4388 .ToLocalChecked();
4389
4390 size_t script_size;
4391 CHECK_EQ(read(REPRL_CRFD, &script_size, 8), 8);
4392 char* buffer = new char[script_size + 1];
4393 char* ptr = buffer;
4394 size_t remaining = script_size;
4395 while (remaining > 0) {
4396 ssize_t rv = read(REPRL_DRFD, ptr, remaining);
4397 CHECK_GE(rv, 0);
4398 remaining -= rv;
4399 ptr += rv;
4400 }
4401 buffer[script_size] = 0;
4402
4403 Local<String> source =
4404 String::NewFromUtf8(isolate, buffer, NewStringType::kNormal)
4405 .ToLocalChecked();
4406 delete[] buffer;
4407 Shell::set_script_executed();
4408 if (!Shell::ExecuteString(isolate, source, file_name,
4409 Shell::kReportExceptions)) {
4410 return false;
4411 }
4412 }
4413#endif // V8_FUZZILLI
4414 for (int i = begin_offset_; i < end_offset_; ++i) {
4415 const char* arg = argv_[i];
4416 if (strcmp(arg, "-e") == 0 && i + 1 < end_offset_) {
4417 // Execute argument given to -e option directly.
4418 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
4419 Local<String> file_name = String::NewFromUtf8Literal(isolate, "unnamed");
4420 Local<String> source =
4421 String::NewFromUtf8(isolate, argv_[i + 1]).ToLocalChecked();
4422 Shell::set_script_executed();
4423 if (!Shell::ExecuteString(isolate, source, file_name,
4424 Shell::kReportExceptions)) {
4425 success = false;
4426 break;
4427 }
4428 ++i;
4429 continue;
4430 } else if (ends_with(arg, ".mjs")) {
4431 Shell::set_script_executed();
4432 if (!Shell::ExecuteModule(isolate, arg)) {
4433 success = false;
4434 break;
4435 }
4436 continue;
4437 } else if (strcmp(arg, "--module") == 0 && i + 1 < end_offset_) {
4438 // Treat the next file as a module.
4439 arg = argv_[++i];
4440 Shell::set_script_executed();
4441 if (!Shell::ExecuteModule(isolate, arg)) {
4442 success = false;
4443 break;
4444 }
4445 continue;
4446 } else if (strcmp(arg, "--json") == 0 && i + 1 < end_offset_) {
4447 // Treat the next file as a JSON file.
4448 arg = argv_[++i];
4449 Shell::set_script_executed();
4450 if (!Shell::LoadJSON(isolate, arg)) {
4451 success = false;
4452 break;
4453 }
4454 continue;
4455 } else if (arg[0] == '-') {
4456 // Ignore other options. They have been parsed already.
4457 continue;
4458 }
4459
4460 // Use all other arguments as names of files to load and run.
4461 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
4462 Local<String> file_name =
4463 String::NewFromUtf8(isolate, arg).ToLocalChecked();
4464 Local<String> source;
4465 if (!Shell::ReadFile(isolate, arg).ToLocal(&source)) {
4466 printf("Error reading '%s'\n", arg);
4467 base::OS::ExitProcess(1);
4468 }
4469 Shell::set_script_executed();
4470 Shell::update_script_size(source->Length());
4471 if (!Shell::ExecuteString(isolate, source, file_name,
4472 Shell::kReportExceptions)) {
4473 success = false;
4474 break;
4475 }
4476 }
4477 return success;
4478}
4479
4480SourceGroup::IsolateThread::IsolateThread(SourceGroup* group)
4481 : base::Thread(GetThreadOptions("IsolateThread")), group_(group) {}
4482
4483void SourceGroup::ExecuteInThread() {
4484 Isolate::CreateParams create_params;
4485 create_params.array_buffer_allocator = Shell::array_buffer_allocator;
4486 Isolate* isolate = Isolate::New(create_params);
4487
4488 {
4489 Isolate::Scope isolate_scope(isolate);
4490 D8Console console(isolate);
4491 Shell::Initialize(isolate, &console, false);
4492 PerIsolateData data(isolate);
4493
4494 for (int i = 0; i < Shell::options.stress_runs; ++i) {
4495 next_semaphore_.ParkedWait(
4496 reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(isolate)->main_thread_local_isolate());
4497 {
4498 Global<Context> global_context;
4499 HandleScope scope(isolate);
4500 {
4501 Local<Context> context;
4502 if (!Shell::CreateEvaluationContext(isolate).ToLocal(&context)) {
4503 DCHECK(isolate->IsExecutionTerminating());
4504 break;
4505 }
4506 global_context.Reset(isolate, context);
4507 }
4508 PerIsolateData::RealmScope realm_scope(isolate, global_context);
4509 InspectorClient inspector_client(isolate, global_context,
4510 Shell::options.enable_inspector);
4511 {
4512 // We cannot use a Context::Scope here, as it keeps a local handle to
4513 // the context and SourceGroup::Execute may execute a non-nestable
4514 // task, e.g. a stackless GC.
4515 global_context.Get(isolate)->Enter();
4516 Execute(isolate);
4517 global_context.Get(isolate)->Exit();
4518 }
4519 Shell::FinishExecuting(isolate, global_context);
4520 }
4521 Shell::CollectGarbage(isolate);
4522 done_semaphore_.Signal();
4523 }
4524
4525 Shell::ResetOnProfileEndListener(isolate);
4526 }
4527
4528 isolate->Dispose();
4529}
4530
4531void SourceGroup::StartExecuteInThread() {
4532 if (thread_ == nullptr) {
4533 thread_ = new IsolateThread(this);
4534 CHECK(thread_->Start());
4535 }
4536 next_semaphore_.Signal();
4537}
4538
4539void SourceGroup::WaitForThread(const i::ParkedScope& parked) {
4540 if (thread_ == nullptr) return;
4541 done_semaphore_.ParkedWait(parked);
4542}
4543
4544void SourceGroup::JoinThread(const i::ParkedScope& parked) {
4545 USE(parked);
4546 if (thread_ == nullptr) return;
4547 thread_->Join();
4548}
4549
4550void SerializationDataQueue::Enqueue(std::unique_ptr<SerializationData> data) {
4551 base::MutexGuard lock_guard(&mutex_);
4552 data_.push_back(std::move(data));
4553}
4554
4555bool SerializationDataQueue::Dequeue(
4556 std::unique_ptr<SerializationData>* out_data) {
4557 out_data->reset();
4558 base::MutexGuard lock_guard(&mutex_);
4559 if (data_.empty()) return false;
4560 *out_data = std::move(data_[0]);
4561 data_.erase(data_.begin());
4562 return true;
4563}
4564
4565bool SerializationDataQueue::IsEmpty() {
4566 base::MutexGuard lock_guard(&mutex_);
4567 return data_.empty();
4568}
4569
4570void SerializationDataQueue::Clear() {
4571 base::MutexGuard lock_guard(&mutex_);
4572 data_.clear();
4573}
