4575Worker::Worker(const char* script) : script_(i::StrDup(script)) {
4576 state_.store(State::kReady);
4577}
4578
4579Worker::~Worker() {
4580 CHECK(state_.load() == State::kTerminated);
4581 DCHECK_NULL(isolate_);
4582 delete thread_;
4583 thread_ = nullptr;
4584 delete[] script_;
4585 script_ = nullptr;
4586}
4587
4588bool Worker::is_running() const { return state_.load() == State::kRunning; }
4589
4590bool Worker::StartWorkerThread(Isolate* requester,
4591 std::shared_ptr<Worker> worker,
4592 base::Thread::Priority priority) {
4593 auto expected = State::kReady;
4594 CHECK(
4595 worker->state_.compare_exchange_strong(expected, State::kPrepareRunning));
4596 auto thread = new WorkerThread(worker, priority);
4597 worker->thread_ = thread;
4598 if (!thread->Start()) return false;
4599 // Wait until the worker is ready to receive messages.
4600 worker->started_semaphore_.ParkedWait(
4601 reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(requester)->main_thread_local_isolate());
4602 Shell::AddRunningWorker(std::move(worker));
4603 return true;
4604}
4605
4606void Worker::WorkerThread::Run() {
4607 // Prevent a lifetime cycle from Worker -> WorkerThread -> Worker.
4608 // We must clear the worker_ field of the thread, but we keep the
4609 // worker alive via a stack root until the thread finishes execution
4610 // and removes itself from the running set. Thereafter the only
4611 // remaining reference can be from a JavaScript object via a Managed.
4612 auto worker = std::move(worker_);
4613 worker_ = nullptr;
4614 worker->ExecuteInThread();
4615 Shell::RemoveRunningWorker(worker);
4616}
4617
4618class ProcessMessageTask : public i::CancelableTask {
4619 public:
4620 ProcessMessageTask(i::CancelableTaskManager* task_manager,
4621 std::shared_ptr<Worker> worker,
4622 std::unique_ptr<SerializationData> data)
4623 : i::CancelableTask(task_manager),
4624 worker_(worker),
4625 data_(std::move(data)) {}
4626
4627 void RunInternal() override { worker_->ProcessMessage(std::move(data_)); }
4628
4629 private:
4630 std::shared_ptr<Worker> worker_;
4631 std::unique_ptr<SerializationData> data_;
4632};
4633
4634void Worker::PostMessage(std::unique_ptr<SerializationData> data) {
4635 base::MutexGuard lock_guard(&worker_mutex_);
4636 if (!is_running()) return;
4637 std::unique_ptr<v8::Task> task(new ProcessMessageTask(
4638 task_manager_, shared_from_this(), std::move(data)));
4639 task_runner_->PostNonNestableTask(std::move(task));
4640}
4641
4642class TerminateTask : public i::CancelableTask {
4643 public:
4644 TerminateTask(i::CancelableTaskManager* task_manager,
4645 std::shared_ptr<Worker> worker)
4646 : i::CancelableTask(task_manager), worker_(worker) {}
4647
4648 void RunInternal() override {
4649 auto expected = Worker::State::kTerminating;
4650 CHECK(worker_->state_.compare_exchange_strong(expected,
4651 Worker::State::kTerminated));
4652 }
4653
4654 private:
4655 std::shared_ptr<Worker> worker_;
4656};
4657
4658std::unique_ptr<SerializationData> Worker::GetMessage(Isolate* requester) {
4659 std::unique_ptr<SerializationData> result;
4660 while (!out_queue_.Dequeue(&result)) {
4661 // If the worker is no longer running, and there are no messages in the
4662 // queue, don't expect any more messages from it.
4663 if (!is_running()) break;
4664 out_semaphore_.ParkedWait(
4665 reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(requester)->main_thread_local_isolate());
4666 }
4667 return result;
4668}
4669
4670void Worker::TerminateAndWaitForThread(const i::ParkedScope& parked) {
4671 USE(parked);
4672 Terminate();
4673 {
4674 base::MutexGuard lock_guard(&worker_mutex_);
4675 // Prevent double-joining.
4676 if (is_joined_) return;
4677 is_joined_ = true;
4678 }
4679 thread_->Join();
4680}
4681
4682void Worker::Terminate() {
4683 base::MutexGuard lock_guard(&worker_mutex_);
4684 auto expected = State::kRunning;
4685 if (!state_.compare_exchange_strong(expected, State::kTerminating)) return;
4686 std::unique_ptr<v8::Task> task(
4687 new TerminateTask(task_manager_, shared_from_this()));
4688 task_runner_->PostTask(std::move(task));
4689 // Also schedule an interrupt in case the worker is running code and never
4690 // returning to the event queue. Since we checked the state before, and we are
4691 // holding the {worker_mutex_}, it's safe to access the isolate.
4692 isolate_->TerminateExecution();
4693}
4694
4695void Worker::EnterTerminatedState() {
4696 base::MutexGuard lock_guard(&worker_mutex_);
4697 state_.store(State::kTerminated);
4698 CHECK(!is_running());
4699 task_runner_.reset();
4700 task_manager_ = nullptr;
4701}
4702
4703void Worker::ProcessMessage(std::unique_ptr<SerializationData> data) {
4704 if (!is_running()) return;
4705 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(isolate_);
4706 HandleScope scope(isolate_);
4707 Local<Context> context = context_.Get(isolate_);
4708 Context::Scope context_scope(context);
4709 Local<Object> global = context->Global();
4710
4711 // Get the message handler.
4712 MaybeLocal<Value> maybe_onmessage = global->Get(
4713 context, String::NewFromUtf8Literal(isolate_, "onmessage",
4714 NewStringType::kInternalized));
4715 Local<Value> onmessage;
4716 if (!maybe_onmessage.ToLocal(&onmessage) || !onmessage->IsFunction()) return;
4717 Local<Function> onmessage_fun = onmessage.As<Function>();
4718
4719 v8::TryCatch try_catch(isolate_);
4720 try_catch.SetVerbose(true);
4721 Local<Value> value;
4722 if (Shell::DeserializeValue(isolate_, std::move(data)).ToLocal(&value)) {
4723 DCHECK(!isolate_->IsExecutionTerminating());
4724 Local<Value> argv[] = {value};
4725 MaybeLocal<Value> result = onmessage_fun->Call(context, global, 1, argv);
4726 USE(result);
4727 }
4728}
4729
4730void Worker::ProcessMessages() {
4731 i::Isolate* i_isolate = reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(isolate_);
4732 i::SaveAndSwitchContext saved_context(i_isolate, i::Context());
4733 SealHandleScope shs(isolate_);
4734 while (is_running() && v8::platform::PumpMessageLoop(
4735 g_default_platform, isolate_,
4736 platform::MessageLoopBehavior::kWaitForWork)) {
4737 if (is_running()) {
4738 MicrotasksScope::PerformCheckpoint(isolate_);
4739 }
4740 }
4741}
4742
4743// static
4744void Worker::SetCurrentWorker(Worker* worker) {
4745 CHECK_NULL(current_worker_);
4746 current_worker_ = worker;
4747}
4748
4749// static
4750Worker* Worker::GetCurrentWorker() { return current_worker_; }
4751
4752void Worker::ExecuteInThread() {
4753 Isolate::CreateParams create_params;
4754 create_params.array_buffer_allocator = Shell::array_buffer_allocator;
4755 isolate_ = Isolate::New(create_params);
4756
4757 // Make the Worker instance available to the whole thread.
4758 SetCurrentWorker(this);
4759
4760 task_runner_ = g_default_platform->GetForegroundTaskRunner(isolate_);
4761 task_manager_ =
4762 reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(isolate_)->cancelable_task_manager();
4763
4764 auto expected = State::kPrepareRunning;
4765 CHECK(state_.compare_exchange_strong(expected, State::kRunning));
4766
4767 // The Worker is now ready to receive messages.
4768 started_semaphore_.Signal();
4769
4770 {
4771 Isolate::Scope isolate_scope(isolate_);
4772 D8Console console(isolate_);
4773 Shell::Initialize(isolate_, &console, false);
4774 PerIsolateData data(isolate_);
4775
4776 CHECK(context_.IsEmpty());
4777
4778 {
4779 HandleScope scope(isolate_);
4780 Local<Context> context;
4781 if (Shell::CreateEvaluationContext(isolate_).ToLocal(&context)) {
4782 context_.Reset(isolate_, context);
4783 CHECK(!context_.IsEmpty());
4784 }
4785 }
4786
4787 if (!context_.IsEmpty()) {
4788 {
4789 bool success;
4790 PerIsolateData::RealmScope realm_scope(isolate_, context_);
4791 {
4792 HandleScope scope(isolate_);
4793 Local<Context> context = context_.Get(isolate_);
4794 Context::Scope context_scope(context);
4795
4796 Local<Object> global = context->Global();
4797 Local<Value> this_value = External::New(isolate_, this);
4798 Local<FunctionTemplate> postmessage_fun_template =
4799 FunctionTemplate::New(isolate_, PostMessageOut, this_value);
4800
4801 Local<Function> postmessage_fun;
4802 if (postmessage_fun_template->GetFunction(context).ToLocal(
4803 &postmessage_fun)) {
4804 global
4805 ->Set(
4806 context,
4807 v8::String::NewFromUtf8Literal(
4808 isolate_, "postMessage", NewStringType::kInternalized),
4809 postmessage_fun)
4810 .FromJust();
4811 }
4812
4813 // First run the script
4814 Local<String> file_name =
4815 String::NewFromUtf8Literal(isolate_, "unnamed");
4816 Local<String> source =
4817 String::NewFromUtf8(isolate_, script_).ToLocalChecked();
4818 success = Shell::ExecuteString(isolate_, source, file_name,
4819 Shell::kReportExceptions);
4820 }
4821 if (!Shell::FinishExecuting(isolate_, context_)) success = false;
4822 if (success) {
4823 bool handler_present;
4824 {
4825 HandleScope scope(isolate_);
4826 Local<Context> context = context_.Get(isolate_);
4827 Context::Scope context_scope(context);
4828 Local<Object> global = context->Global();
4829 // Check that there's a message handler
4830 MaybeLocal<Value> maybe_onmessage = global->Get(
4831 context,
4832 String::NewFromUtf8Literal(isolate_, "onmessage",
4833 NewStringType::kInternalized));
4834 Local<Value> onmessage;
4835 handler_present =
4836 maybe_onmessage.ToLocal(&onmessage) && onmessage->IsFunction();
4837 }
4838 if (handler_present) {
4839 // Now wait for messages.
4840 ProcessMessages();
4841 }
4842 }
4843 }
4844 Shell::CollectGarbage(isolate_);
4845 }
4846
4847 EnterTerminatedState();
4848
4849 Shell::ResetOnProfileEndListener(isolate_);
4850 context_.Reset();
4851 platform::NotifyIsolateShutdown(g_default_platform, isolate_);
4852 }
4853
4854 isolate_->Dispose();
4855 isolate_ = nullptr;
4856
4857 // Post nullptr to wake the thread waiting on GetMessage() if there is one.
4858 out_queue_.Enqueue(nullptr);
4859 out_semaphore_.Signal();
4860}
4861
4862void Worker::PostMessageOut(const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>& info) {
4863 DCHECK(i::ValidateCallbackInfo(info));
4864 Isolate* isolate = info.GetIsolate();
4865 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
4866
4867 if (info.Length() < 1) {
4868 ThrowError(isolate, "Invalid argument");
4869 return;
4870 }
4871
4872 Local<Value> message = info[0];
4873 Local<Value> transfer = Undefined(isolate);
4874 std::unique_ptr<SerializationData> data =
4875 Shell::SerializeValue(isolate, message, transfer);
4876 if (data) {
4877 DCHECK(info.Data()->IsExternal());
4878 Local<External> this_value = info.Data().As<External>();
4879 Worker* worker = static_cast<Worker*>(this_value->Value());
4880 worker->out_queue_.Enqueue(std::move(data));
4881 worker->out_semaphore_.Signal();
4882 }
4883}
4884
4885#ifdef V8_TARGET_OS_WIN
4886// Enable support for unicode filename path on windows.
4887// We first convert ansi encoded argv[i] to utf16 encoded, and then
4888// convert utf16 encoded to utf8 encoded with setting the argv[i]
4889// to the utf8 encoded arg. We allocate memory for the utf8 encoded
4890// arg, and we will free it and reset it to nullptr after using
4891// the filename path arg. And because Execute may be called multiple
4892// times, we need to free the allocated unicode filename when exit.
4893
4894// Save the allocated utf8 filenames, and we will free them when exit.
4895std::vector<char*> utf8_filenames;
4896#include <shellapi.h>
4897// Convert utf-16 encoded string to utf-8 encoded.
4898char* ConvertUtf16StringToUtf8(const wchar_t* str) {
4899 // On Windows wchar_t must be a 16-bit value.
4900 static_assert(sizeof(wchar_t) == 2, "wrong wchar_t size");
4901 int len =
4902 WideCharToMultiByte(CP_UTF8, 0, str, -1, nullptr, 0, nullptr, FALSE);
4903 DCHECK_LT(0, len);
4904 char* utf8_str = new char[len];
4905 utf8_filenames.push_back(utf8_str);
4906 WideCharToMultiByte(CP_UTF8, 0, str, -1, utf8_str, len, nullptr, FALSE);
4907 return utf8_str;
4908}
4909
4910// Convert ansi encoded argv[i] to utf8 encoded.
4911void PreProcessUnicodeFilenameArg(char* argv[], int i) {
4912 int argc;
4913 wchar_t** wargv = CommandLineToArgvW(GetCommandLineW(), &argc);
4914 argv[i] = ConvertUtf16StringToUtf8(wargv[i]);
4915 LocalFree(wargv);
4916}
4917
4918#endif
4919
4920namespace {
4921
4922bool FlagMatches(const char* flag, char** arg, bool keep_flag = false) {
4923 if (strcmp(*arg, flag) == 0) {
4924 if (!keep_flag) {
4925 *arg = nullptr;
4926 }
4927 return true;
4928 }
4929 return false;
4930}
4931
4932template <size_t N>
4933bool FlagWithArgMatches(const char (&flag)[N], char** flag_value, int argc,
4934 char* argv[], int* i) {
4935 char* current_arg = argv[*i];
4936
4937 // Compare the flag up to the last character of the flag name (not including
4938 // the null terminator).
4939 if (strncmp(current_arg, flag, N - 1) == 0) {
4940 // Match against --flag=value
4941 if (current_arg[N - 1] == '=') {
4942 *flag_value = argv[*i] + N;
4943 argv[*i] = nullptr;
4944 return true;
4945 }
4946 // Match against --flag value
4947 if (current_arg[N - 1] == '\0') {
4948 CHECK_LT(*i, argc - 1);
4949 argv[*i] = nullptr;
4950 (*i)++;
4951 *flag_value = argv[*i];
4952 argv[*i] = nullptr;
4953 return true;
4954 }
4955 }
4956
4957 flag_value = nullptr;
4958 return false;
4959}
4960
4961} // namespace

4963bool Shell::SetOptions(int argc, char* argv[]) {
4964 bool logfile_per_isolate = false;
4965 options.d8_path = argv[0];
4966 for (int i = 0; i < argc; i++) {
4967 char* flag_value = nullptr;

4973 }

4975 } else if (FlagMatches("--no-arguments", &argv[i])) {

4983 /*keep_flag=*/true)) {

4995 FlagMatches("--no-test", &argv[i])) {

5076 options.enable_inspector = true;

5078 options.lcov_file = flag_value;
5079#ifdef V8_OS_LINUX

5081 options.scope_linux_perf_to_mark_measure = true;

5083 &i)) {

5085 } else if (FlagWithArgMatches("--perf-ack-fd", &flag_value, argc, argv,
5086 &i)) {

5090 options.disable_in_process_stack_traces = true;

5093 argv, &i)) {
5094 options.read_from_tcp_port = atoi(flag_value);
5095#endif // V8_OS_POSIX
5096 } else if (FlagMatches("--enable-os-system", &argv[i])) {
5097 options.enable_os_system = true;
5098 } else if (FlagMatches("--no-apply-priority", &argv[i])) {
5099 options.apply_priority = false;
5100 } else if (FlagMatches("--quiet-load", &argv[i])) {
5101 options.quiet_load = true;

5121 argv, &i)) {

5131 DCHECK(options.fuzzy_module_file_extensions);

5137 i::v8_flags.enable_etw_stack_walking = true;

5145 // by macos

5153 options.wasm_trap_handler = false;
5154#endif // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
5155 } else if (FlagMatches("--expose-fast-api", &argv[i])) {
5156 options.expose_fast_api = true;
5157 } else {
5158#ifdef V8_TARGET_OS_WIN
5159 PreProcessUnicodeFilenameArg(argv, i);
5160#endif
5161 }
5162 }
5163
5164#ifdef V8_OS_LINUX
5165 if (options.scope_linux_perf_to_mark_measure) {
5166 if (options.perf_ctl_fd == -1 || options.perf_ack_fd == -1) {
5167 fprintf(stderr,
5168 "Flag --scope-linux-perf-to-mark-measure requires both "
5169 "--perf-ctl-fd and --perf-ack-fd\n");
5170 return false;
5171 }
5172 SendPerfControlCommand("disable");
5173 }
5174#endif
5175
5176 const char* usage =
5177 "Synopsis:\n"
5178 " shell [options] [--shell] [<file>...]\n"
5179 " d8 [options] [-e <string>] [--shell] [--module|]"
5180 " <file>...]\n\n"
5181 " -e execute a string in V8\n"
5182 " --shell run an interactive JavaScript shell\n"
5183 " --module execute a file as a JavaScript module\n";
5184 using HelpOptions = i::FlagList::HelpOptions;
5185 i::v8_flags.abort_on_contradictory_flags = true;
5186 i::FlagList::SetFlagsFromCommandLine(&argc, argv, true,
5187 HelpOptions(HelpOptions::kExit, usage));
5188 i::FlagList::ResolveContradictionsWhenFuzzing();
5189
5190 options.mock_arraybuffer_allocator = i::v8_flags.mock_arraybuffer_allocator;
5191 options.mock_arraybuffer_allocator_limit =
5192 i::v8_flags.mock_arraybuffer_allocator_limit;
5193#ifdef V8_OS_LINUX
5194 options.multi_mapped_mock_allocator = i::v8_flags.multi_mapped_mock_allocator;
5195#endif // V8_OS_LINUX
5196
5197 if (i::v8_flags.stress_snapshot && options.expose_fast_api &&
5198 check_d8_flag_contradictions) {
5199 FATAL("Flag --expose-fast-api is incompatible with --stress-snapshot.");
5200 }
5201
5202 // Set up isolated source groups.
5203 options.isolate_sources = new SourceGroup[options.num_isolates];
5204 SourceGroup* current = options.isolate_sources;
5205 current->Begin(argv, 1);
5206 for (int i = 1; i < argc; i++) {
5207 const char* str = argv[i];
5208 if (strcmp(str, "--isolate") == 0) {
5209 current->End(i);
5210 current++;
5211 current->Begin(argv, i + 1);
5212 } else if (strcmp(str, "--module") == 0 || strcmp(str, "--json") == 0) {
5213 // Pass on to SourceGroup, which understands these options.
5214 } else if (strncmp(str, "--", 2) == 0) {
5215 if (!i::v8_flags.correctness_fuzzer_suppressions) {
5216 printf("Warning: unknown flag %s.\nTry --help for options\n", str);
5217 }
5218 } else if (strcmp(str, "-e") == 0 && i + 1 < argc) {
5219 set_script_executed();
5220 } else if (strncmp(str, "-", 1) != 0) {
5221 // Not a flag, so it must be a script to execute.
5222 set_script_executed();
5223 }
5224 }
5225 current->End(argc);
5226
5227 if (!logfile_per_isolate && options.num_isolates) {
5228 V8::SetFlagsFromString("--no-logfile-per-isolate");
5229 }
5230
5231 return true;
5232}
5233
5234int Shell::RunMain(v8::Isolate* isolate, bool last_run) {
5235 i::Isolate* i_isolate = reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(isolate);
5236
5237 for (int i = 1; i < options.num_isolates; ++i) {
5238 options.isolate_sources[i].StartExecuteInThread();
5239 }
5240
5241 // The Context object, created inside RunMainIsolate, is used after the method
5242 // returns in some situations:
5243 const bool keep_context_alive =
5244 last_run && (use_interactive_shell() || i::v8_flags.stress_snapshot);
5245 bool success = RunMainIsolate(isolate, keep_context_alive);
5246 CollectGarbage(isolate);
5247
5248 // Park the main thread here to prevent deadlocks in shared GCs when
5249 // waiting in JoinThread.
5250 i_isolate->main_thread_local_heap()->BlockMainThreadWhileParked(
5251 [last_run](const i::ParkedScope& parked) {
5252 for (int i = 1; i < options.num_isolates; ++i) {
5253 if (last_run) {
5254 options.isolate_sources[i].JoinThread(parked);
5255 } else {
5256 options.isolate_sources[i].WaitForThread(parked);
5257 }
5258 }
5259 WaitForRunningWorkers(parked);
5260 });
5261
5262 // Other threads have terminated, we can now run the artifical
5263 // serialize-deserialize pass (which destructively mutates heap state).
5264 if (success && last_run && i::v8_flags.stress_snapshot) {
5265 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
5266 static constexpr bool kClearRecompilableData = true;
5267 auto context = v8::Local<v8::Context>::New(isolate, evaluation_context_);
5268 i::Handle<i::Context> i_context = Utils::OpenHandle(*context);
5269 // Stop concurrent compiles before mutating the heap.
5270 if (i_isolate->concurrent_recompilation_enabled()) {
5271 i_isolate->optimizing_compile_dispatcher()->Stop();
5272 }
5273#if V8_ENABLE_MAGLEV
5274 if (i_isolate->maglev_concurrent_dispatcher()->is_enabled()) {
5275 i_isolate->maglev_concurrent_dispatcher()->AwaitCompileJobs();
5276 }
5277#endif // V8_ENABLE_MAGLEV
5278 // TODO(jgruber,v8:10500): Don't deoptimize once we support serialization
5279 // of optimized code.
5280 i::Deoptimizer::DeoptimizeAll(i_isolate);
5281 // Trigger GC to better align with production code. Also needed by
5282 // ClearReconstructableDataForSerialization to not look into dead objects.
5283 i_isolate->heap()->CollectAllAvailableGarbage(
5284 i::GarbageCollectionReason::kSnapshotCreator);
5285 i::Snapshot::ClearReconstructableDataForSerialization(
5286 i_isolate, kClearRecompilableData);
5287 i::Snapshot::SerializeDeserializeAndVerifyForTesting(i_isolate, i_context);
5288 }
5289
5290 if (Shell::unhandled_promise_rejections_.load() > 0) {
5291 printf("%i pending unhandled Promise rejection(s) detected.\n",
5292 Shell::unhandled_promise_rejections_.load());
5293 success = false;
5294 // RunMain may be executed multiple times, e.g. in REPRL mode, so we have to
5295 // reset this counter.
5296 Shell::unhandled_promise_rejections_.store(0);
5297 }
5298 // In order to finish successfully, success must be != expected_to_throw.
5299 if (Shell::options.no_fail) return 0;
5300 // Fuzzers aren't expected to use --throws, but may pick it up from testcases.
5301 // In that case, just ignore the flag.
5302 if (i::v8_flags.fuzzing && Shell::options.expected_to_throw) return 0;
5303 return (success == Shell::options.expected_to_throw ? 1 : 0);
5304}
5305
5306bool Shell::RunMainIsolate(v8::Isolate* isolate, bool keep_context_alive) {
5307 if (options.lcov_file) {
5308 debug::Coverage::SelectMode(isolate, debug::CoverageMode::kBlockCount);
5309 }
5310 HandleScope scope(isolate);
5311 Global<Context> global_context;
5312 {
5313 Local<Context> context;
5314 if (!CreateEvaluationContext(isolate).ToLocal(&context)) {
5315 DCHECK(isolate->IsExecutionTerminating());
5316 // We must not exit early here in REPRL mode as that would cause the next
5317 // testcase sent by Fuzzilli to be skipped, which will desynchronize the
5318 // communication between d8 and Fuzzilli, leading to a crash.
5319 DCHECK(!fuzzilli_reprl);
5320 return false;
5321 }
5322 global_context.Reset(isolate, context);
5323 if (keep_context_alive) {
5324 evaluation_context_.Reset(isolate, context);
5325 }
5326 }
5327 PerIsolateData::RealmScope realm_scope(isolate, global_context);
5328 InspectorClient inspector_client(isolate, global_context,
5329 options.enable_inspector);
5330 bool success = true;
5331 {
5332 // We cannot use a Context::Scope here, as it keeps a local handle to the
5333 // context and SourceGroup::Execute may execute a non-nestable task, e.g. a
5334 // stackless GC.
5335 global_context.Get(isolate)->Enter();
5336 if (!options.isolate_sources[0].Execute(isolate)) success = false;
5337 global_context.Get(isolate)->Exit();
5338 }
5339 if (!FinishExecuting(isolate, global_context)) success = false;
5340 WriteLcovData(isolate, options.lcov_file);
5341 return success;
5342}
5343
5344void Shell::CollectGarbage(Isolate* isolate) {
5345 if (options.send_idle_notification) {
5346 isolate->ContextDisposedNotification();
5347 }
5348 if (options.invoke_weak_callbacks) {
5349 // By sending a low memory notifications, we will try hard to collect all
5350 // garbage and will therefore also invoke all weak callbacks of actually
5351 // unreachable persistent handles.
5352 isolate->LowMemoryNotification();
5353 }
5354}
5355
5356void Shell::NotifyStartStreamingTask(Isolate* isolate) {
5357 DCHECK(options.streaming_compile);
5358 base::MutexGuard guard(isolate_status_lock_.Pointer());
5359 ++isolate_running_streaming_tasks_[isolate];
5360}
5361
5362void Shell::NotifyFinishStreamingTask(Isolate* isolate) {
5363 DCHECK(options.streaming_compile);
5364 base::MutexGuard guard(isolate_status_lock_.Pointer());
5365 --isolate_running_streaming_tasks_[isolate];
5366 DCHECK_GE(isolate_running_streaming_tasks_[isolate], 0);
5367}
5368
5369namespace {
5370bool RunSetTimeoutCallback(Isolate* isolate, bool* did_run) {
5371 PerIsolateData* data = PerIsolateData::Get(isolate);
5372 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate);
5373 Local<Function> callback;
5374 if (!data->GetTimeoutCallback().ToLocal(&callback)) return true;
5375 Local<Context> context;
5376 if (!data->GetTimeoutContext().ToLocal(&context)) return true;
5377 TryCatch try_catch(isolate);
5378 try_catch.SetVerbose(true);
5379 Context::Scope context_scope(context);
5380 if (callback->Call(context, Undefined(isolate), 0, nullptr).IsEmpty()) {
5381 return false;
5382 }
5383 *did_run = true;
5384 return true;
5385}
5386
5387bool ProcessMessages(
5388 Isolate* isolate,
5389 const std::function<platform::MessageLoopBehavior()>& behavior) {
5390 while (true) {
5391 i::Isolate* i_isolate = reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(isolate);
5392 i::SaveAndSwitchContext saved_context(i_isolate, i::Context());
5393 SealHandleScope shs(isolate);
5394 for (bool ran_tasks = true; ran_tasks;) {
5395 // Execute one foreground task (if one exists), then microtasks.
5396 if (isolate->IsExecutionTerminating()) return false;
5397 ran_tasks = v8::platform::PumpMessageLoop(g_default_platform, isolate,
5398 behavior());
5399 if (isolate->IsExecutionTerminating()) return false;
5400 if (ran_tasks) MicrotasksScope::PerformCheckpoint(isolate);
5401
5402 // In predictable mode we push all background tasks into the foreground
5403 // task queue of the {kProcessGlobalPredictablePlatformWorkerTaskQueue}
5404 // isolate. We execute all background tasks after running one foreground
5405 // task.
5406 if (i::v8_flags.verify_predictable) {
5407 if (isolate->IsExecutionTerminating()) return false;
5408 while (v8::platform::PumpMessageLoop(
5409 g_default_platform,
5410 kProcessGlobalPredictablePlatformWorkerTaskQueue,
5411 platform::MessageLoopBehavior::kDoNotWait)) {
5412 ran_tasks = true;
5413 if (isolate->IsExecutionTerminating()) return false;
5414 }
5415 }
5416 }
5417 if (g_default_platform->IdleTasksEnabled(isolate)) {
5418 v8::platform::RunIdleTasks(g_default_platform, isolate,
5419 50.0 / base::Time::kMillisecondsPerSecond);
5420 }
5421 if (isolate->IsExecutionTerminating()) return false;
5422 bool ran_set_timeout = false;
5423 if (!RunSetTimeoutCallback(isolate, &ran_set_timeout)) return false;
5424 if (!ran_set_timeout) return true;
5425 }
5426}
5427} // anonymous namespace
5428
5429bool Shell::CompleteMessageLoop(Isolate* isolate) {
5430 auto get_waiting_behaviour = [isolate]() {
5431 base::MutexGuard guard(isolate_status_lock_.Pointer());
5432 bool should_wait = (options.wait_for_background_tasks &&
5433 isolate->HasPendingBackgroundTasks()) ||
5434 isolate_running_streaming_tasks_[isolate] > 0;
5435 return should_wait ? platform::MessageLoopBehavior::kWaitForWork
5436 : platform::MessageLoopBehavior::kDoNotWait;
5437 };
5438 if (i::v8_flags.verify_predictable) {
5439 bool ran_tasks = ProcessMessages(
5440 isolate, [] { return platform::MessageLoopBehavior::kDoNotWait; });
5441 if (get_waiting_behaviour() ==
5442 platform::MessageLoopBehavior::kWaitForWork) {
5443 FATAL(
5444 "There is outstanding work after executing all tasks in predictable "
5445 "mode -- this would deadlock.");
5446 }
5447 return ran_tasks;
5448 }
5449 return ProcessMessages(isolate, get_waiting_behaviour);
5450}
5451
5452bool Shell::FinishExecuting(Isolate* isolate, const Global<Context>& context) {
5453 if (!CompleteMessageLoop(isolate)) return false;
5454 HandleScope scope(isolate);
5455 // We cannot use a Context::Scope here, as it keeps a local handle to the
5456 // context and HandleUnhandledPromiseRejections may execute a non-nestable
5457 // task, e.g. a stackless GC.
5458 context.Get(isolate)->Enter();
5459 bool result = HandleUnhandledPromiseRejections(isolate);
5460 context.Get(isolate)->Exit();
5461 return result;
5462}
5463
5464bool Shell::EmptyMessageQueues(Isolate* isolate) {
5465 return ProcessMessages(
5466 isolate, []() { return platform::MessageLoopBehavior::kDoNotWait; });
5467}
5468
5469bool Shell::HandleUnhandledPromiseRejections(Isolate* isolate) {
5470 if (options.ignore_unhandled_promises) return true;
5471 PerIsolateData* data = PerIsolateData::Get(isolate);
5472 int count = data->HandleUnhandledPromiseRejections();
5473 Shell::unhandled_promise_rejections_.store(
5474 Shell::unhandled_promise_rejections_.load() + count);
5475 return count == 0;
5476}
5477
5478class Serializer : public ValueSerializer::Delegate {
5479 public:
5480 explicit Serializer(Isolate* isolate)
5481 : isolate_(isolate),
5482 serializer_(isolate, this),
5483 current_memory_usage_(0) {}
5484
5485 Serializer(const Serializer&) = delete;
5486 Serializer& operator=(const Serializer&) = delete;
5487
5488 Maybe<bool> WriteValue(Local<Context> context, Local<Value> value,
5489 Local<Value> transfer) {
5490 bool ok;
5491 DCHECK(!data_);
5492 data_.reset(new SerializationData);
5493 if (!PrepareTransfer(context, transfer).To(&ok)) {
5494 return Nothing<bool>();
5495 }
5496 serializer_.WriteHeader();
5497
5498 if (!serializer_.WriteValue(context, value).To(&ok)) {
5499 data_.reset();
5500 return Nothing<bool>();
5501 }
5502
5503 if (!FinalizeTransfer().To(&ok)) {
5504 return Nothing<bool>();
5505 }
5506
5507 std::pair<uint8_t*, size_t> pair = serializer_.Release();
5508 data_->data_.reset(pair.first);
5509 data_->size_ = pair.second;
5510 return Just(true);
5511 }
5512
5513 std::unique_ptr<SerializationData> Release() { return std::move(data_); }
5514
5515 void AppendBackingStoresTo(std::vector<std::shared_ptr<BackingStore>>* to) {
5516 to->insert(to->end(), std::make_move_iterator(backing_stores_.begin()),
5517 std::make_move_iterator(backing_stores_.end()));
5518 backing_stores_.clear();
5519 }
5520
5521 protected:
5522 // Implements ValueSerializer::Delegate.
5523 void ThrowDataCloneError(Local<String> message) override {
5524 isolate_->ThrowException(Exception::Error(message));
5525 }
5526
5527 Maybe<uint32_t> GetSharedArrayBufferId(
5528 Isolate* isolate, Local<SharedArrayBuffer> shared_array_buffer) override {
5529 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(data_);
5530 for (size_t index = 0; index < shared_array_buffers_.size(); ++index) {
5531 if (shared_array_buffers_[index] == shared_array_buffer) {
5532 return Just<uint32_t>(static_cast<uint32_t>(index));
5533 }
5534 }
5535
5536 size_t index = shared_array_buffers_.size();
5537 shared_array_buffers_.emplace_back(isolate_, shared_array_buffer);
5538 data_->sab_backing_stores_.push_back(
5539 shared_array_buffer->GetBackingStore());
5540 return Just<uint32_t>(static_cast<uint32_t>(index));
5541 }
5542
5543 Maybe<uint32_t> GetWasmModuleTransferId(
5544 Isolate* isolate, Local<WasmModuleObject> module) override {
5545 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(data_);
5546 for (size_t index = 0; index < wasm_modules_.size(); ++index) {
5547 if (wasm_modules_[index] == module) {
5548 return Just<uint32_t>(static_cast<uint32_t>(index));
5549 }
5550 }
5551
5552 size_t index = wasm_modules_.size();
5553 wasm_modules_.emplace_back(isolate_, module);
5554 data_->compiled_wasm_modules_.push_back(module->GetCompiledModule());
5555 return Just<uint32_t>(static_cast<uint32_t>(index));
5556 }
5557
5558 void* ReallocateBufferMemory(void* old_buffer, size_t size,
5559 size_t* actual_size) override {
5560 // Not accurate, because we don't take into account reallocated buffers,
5561 // but this is fine for testing.
5562 current_memory_usage_ += size;
5563 if (current_memory_usage_ > Shell::options.max_serializer_memory) {
5564 return nullptr;
5565 }
5566
5567 void* result = base::Realloc(old_buffer, size);
5568 *actual_size = result ? size : 0;
5569 return result;
5570 }
5571
5572 void FreeBufferMemory(void* buffer) override { base::Free(buffer); }
5573
5574 bool AdoptSharedValueConveyor(Isolate* isolate,
5575 SharedValueConveyor&& conveyor) override {
5576 data_->shared_value_conveyor_.emplace(std::move(conveyor));
5577 return true;
5578 }
5579
5580 private:
5581 Maybe<bool> PrepareTransfer(Local<Context> context, Local<Value> transfer) {
5582 if (transfer->IsArray()) {
5583 Local<Array> transfer_array = transfer.As<Array>();
5584 uint32_t length = transfer_array->Length();
5585 for (uint32_t i = 0; i < length; ++i) {
5586 Local<Value> element;
5587 if (transfer_array->Get(context, i).ToLocal(&element)) {
5588 if (!element->IsArrayBuffer()) {
5589 isolate_->ThrowError(
5590 "Transfer array elements must be an ArrayBuffer");
5591 return Nothing<bool>();
5592 }
5593
5594 Local<ArrayBuffer> array_buffer = element.As<ArrayBuffer>();
5595
5596 if (std::find(array_buffers_.begin(), array_buffers_.end(),
5597 array_buffer) != array_buffers_.end()) {
5598 isolate_->ThrowError(
5599 "ArrayBuffer occurs in the transfer array more than once");
5600 return Nothing<bool>();
5601 }
5602
5603 serializer_.TransferArrayBuffer(
5604 static_cast<uint32_t>(array_buffers_.size()), array_buffer);
5605 array_buffers_.emplace_back(isolate_, array_buffer);
5606 } else {
5607 return Nothing<bool>();
5608 }
5609 }
5610 return Just(true);
5611 } else if (transfer->IsUndefined()) {
5612 return Just(true);
5613 } else {
5614 isolate_->ThrowError("Transfer list must be an Array or undefined");
5615 return Nothing<bool>();
5616 }
5617 }
5618
5619 Maybe<bool> FinalizeTransfer() {
5620 for (const auto& global_array_buffer : array_buffers_) {
5621 Local<ArrayBuffer> array_buffer =
5622 Local<ArrayBuffer>::New(isolate_, global_array_buffer);
5623 if (!array_buffer->IsDetachable()) {
5624 isolate_->ThrowError(
5625 "ArrayBuffer is not detachable and could not be transferred");
5626 return Nothing<bool>();
5627 }
5628
5629 auto backing_store = array_buffer->GetBackingStore();
5630 data_->backing_stores_.push_back(std::move(backing_store));
5631 if (array_buffer->Detach(v8::Local<v8::Value>()).IsNothing()) {
5632 return Nothing<bool>();
5633 }
5634 }
5635
5636 return Just(true);
5637 }
5638
5639 // This must come before ValueSerializer as it caches this value.
5640 Isolate* isolate_;
5641 ValueSerializer serializer_;
5642 std::unique_ptr<SerializationData> data_;
5643 std::vector<Global<ArrayBuffer>> array_buffers_;
5644 std::vector<Global<SharedArrayBuffer>> shared_array_buffers_;
5645 std::vector<Global<WasmModuleObject>> wasm_modules_;
5646 std::vector<std::shared_ptr<v8::BackingStore>> backing_stores_;
5647 size_t current_memory_usage_;
5648};
5649
5650class Deserializer : public ValueDeserializer::Delegate {
5651 public:
5652 Deserializer(Isolate* isolate, std::unique_ptr<SerializationData> data)
5653 : isolate_(isolate),
5654 deserializer_(isolate, data->data(), data->size(), this),
5655 data_(std::move(data)) {
5656 deserializer_.SetSupportsLegacyWireFormat(true);
5657 }
5658
5659 Deserializer(const Deserializer&) = delete;
5660 Deserializer& operator=(const Deserializer&) = delete;
5661
5662 MaybeLocal<Value> ReadValue(Local<Context> context) {
5663 bool read_header;
5664 if (!deserializer_.ReadHeader(context).To(&read_header)) {
5665 return MaybeLocal<Value>();
5666 }
5667
5668 uint32_t index = 0;
5669 for (const auto& backing_store : data_->backing_stores()) {
5670 Local<ArrayBuffer> array_buffer =
5671 ArrayBuffer::New(isolate_, std::move(backing_store));
5672 deserializer_.TransferArrayBuffer(index++, array_buffer);
5673 }
5674
5675 return deserializer_.ReadValue(context);
5676 }
5677
5678 MaybeLocal<SharedArrayBuffer> GetSharedArrayBufferFromId(
5679 Isolate* isolate, uint32_t clone_id) override {
5680 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(data_);
5681 if (clone_id < data_->sab_backing_stores().size()) {
5682 return SharedArrayBuffer::New(
5683 isolate_, std::move(data_->sab_backing_stores().at(clone_id)));
5684 }
5685 return MaybeLocal<SharedArrayBuffer>();
5686 }
5687
5688 MaybeLocal<WasmModuleObject> GetWasmModuleFromId(
5689 Isolate* isolate, uint32_t transfer_id) override {
5690 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(data_);
5691 if (transfer_id >= data_->compiled_wasm_modules().size()) return {};
5692 return WasmModuleObject::FromCompiledModule(
5693 isolate_, data_->compiled_wasm_modules().at(transfer_id));
5694 }
5695
5696 const SharedValueConveyor* GetSharedValueConveyor(Isolate* isolate) override {
5697 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(data_);
5698 if (data_->shared_value_conveyor()) {
5699 return &data_->shared_value_conveyor().value();
5700 }
5701 return nullptr;
5702 }
5703
5704 private:
5705 Isolate* isolate_;
5706 ValueDeserializer deserializer_;
5707 std::unique_ptr<SerializationData> data_;
5708};
5709
5710class D8Testing {
5711 public:
5716 static int GetStressRuns() {
5717 if (i::v8_flags.stress_runs != 0) return i::v8_flags.stress_runs;
5718#ifdef DEBUG
5719 // In debug mode the code runs much slower so stressing will only make two
5720 // runs.
5721 return 2;
5722#else
5723 return 5;
5724#endif
5725 }
5726
5730 static void DeoptimizeAll(Isolate* isolate) {
5731 i::Isolate* i_isolate = reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(isolate);
5732 i::HandleScope scope(i_isolate);
5733 i::Deoptimizer::DeoptimizeAll(i_isolate);
5734 }
5735};
5736
5737std::unique_ptr<SerializationData> Shell::SerializeValue(
5738 Isolate* isolate, Local<Value> value, Local<Value> transfer) {
5739 bool ok;
5740 Local<Context> context = isolate->GetCurrentContext();
5741 Serializer serializer(isolate);
5742 std::unique_ptr<SerializationData> data;
5743 if (serializer.WriteValue(context, value, transfer).To(&ok)) {
5744 data = serializer.Release();
5745 }
5746 return data;
5747}
5748
5749MaybeLocal<Value> Shell::DeserializeValue(
5750 Isolate* isolate, std::unique_ptr<SerializationData> data) {
5751 Local<Context> context = isolate->GetCurrentContext();
5752 Deserializer deserializer(isolate, std::move(data));
5753 return deserializer.ReadValue(context);
5754}
5755
5756void Shell::AddRunningWorker(std::shared_ptr<Worker> worker) {
5757 workers_mutex_.Pointer()->AssertHeld(); // caller should hold the mutex.
5758 running_workers_.insert(worker);
5759}
5760
5761void Shell::RemoveRunningWorker(const std::shared_ptr<Worker>& worker) {
5762 base::MutexGuard lock_guard(workers_mutex_.Pointer());
5763 auto it = running_workers_.find(worker);
5764 if (it != running_workers_.end()) running_workers_.erase(it);
5765}
5766
5767void Shell::WaitForRunningWorkers(const i::ParkedScope& parked) {
5768 // Make a copy of running_workers_, because we don't want to call
5769 // Worker::Terminate while holding the workers_mutex_ lock. Otherwise, if a
5770 // worker is about to create a new Worker, it would deadlock.
5771 std::unordered_set<std::shared_ptr<Worker>> workers_copy;
5772 {
5773 base::MutexGuard lock_guard(workers_mutex_.Pointer());
5774 allow_new_workers_ = false;
5775 workers_copy.swap(running_workers_);
5776 }
5777
5778 for (auto& worker : workers_copy) {
5779 worker->TerminateAndWaitForThread(parked);
5780 }
5781
5782 // Now that all workers are terminated, we can re-enable Worker creation.
5783 base::MutexGuard lock_guard(workers_mutex_.Pointer());
5784 DCHECK(running_workers_.empty());
5785 allow_new_workers_ = true;
5786}
5787
5788namespace {
5789
5790#ifdef V8_OS_POSIX
5791void d8_sigterm_handler(int signal, siginfo_t* info, void* context) {
5792 // Dump stacktraces when terminating d8 instances with SIGTERM.
5793 // SIGKILL is not intercepted.
5794 if (signal == SIGTERM) {
5795 FATAL("d8: Received SIGTERM signal (likely due to a TIMEOUT)\n");
5796 } else {
5797 UNREACHABLE();
5798 }
5799}
5800#endif // V8_OS_POSIX
5801
5802void d8_install_sigterm_handler() {
5803#ifdef V8_OS_POSIX
5804 CHECK(!i::v8_flags.fuzzing);
5805 struct sigaction sa;
5806 sa.sa_sigaction = d8_sigterm_handler;
5807 sigemptyset(&sa.sa_mask);
5808 sa.sa_flags = 0;
5809 if (sigaction(SIGTERM, &sa, NULL) == -1) {
5810 FATAL("Could not install SIGTERM handler");
5811 }
5812#endif // V8_OS_POSIX
5813}
5814
5815} // namespace
5816
5817int Shell::Main(int argc, char* argv[]) {
5818 v8::base::EnsureConsoleOutput();
5819 if (!SetOptions(argc, argv)) return 1;
5820 if (!i::v8_flags.fuzzing) d8_install_sigterm_handler();
5821
5822 v8::V8::InitializeICUDefaultLocation(argv[0], options.icu_data_file);
5823
5824#ifdef V8_OS_DARWIN
5825 if (options.apply_priority) {
5826 struct task_category_policy category = {.role =
5827 TASK_FOREGROUND_APPLICATION};
5828 task_policy_set(mach_task_self(), TASK_CATEGORY_POLICY,
5829 (task_policy_t)&category, TASK_CATEGORY_POLICY_COUNT);
5830 pthread_set_qos_class_self_np(QOS_CLASS_USER_INTERACTIVE, 0);
5831 }
5832#endif
5833
5834#ifdef V8_INTL_SUPPORT
5835 if (options.icu_locale != nullptr) {
5836 icu::Locale locale(options.icu_locale);
5837 UErrorCode error_code = U_ZERO_ERROR;
5838 icu::Locale::setDefault(locale, error_code);
5839 }
5840#endif // V8_INTL_SUPPORT
5841
5842 v8::platform::InProcessStackDumping in_process_stack_dumping =
5843 options.disable_in_process_stack_traces
5844 ? v8::platform::InProcessStackDumping::kDisabled
5845 : v8::platform::InProcessStackDumping::kEnabled;
5846
5847 std::ofstream trace_file;
5848 std::unique_ptr<platform::tracing::TracingController> tracing;
5849 if (options.trace_enabled && !i::v8_flags.verify_predictable) {
5850 tracing = std::make_unique<platform::tracing::TracingController>();
5851
5852 if (!options.enable_etw_stack_walking) {
5853 const char* trace_path =
5854 options.trace_path ? options.trace_path : "v8_trace.json";
5855 trace_file.open(trace_path);
5856 if (!trace_file.good()) {
5857 printf("Cannot open trace file '%s' for writing: %s.\n", trace_path,
5858 strerror(errno));
5859 return 1;
5860 }
5861 }
5862
5863#ifdef V8_USE_PERFETTO
5864 // Set up the in-process backend that the tracing controller will connect
5865 // to.
5866 perfetto::TracingInitArgs init_args;
5867 init_args.backends = perfetto::BackendType::kInProcessBackend;
5868 perfetto::Tracing::Initialize(init_args);
5869
5870 tracing->InitializeForPerfetto(&trace_file);
5871#else
5872 platform::tracing::TraceBuffer* trace_buffer = nullptr;
5873#if defined(V8_ENABLE_SYSTEM_INSTRUMENTATION)
5874 if (options.enable_system_instrumentation) {
5875 trace_buffer =
5876 platform::tracing::TraceBuffer::CreateTraceBufferRingBuffer(
5877 platform::tracing::TraceBuffer::kRingBufferChunks,
5878 platform::tracing::TraceWriter::
5879 CreateSystemInstrumentationTraceWriter());
5880 }
5881#endif // V8_ENABLE_SYSTEM_INSTRUMENTATION
5882 if (!trace_buffer) {
5883 trace_buffer =
5884 platform::tracing::TraceBuffer::CreateTraceBufferRingBuffer(
5885 platform::tracing::TraceBuffer::kRingBufferChunks,
5886 platform::tracing::TraceWriter::CreateJSONTraceWriter(
5887 trace_file));
5888 }
5889 tracing->Initialize(trace_buffer);
5890#endif // V8_USE_PERFETTO
5891 }
5892
5893 platform::tracing::TracingController* tracing_controller = tracing.get();
5894 if (i::v8_flags.single_threaded) {
5895 g_platform = v8::platform::NewSingleThreadedDefaultPlatform(
5896 v8::platform::IdleTaskSupport::kEnabled, in_process_stack_dumping,
5897 std::move(tracing));
5898 } else {
5899 g_platform = v8::platform::NewDefaultPlatform(
5900 options.thread_pool_size, v8::platform::IdleTaskSupport::kEnabled,
5901 in_process_stack_dumping, std::move(tracing),
5902 options.apply_priority ? v8::platform::PriorityMode::kApply
5903 : v8::platform::PriorityMode::kDontApply);
5904 }
5905 g_default_platform = g_platform.get();
5906 if (i::v8_flags.predictable) {
5907 g_platform = MakePredictablePlatform(std::move(g_platform));
5908 }
5909 if (options.stress_delay_tasks) {
5910 int64_t random_seed = i::v8_flags.fuzzer_random_seed;
5911 if (!random_seed) random_seed = i::v8_flags.random_seed;
5912 // If random_seed is still 0 here, the {DelayedTasksPlatform} will choose a
5913 // random seed.
5914 g_platform = MakeDelayedTasksPlatform(std::move(g_platform), random_seed);
5915 }
5916
5917 if (i::v8_flags.trace_turbo_cfg_file == nullptr) {
5918 V8::SetFlagsFromString("--trace-turbo-cfg-file=turbo.cfg");
5919 }
5920 if (i::v8_flags.redirect_code_traces_to == nullptr) {
5921 V8::SetFlagsFromString("--redirect-code-traces-to=code.asm");
5922 }
5923 v8::V8::InitializePlatform(g_platform.get());
5924
5925 // Disable flag freezing if we are producing a code cache, because for that we
5926 // modify v8_flags.hash_seed (below).
5927 if (options.code_cache_options != ShellOptions::kNoProduceCache) {
5928 i::v8_flags.freeze_flags_after_init = false;
5929 }
5930
5931 v8::V8::Initialize();
5932 if (options.snapshot_blob) {
5933 v8::V8::InitializeExternalStartupDataFromFile(options.snapshot_blob);
5934 } else {
5935 v8::V8::InitializeExternalStartupData(argv[0]);
5936 }
5937 int result = 0;
5938 Isolate::CreateParams create_params;
5939 ShellArrayBufferAllocator shell_array_buffer_allocator;
5940 MockArrayBufferAllocator mock_arraybuffer_allocator;
5941 const size_t memory_limit =
5942 options.mock_arraybuffer_allocator_limit * options.num_isolates;
5943 MockArrayBufferAllocatiorWithLimit mock_arraybuffer_allocator_with_limit(
5944 memory_limit >= options.mock_arraybuffer_allocator_limit
5945 ? memory_limit
5946 : std::numeric_limits<size_t>::max());
5947#ifdef V8_OS_LINUX
5948 MultiMappedAllocator multi_mapped_mock_allocator;
5949#endif // V8_OS_LINUX
5950 if (options.mock_arraybuffer_allocator) {
5951 if (memory_limit) {
5952 Shell::array_buffer_allocator = &mock_arraybuffer_allocator_with_limit;
5953 } else {
5954 Shell::array_buffer_allocator = &mock_arraybuffer_allocator;
5955 }
5956#ifdef V8_OS_LINUX
5957 } else if (options.multi_mapped_mock_allocator) {
5958 Shell::array_buffer_allocator = &multi_mapped_mock_allocator;
5959#endif // V8_OS_LINUX
5960 } else {
5961 Shell::array_buffer_allocator = &shell_array_buffer_allocator;
5962 }
5963 create_params.array_buffer_allocator = Shell::array_buffer_allocator;
5964#ifdef ENABLE_VTUNE_JIT_INTERFACE
5965 if (i::v8_flags.enable_vtunejit) {
5966 create_params.code_event_handler = vTune::GetVtuneCodeEventHandler();
5967 }
5968#endif // ENABLE_VTUNE_JIT_INTERFACE
5969 create_params.constraints.ConfigureDefaults(
5970 base::SysInfo::AmountOfPhysicalMemory(),
5971 base::SysInfo::AmountOfVirtualMemory());
5972
5973 Shell::counter_map_ = new CounterMap();
5974 if (options.dump_counters || options.dump_counters_nvp ||
5975 i::TracingFlags::is_gc_stats_enabled()) {
5976 create_params.counter_lookup_callback = LookupCounter;
5977 create_params.create_histogram_callback = CreateHistogram;
5978 create_params.add_histogram_sample_callback = AddHistogramSample;
5979 }
5980
5981#ifdef V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
5982 // Enable sandbox testing mode if requested.
5983 //
5984 // This will install the sandbox crash filter to ignore all crashes that do
5985 // not represent sandbox violations.
5986 //
5987 // Note: this must happen before the Wasm trap handler is installed, so that
5988 // the wasm trap handler is invoked first (and can handle Wasm OOB accesses),
5989 // then forwards all "real" crashes to the sandbox crash filter.
5990 if (i::v8_flags.sandbox_testing || i::v8_flags.sandbox_fuzzing) {
5991 i::SandboxTesting::Mode mode = i::v8_flags.sandbox_testing
5992 ? i::SandboxTesting::Mode::kForTesting
5993 : i::SandboxTesting::Mode::kForFuzzing;
5994 i::SandboxTesting::Enable(mode);
5995 }
5996#endif // V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
5997
5998#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
5999 if (V8_TRAP_HANDLER_SUPPORTED && options.wasm_trap_handler) {
6000 constexpr bool kUseDefaultTrapHandler = true;
6001 if (!v8::V8::EnableWebAssemblyTrapHandler(kUseDefaultTrapHandler)) {
6002 FATAL("Could not register trap handler");
6003 }
6004 }
6005#endif // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
6006
6007 if (i::v8_flags.experimental) {
6008 // This message is printed to stderr so that it is also visible in
6009 // Clusterfuzz reports.
6010 fprintf(stderr,
6011 "V8 is running with experimental features enabled. Stability and "
6012 "security will suffer.\n");
6013 }
6014
6015 Isolate* isolate = Isolate::New(create_params);
6016
6017#ifdef V8_FUZZILLI
6018 // Let the parent process (Fuzzilli) know we are ready.
6019 if (options.fuzzilli_enable_builtins_coverage) {
6020 cov_init_builtins_edges(static_cast<uint32_t>(
6021 i::BasicBlockProfiler::Get()
6022 ->GetCoverageBitmap(reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(isolate))
6023 .size()));
6024 }
6025 char helo[] = "HELO";
6026 if (write(REPRL_CWFD, helo, 4) != 4 || read(REPRL_CRFD, helo, 4) != 4) {
6027 fuzzilli_reprl = false;
6028 }
6029
6030 if (memcmp(helo, "HELO", 4) != 0) {
6031 FATAL("REPRL: Invalid response from parent");
6032 }
6033#endif // V8_FUZZILLI
6034
6035 {
6036 Isolate::Scope scope(isolate);
6037 D8Console console(isolate);
6038 Initialize(isolate, &console);
6039 PerIsolateData data(isolate);
6040
6041 // Fuzzilli REPRL = read-eval-print-loop
6042 do {
6043#ifdef V8_FUZZILLI
6044 if (fuzzilli_reprl) {
6045 unsigned action = 0;
6046 ssize_t nread = read(REPRL_CRFD, &action, 4);
6047 if (nread != 4 || action != 'cexe') {
6048 FATAL("REPRL: Unknown action: %u", action);
6049 }
6050 }
6051#endif // V8_FUZZILLI
6052
6053 result = 0;
6054
6055 if (options.trace_enabled) {
6056 platform::tracing::TraceConfig* trace_config;
6057 if (options.trace_config) {
6058 int size = 0;
6059 char* trace_config_json_str = ReadChars(options.trace_config, &size);
6060 trace_config = tracing::CreateTraceConfigFromJSON(
6061 isolate, trace_config_json_str);
6062 delete[] trace_config_json_str;
6063 } else {
6064 trace_config =
6065 platform::tracing::TraceConfig::CreateDefaultTraceConfig();
6066 if (options.enable_system_instrumentation) {
6067 trace_config->AddIncludedCategory("disabled-by-default-v8.compile");
6068 }
6069 }
6070 tracing_controller->StartTracing(trace_config);
6071 }
6072
6073 CpuProfiler* cpu_profiler;
6074 if (options.cpu_profiler) {
6075 cpu_profiler = CpuProfiler::New(isolate);
6076 cpu_profiler->StartProfiling(String::Empty(isolate),
6077 CpuProfilingOptions{});
6078 }
6079
6080 if (i::v8_flags.stress_runs > 0) {
6081 options.stress_runs = i::v8_flags.stress_runs;
6082 for (int i = 0; i < options.stress_runs && result == 0; i++) {
6083 printf("============ Run %d/%d ============\n", i + 1,
6084 options.stress_runs.get());
6085 bool last_run = i == options.stress_runs - 1;
6086 result = RunMain(isolate, last_run);
6087 }
6088 } else if (options.code_cache_options != ShellOptions::kNoProduceCache) {
6089 // Park the main thread here in case the new isolate wants to perform
6090 // a shared GC to prevent a deadlock.
6091 reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(isolate)
6092 ->main_thread_local_isolate()
6093 ->BlockMainThreadWhileParked([&result]() {
6094 printf("============ Run: Produce code cache ============\n");
6095 // First run to produce the cache
6096 Isolate::CreateParams create_params2;
6097 create_params2.array_buffer_allocator =
6098 Shell::array_buffer_allocator;
6099 // Use a different hash seed.
6100 i::v8_flags.hash_seed = i::v8_flags.hash_seed ^ 1337;
6101 Isolate* isolate2 = Isolate::New(create_params2);
6102 // Restore old hash seed.
6103 i::v8_flags.hash_seed = i::v8_flags.hash_seed ^ 1337;
6104 {
6105 Isolate::Scope isolate_scope(isolate2);
6106 D8Console console2(isolate2);
6107 Initialize(isolate2, &console2);
6108 PerIsolateData data2(isolate2);
6109
6110 result = RunMain(isolate2, false);
6111 ResetOnProfileEndListener(isolate2);
6112 }
6113 // D8WasmAsyncResolvePromiseTask may be still in the runner at
6114 // this point. We need to terminate the task runners before the
6115 // Isolate to avoid retaining stray tasks with v8::Global pointing
6116 // into a reclaimed Isolate.
6117 platform::NotifyIsolateShutdown(g_default_platform, isolate2);
6118 isolate2->Dispose();
6119 });
6120
6121 // Change the options to consume cache
6122 DCHECK(options.compile_options == v8::ScriptCompiler::kEagerCompile ||
6123 options.compile_options ==
6124 v8::ScriptCompiler::kNoCompileOptions);
6125 options.compile_options.Overwrite(
6126 v8::ScriptCompiler::kConsumeCodeCache);
6127 options.code_cache_options.Overwrite(ShellOptions::kNoProduceCache);
6128
6129 printf("============ Run: Consume code cache ============\n");
6130 // Second run to consume the cache in current isolate
6131 result = RunMain(isolate, true);
6132 options.compile_options.Overwrite(
6133 v8::ScriptCompiler::kNoCompileOptions);
6134 } else {
6135 bool last_run = true;
6136 result = RunMain(isolate, last_run);
6137 }
6138
6139 // Run interactive shell if explicitly requested or if no script has been
6140 // executed, but never on --test
6141 if (use_interactive_shell()) {
6142 RunShell(isolate);
6143 }
6144
6145 if (i::v8_flags.trace_ignition_dispatches_output_file != nullptr) {
6146 WriteIgnitionDispatchCountersFile(isolate);
6147 }
6148
6149 if (options.cpu_profiler) {
6150 CpuProfile* profile =
6151 cpu_profiler->StopProfiling(String::Empty(isolate));
6152 if (options.cpu_profiler_print) {
6153 const internal::ProfileNode* root =
6154 reinterpret_cast<const internal::ProfileNode*>(
6155 profile->GetTopDownRoot());
6156 root->Print(0);
6157 }
6158 profile->Delete();
6159 cpu_profiler->Dispose();
6160 }
6161
6162#ifdef V8_FUZZILLI
6163 // Send result to parent (fuzzilli) and reset edge guards.
6164 if (fuzzilli_reprl) {
6165 int status = result << 8;
6166 std::vector<bool> bitmap;
6167 if (options.fuzzilli_enable_builtins_coverage) {
6168 bitmap = i::BasicBlockProfiler::Get()->GetCoverageBitmap(
6169 reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(isolate));
6170 cov_update_builtins_basic_block_coverage(bitmap);
6171 }
6172 if (options.fuzzilli_coverage_statistics) {
6173 int tot = 0;
6174 for (bool b : bitmap) {
6175 if (b) tot++;
6176 }
6177 static int iteration_counter = 0;
6178 std::ofstream covlog("covlog.txt", std::ios::app);
6179 covlog << iteration_counter << "\t" << tot << "\t"
6180 << sanitizer_cov_count_discovered_edges() << "\t"
6181 << bitmap.size() << std::endl;
6182 iteration_counter++;
6183 }
6184 // In REPRL mode, stdout and stderr can be regular files, so they need
6185 // to be flushed after every execution
6186 fflush(stdout);
6187 fflush(stderr);
6188 CHECK_EQ(write(REPRL_CWFD, &status, 4), 4);
6189 sanitizer_cov_reset_edgeguards();
6190 if (options.fuzzilli_enable_builtins_coverage) {
6191 i::BasicBlockProfiler::Get()->ResetCounts(
6192 reinterpret_cast<i::Isolate*>(isolate));
6193 }
6194 }
6195#endif // V8_FUZZILLI
6196 } while (fuzzilli_reprl);
6197
6198 // Shut down contexts and collect garbage.
6199 cached_code_map_.clear();
6200 evaluation_context_.Reset();
6201 stringify_function_.Reset();
6202 ResetOnProfileEndListener(isolate);
6203 CollectGarbage(isolate);
6204 }
6205 OnExit(isolate, true);
6206
6207 // Delete the platform explicitly here to write the tracing output to the
6208 // tracing file.
6209 if (options.trace_enabled) {
6210 tracing_controller->StopTracing();
6211 }
6212 g_platform.reset();
6213
6214#ifdef V8_TARGET_OS_WIN
6215 // We need to free the allocated utf8 filenames in
6216 // PreProcessUnicodeFilenameArg.
6217 for (char* utf8_str : utf8_filenames) {
6218 delete[] utf8_str;
6219 }
6220 utf8_filenames.clear();
6221#endif
6222
6223 return result;
6224}
6225
6226} // namespace v8
6227
6228int main(int argc, char* argv[]) { return v8::Shell::Main(argc, argv); }
